Reviews.Title: “Stag do tastic”
Reviews.Author: Japeski
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend at the Park Inn on a stag do from the UK. Overall a great hotel for this type of trip, close to transport, restaurants, fast food and bars. The rooms are clean a modern and the comfortable. The shower issue reported by others is true, as long as you are comfortable with the other person its not an issue. Couple of pros/cons: Views are great Lifts are fast Staff are friendly and speak English No wi-fi in rooms Bar is expensive

Reviews.Title: “berlin city break”
Reviews.Author: gmaria25
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Berlin, We chose this hotel because it was located close to the railway station offering good conections for public transport and ease of access to sites and attractions. The standard of food in the hotel's restaurant was excellent. The lounge bar very inviting with evening entertainment.We booked breakfast which was alright. Not too impressed with it Big disappointment there was no toast/toaster on offer The rooms were very modern and comfortable. The shower situation although not ideal was not an issue. We would recommend this hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: Jorge1972
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, and most of all, well located. The bathroom issue discussed by many visitors is real. If you're travelling as a couple, there should be no problem. But if the situation is different, it could be complicated by this detail. For the rest, I will insist: great big hotel, close to everything, reasonably priced. Will surely return!

Reviews.Title: “Very conveniënt hotel for stedentrip”
Reviews.Author: nicolasHolland
Reviews.Content: We selected thuis hotel based on location, easy of travel from Tegel-airport > not necessarely in this sequence though. Together with the Berlin Welcome Card and 2-day valid City Circle hop-on-off bus we had a convenient basis for our 4-nicht stay. When tired for dining out the evening, then hotel offers very price attractive and good menu's à la carte or by buffet. All needed (airport-)busses, trams, underground and regional trains are within 100 mtrs.. Next time for us again there!

Reviews.Title: “lovely room, great views, fab location but.....”
Reviews.Author: PeteGLondon
Reviews.Content: don't eat here whatever you do.... unless you have a penchant for bland hotel food from the 1980s.

Reviews.Title: “Great S-Bahn connections for Schönefeld Airport and for city.”
Reviews.Author: bosha_22
Reviews.Content: Great location for adventuring the city. The Spago's bar is actually great for a drink or two after a day museum visiting! Relax on the couches in there. Small rooms - but you get what you pay for. The 'colour' rooms are bigger but have no windows.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back”
Reviews.Author: Marie S
Reviews.Content: Great location, direct train to the airport. Rooms clean and suitable for a city break. Yes there not the biggest but its a central city hotel, the size is more than fine. I would stay here again, good clean hotel. Also no chance of losing it, as its so big!! We found there was some noise from the square, but not enough to worry about. Breakfast was good - but very busy. Always good choice of food on offer.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Mererid
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel when travelling with a friend who had not visite Berlin before because of its easy access to and from Schonfeld airport and its closeness to major attractions. The staff are very friendly and and a nice touch was the request to a queue at reception to "wait for the next smile". Our rooms were described as "small single room". One was on the 34th and one the 35thfloor, and both had superb views over the city and the Tiergarten. They were not excessively small - about the size of the third bedroom in a 3 bed semi. The TV had 5 English channels, there was a safe, but no tea/coffee making facilities although these may have been available to borrow. The airconditioning and heating were easy to use. The bed was comfortable for sleeping, but the drawback was that it was impossible to sit up and read in bed for long, because there was no headboard and the bed was midway between two walls neither of which was suitable to be used as a headboard even if the bed was pushed up to it. Also the only light switch was by the door and flex of the reading lamp on the desk did not reach the bed, so one had to get out of bed to switch the light on or off. The hotel is very secure. Guests had to use their swipe cards to activate the lift before pressing the floor button, and some rooms - our inlcuded had an "ante door" that had to be swiped before reaching the room door. There are several restaurants in the hotel and prices vary. But there are many snack and light meal outlets in the adjacent shopping area including Burger King. There is a charge for WiFi, laptops can be rented, and bathrobes and slippers can be borrowed - not sure if there's a charge. We apid by debit card in sterling - 3 nights room only was £204 each.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: hywandrew
Reviews.Content: The previous reviewer to this says '...in a remote residential neighbourhood...' What a bizzarre comment. The number one advantage of this hotel is the location, right in the middle of Alexander Platz, there is an underground station within 50yards of the entrance/exit and The Overground within 100 yds. There are at least 5-6 taxis outside at any given time. The Brandenburg Gate, Reichstag, Spree Island, TV Tower, Berlin Dom,and other numerous other landmarks /museums/attractions are all within walking distance. The hotel is huge and extremely busy. It is a mix of business and tourist visitors whilslt we were there I think there was a different business conference every day and numerous coach tours of tourists. This can as we observed lead to a busy reception desk. However apart from the wait the reception staff were, courteous, professional and helpful. For people with a late departure there is a luggage room to store cases. The bar restaurant area downstairs is sophisticated with a resident piano player/singer who is very entertaining. Prices are on the top side of expensive here. The rooms themselves are on the small side but are pleasantly furnished. There is a desk, separate WC , shower and sink.Some find this a little disconcerting and their comments are well documented on here it was a none issue for me. There is a curtain to divide the sleeping area from the shower area for the ones who crave a little privacy. Beds are comfortable and linens of a decent quality, however only one pillow is a big drawback for me, towels a little on the small side. The big drawback to this hotel for me is noise. It is a building obviously cheaply built and as such noise travels very easily, people in adjoining rooms could be heard crystal clear even when not being particularly raucous and there was a constant noise from the centrally placed elevators. All in all this is a good city centre hotel for the visiting tourist or business person. It's plus points outweigh it's negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest possible room and toilets you have to pay for”
Reviews.Author: AdB43
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival a long queue was waiting for check-in. Staff was friendly to help but that didn't change the hectic. People everywhere. Room was clean but very very small, internet had to be paid for. In the evening we had dinner in the Spagus restaurant of the hotel. Food was good but we going to the toilets was a costly happening. 50 eurocent! Never saw this in a hotel and refused to pay for it. The breakfast was OK but the price tag of 19 euro made it a lot less OK. The vicinity of the hotel was good directly at the Alexanderplatz. Next morning looking for a place to have a discussion but no space available.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location - good hotel”
Reviews.Author: smiley588
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel on our first visit to Berlin, stayed there for 4 nights and couldn't have selected a better place for access to public transport. U-bahn, S-bahn, Tram, central buslines like 100 and 200, are all just around the corner. The hotel itself is allright and the reception staff very helpful.The room was OK, had a decent size, was clean and equipped with safe, minibar and seating area, although unusual to only have glassdoors around the shower and toilet area! We were not impressed by the air condition system. Stay away from the WiFI solution avaiable in the room (too expensive) and from the restaurant (there are plenty of good alternatives in the area),

Reviews.Title: “city break”
Reviews.Author: RoKers
Reviews.Content: Excellent location (very central), ideal for business or citybreak. Upgraded to a higher floor, (24th). Much better view. Toilet and washing area very poor, glass doors/walls. Forget wi-fi in the room, (mindful that this is meant to be a 4* Hotel), if you are willing to pay, they charge 6 Euro/hr at reception or 18 Euro a day. Breakfast is good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, standard rooms are a bit tiny”
Reviews.Author: asd2k
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel at special anniversary rate (40 years = 40 Euros per night) in August 2010. If you arrive from Tegel, just take X-Bus at get off on the last station – Alexanderplatz. A huge building, being seen from any corner in Berlin. There is no need to take breakfast, since a great variety of alternatives around the square. Room was tiny for 4* hotel, windows could be opened.

Reviews.Title: “avoid west facing corner rooms”
Reviews.Author: sellocello
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel just one night on a business trip, paid by the host company, so cannot really complain but...the room I was given was at the corner facing west, so the sun was inside the room all day and the A/C could not cope, it was like being inside an oven. Was too tired to ask for a room change. Apart from that the rest was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: donegaljam
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Berlin, having stayed five days at the Park Inn. It is a big hotel with over 1,000 rooms, directly on Alexanderplatz. Our room was on the 26th floor with wonderful views of Berlin, and was very clean and also very quiet. The bed was very comfortable but the pillows were not. The buffet breakfast was excellent with plent of variety. The only negative regarding this hotel, was that there was no free Wifi. We found it impossible to find a hotspot and for such a major city, the cost, we thought was prohibitive.

Reviews.Title: “Good location with tiny room”
Reviews.Author: Lekky-rkl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Park inn for several times during my ITB trip. Personally, the room is fit for solo travellers. It's not suitable for traveling with friend or colleage due to the bathroom design. Anyway, it is ok for my single room based on the convinient location, very easy to find something to eat, close to Berlin's attractions, many mobile shops and few step away from the underground train. Overall, it is a good hotel for me.

Reviews.Title: “Good location Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Boyfromla
Reviews.Content: Excellent location - Close to bus and in front of the subway station Staff very helpfull and plesant Rooms are not very big but well equiped including a bathroom not spearted from the room . Nice view from the room also Very good beakfast in the morning Rates are very good for this property I paid less than 150 € for a good quality hotel .

Reviews.Title: “There must be something wrong with German architects”
Reviews.Author: Gellin_Uppsala
Reviews.Content: Second time in Berlin in 6 months - stayed at two different hotels but they had adapted the same unbeliveble bathroom style, glas walls. Who would like to do their most private things in a glas cage? The bathroom, or the toilet and the shower where in two different "sections" sharing the same door! Meaning that if you wanted to close the door to the toilet the shower was "open" and vice versa. The sink was outside on it´s own just beside the bed. Sorry, but this horrible solution is, according to me, so disturbing. Another thing about the hotel; there was almost impossible to use the mobile phone inside the room, you simply would´nt get enough signals. If you´re using 3G, it´s the same situation - and the hotel would charge you 18 euro/day for internet access. But, the hotel has a great location if you want to explore the city and they serve a very good breakfast, but 105 euro/night is to much!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room and service”
Reviews.Author: Davehudds
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Inn on Alexanderplatz for a week in March. The location of teh hotel is great just across from the main Alexanderpaltz station. It's only 3 euros each from Berlin shcoenfeld airport which makes it cheap and easy to get to. The hotel itself is clean and tidy the reception staff were very helpful and we even got an upgrade to a corner panorama room which was good as we had windows on two sides of the room. In reference to the comments about the bath/shower being on the centre of the room. This is true however i hardly see this as a problem as there is a curtain you can pull round if you are staying with friends however i have no problem seeing my wife have oa shower or her seeing me so i'm not sure what the rpoblem is with that. Min bar was restocked each day beer was reasonable but the soft drinks a bit pricey but there are plenty of shops nearby to stock up if you need to. My only concern with the room was the airconditioning didn't seem to work but they may turn this off until the summer. One other point would be the bed are a bit soft. Location wise in Berlin it's great never too far from the main historic sites in the centre and as i said earlier right next to all the U and S bahn and regional trains for exploring further afield. If you can ask for a room on a higher floor as the views are great. One thing if you are going to Berlin before May and are planning on visiting the Potsdam Palace at Sansonocci, don't bother as it's under renovation at the moment.

Reviews.Title: “convenient hotel for exploring berlin”
Reviews.Author: cheesylee
Reviews.Content: we stayed here in march and found the hotel to be well situated for sightseeing. the hotel is within walking distance of some sights and adjacent to the metro and s-bahn stations for handy travel to those further afield. rooms are clean and comfortable, if slightly small. the only gripe is that there is no free wifi or internet and it costs E5 for 15mins use! since many hotels now offer these free, it seems rather excessive.

Reviews.Title: “... a one-night stay at this hotel is not enough ...”
Reviews.Author: pinoy_fahrer
Reviews.Content: ... since we just decided a day before to go to Berlin from Bonn, we dont have a place to stay in Berlin ... we decided to call Park Inn which is near Alexander Platz and as my wife had experience already in staying at this hotel, immediately they accepted us provide only one-night because the hotel will be fully booked by the next days ... so we arrived at the hotel, we got the keys in just a minute and went up to our room which has a nice view of the tallest tower in Berlin (in Germany) ... it has already three beds for us with bathrobes and towels and other amenities ... the breakfast menu is so much, many German and continental dish are at the buffet tables, so many food to choose from ... although, as in any German hotel, concierge normally will not take your luggages in your room, unlike here in Asian region ... by the way, you can get tickets from the concierge a tour of Berlin for just 22 euro and the tour will last for 2.5 hours around Berlin ...

Reviews.Title: “A good basic hotel with good transport links in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: jonnogreig
Reviews.Content: A good basic hotel in the old East Berlin. Fantastic price for what you get. Great views from the upper floors. Did not have breakfast in the property. Would recommend to anyone travelling to Berlin on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the center of Berlin, very good connections to every where underground or trains and to every where else in Berli”
Reviews.Author: evaviva
Reviews.Content: The hotel in the heart of Berlin was very good value for money. 5 nights about 300 pounds. It had free sauna included which was awesome to relax. It was hard to get massage appointments in the spa area but we never saw any spa rooms in use. Overall very friendly and helpful staff from the reception to cleaning staff to security. Breakfast unfortunately not included in the price and very pricey, 20€ per person for breakfast. We tried it out once and it was fantastic, a whole array of types of food, eggs ,omletts, scrambled eggs, beans, bacon, cold cuts ham and cheese, freshly baked bread and buns and cakes, juices (not fresh), yogurt and fruit, pastries, cereals. But I think they should offer a simpler breakfast for a reasonable price... I think 20€ for breakfast is too much. 12€ should be enough for a good breakfast else where. No kettle with tea and coffee in the room. Great service looking after luggage after we checked out and still had time in city. No internet connection included costs 6,99€ extra per hour!@!! Too pricey should be included in the price. Overall very good though.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms with fantastic panoramic view”
Reviews.Author: Ingwe40
Reviews.Content: Excellent setting in the center of the city and good value for money. The breakfast iis not included and was an extra 16€ but it was also good value/money with a very extensive buffet. The rooms are medium sized but extremely practical with a lot of storage space a press for pants, a spacious desk, very good illumination (that's rare) and not less than SIX power plugs in the room. The only negative point is that internet cost 16€/h a disease of most big hotels worldwide. Why isn't that FOC everywhere these days? Anyway, if I go back to Berlin I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: MartinRogers
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a business trip. Location was good on Alexanderplatz, close to shopping and train stations. The checkin was good and quick to the room. I was aware of the rooms having their bathrooms in the room. Yes it was. Ok for me as I was travelling alone. Would not be suitable if with the wife and no good for any one who has booked a twin room to share. I had issue with the internet collection int he first room, engineering changed the phone and then said it was my computer as it was not purcased in Germany. Went and visited reception and changed rooms Internet worked immediately and with the computer not from Germany, I went to use the fitness room and was shocked to see it only had 4 pieces of equipment and 1 piece was already out fo order - do not stay at this hotel is you want to do any gym work etc Quick and easy check out.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: amyhillmob
Reviews.Content: You couldn't ask for a greater location than this. Alexander Platz is in the heart of Berlin and contains the TV tower that can be seen for all over Berlin. The hotel was fantastic. Staff were very courteous and helpful, the rooms were well kept and clean. it is great to watch the sun go down from the roof terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Emma S
Reviews.Content: The Park Inn is in a fantastic location - the Alexanderplatz train station is right on the doorstep, the iconic TV tower is just the other side and there are plenty of sights within walking distance. The rooms are well equipped and comfortable. We were given a room with beds pushed together, but when we asked for a normal double bed we were given one without hesitation or fuss. Nice staff. Only two things that were not quite what we expected: - There was no wifi in the rooms (although there is cable connection at a cost) - The toilet and shower are in opaque glass cubicles. We didn't mind at all, but we could see that some people wouldn't like it.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD 3-4 STAR HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Vicki B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good choice if you are looking for a 3-4 star hotel in a good location. The room was very modern. It is one of those rooms that has the sink in the main bedroom and then the toilet was behind a frosted glass door and shower behind another glass door. You would not want to stay here with someone that you didn't know very well, as there is no bathroom privacy apart from a huge 'shower curtain' that you can pull across to seperate the beds from the bathroom area. The hotel bar is very good and has great areas to relax over a drink. The location was great, right beside a big shopping mall, and a short walk from a whole lot of bars and restaurants. They offered us a free late check out of 7pm which was amazing as our flight did not depart until 9pm. I would definately recommend this hotel to both business and leisure travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: mars27
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and found the location perfect for us. We love to walk and explore new cities and it helped having the tv tower as an icon as no matter where we went we always new where out hotel was. The rooms were natrow though clean and a reasonable size. Agree with other reviewers about having to pay for foyer toilet, not necessary. Not having free wifi was the biggest turnoff for us. It meant we didn't eat breakfast in the hotel. Instead we went to the Starbucks at the base of the tv tower every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Alright”
Reviews.Author: Karinawh
Reviews.Content: Park Inn is a nice hotel at a good location in Berlin. Rooms are nice and there's a fantastic view from the building. The staff are friendly, but wasnt always the most efficient, but it was alright. You have to pay to use the toilets in the lobby even as a guest and when you're in the restaurant. That's just annoying and not really good enough for a hotel of this caliber. But the breakfast is absolutely amazing - there's everything you could possibly want!! I'd recommend the hotel, but have stayed at better in Berlin though.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: sir-hilary
Reviews.Content: We booked this based for the location, and on a favorable review in Lonely Planet. The location was great, but apart from that this was a disappointing hotel. The main entrance door was broken for most of our 5-night stay; they were charging hotel guests money to use the washroom in the lobby; internet was not free, they were selling it for ~ 18 euros per day; generally felt like they were trying to gouge the guests at every turn; room was shockingly small – hard for two people to share the space; no comfortable chairs to sit in and relax. Apart from these complaints it wasn't too bad – the room had a nice contemporary look, the view was good, and yes the location couldn't be better. We booked this because it was a bit cheaper than the Melia and the Westin Grand, and a bit more central than the wonderful Innside.... To some extent, during the stay, I regretted not choosing one of those other hotels. But the location is excellent, lots of great cafes, restaurants, shopping, galleries, etc in very close proximity. Dolores burrito joint, Oliv cafe, Monsieur Vuong were some of the very close by spots that we enjoyed a great deal....

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Michelle S
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent location in Berlin if your train traveling. Walk across the square and your in the train station. The rooms are small but that is typical for Europe. The bathroom is in your room with the shower location but there's a curtain to draw if your not a couple and want some shower privacy. My issue here is the communications system at the hotel are awful. If you need to have phone access to dial the US you will have a difficult time. When we tried to deal with the front desk regarding the problems with the phone we were dismissed as I was asking for a new phone system to be installed. The reception staff is rude and does not make an effort to help guests.

Reviews.Title: “Very Bad Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amy V
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with my fiancee. We stayed for 5 days en and had 3 rooms in those 5 days. The first room was a colorsuite (with no windows), we had to switch rooms because there was a very irritating sound coming from the airco. Also you could hear the elevators constantly going up and down. The second room (also a colorsuite) was not better, the noise was slightly less irritating except after 2 days the airco stopped working completly (wat is very irritating in a no window suite). The mechanic they send up just pulled a switch and said it would be better within a hour, this was not the case. After complaining at the reception we got anther room, with a view this time, this room was fine except this was our last night. The breakfast was not good either, you can eat at two locations, one simpler and the other a little better. At the simpler one (the most used) was nothing special. Just simple and the bread was hard en not very good. This is not one of the best hotels we have stayed in and we will never go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: CharfieldPTC
Reviews.Content: 50yds from the main train station so it was very easy to get from airport to hotel. Very modern decor in rooms. Usual German odd "open" bathroom with just a glass wall between bedroom and shower. Aircon not great as room unbearably hot even with windows open. Apart from heating would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin Weekend”
Reviews.Author: jezzer23
Reviews.Content: Great Location, rooms not massive but clean & comfortable, Breakfast awasome, huge choice, nice staff, an absolute bargain for what we paid, everything was close by, good public transport and some great bars within walking distance

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, central, make you feel welcome”
Reviews.Author: Pauldbk
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Its central in the city and staff makes you feel welcome and gives you the impression that you ARE a guest. Choose the rooms with view over the city. You can look from your shower!

Reviews.Title: “Good situation comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vaudrey
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently situated, easy walking distance from the Museumsinsel, next to Alexanderplatz stations - S-Bahn and U-Bahn, with direct rail connection in less than 30 minutes to Schönefeld airport (and after June to the new Berlin-Brandenburg airport). The rooms are spacious by European standards and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in the Middle of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: videoordvd
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Inn Alexanderplatz for a conference in December 2011. This hotel's location was incredibly convenient. It is literally right in the center of Alexanderplatz, which means plenty of shops, restaurants, and sights are right outside your door. The view of the Fernsehturm (Berlin's TV Tower) from my room was not to be believed, and I did not even pay extra for a higher room. The service of the hotel staff was great. There were a few minor problems with my room - the heater was stuck on high and at some point a fuse blew and the power outlets stopped working - but each time a staff member was sent up and fixed the problem with no delay. Everything was very clean. Check-in was a breeze, but check-out took a long time due to the line. I don't think there is much the hotel can do about this, they were all working very quickly and just got rushed by a group of people I suppose. The food I ate at the hotel restaurant on the first floor was quite good, if a bit expensive for Berlin. The only downside to the Park Inn is the rather peculiar layout of its rooms. The double bed in mine was just two single mattresses pushed together, which wasn't the most comfortable arrangement. The desk area near my window was pretty cramped. The most interesting aspect of the room by far was the bathroom setup. There is no separation between the bathing area and the sleeping area. The toilet was in a small closet by itself right by the door, and the sink was right next to my bed. A glass-walled shower stall stood in between, so you can see right in to the shower from anywhere in the room. Either book separate rooms for everyone you're traveling with, or be prepared to get a lot more intimate with your travel companions.

Reviews.Title: “Huge hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: Merengue70
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very large, around 35 floors and I guess not less then 650 rooms. It's not my favorite choice in terms of hotel size (I'd rather prefer small ones) but the location is at least very good: central, many restaurants around and tube + over-ground train a few steps away from the door. Room was ok, just a bit small. Anyway well furnished and with large flat screen LED TV. Breakfast OK with a wide selection of salty and sweety dishes. Internet in the room, cabled, only with extra 18€ fee daily. There is a bar on the roof terrace, which looks wondeful, at least during summer time, I could not taste it as outside is -18 °C today.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, wonderful view, good location”
Reviews.Author: sinistra
Reviews.Content: This hotel once was the first choice when Comecon representatives were visiting the capital of the GDR. Nowadays, the main feature is it's height. The view to Alexanderplatz, Unter den Linden and the rest of Mitte is wonderful. The rooms are rather bland. The hotel has undergone some renovation the last decade, but it still isn't especially fancy in any way. A large drawback is the lack of WiFi. The only Internet connection is a cable which costs 18 Euros per day! In a modern hotel free WiFi is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: EuroTravellerLDN
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location and if you get a high floor then great view to go with it. The entrances are pretty rubbish and the lobby is small the front desk had about 4 staff so the check in queue lasted not more than 10 mins, although that's still muh more than I am used to. The first room ( we had to change) was modern and nice. The TV was annoying though and had a mind of it's own. The 'bathroom' is effectively a shower/toilet and a sink area within the room that you can conceal with a curtain the door to the toilet is also the door to the shower. I didn't like this, it was not trendy if thats why they thought and essentially pretty annoying. I think the only reason they did it wa s otherwise there is simply not enough room. The bed was comfy. The first night, after a night out the two rooms either side decided to make a load of noise. We can handle this but when we ourselves got in at 4am and they were still screaming at 6 am(!) and running from room to room banging their doors we had stern words with them twice before calling security to shut them up. This wasn't helped by the gap between the door and floor that lets sound in. Anyway later that day we asked to be moved. The receptionist said sorry and we were moved. The next room was on floor 30 with a better view. The room was older and the silly attempt at a bathroom had no curtain this time. The bed was old and the mattress had collapsed on one side. On the whole the hotel disappointed but I I have never stayed at a park inn so maybe this is just normal and I am being overly harsh. The 19euro per person breakfast is a joke though.

Reviews.Title: “Sehr gut in Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: emily84London
Reviews.Content: Sorry for the corny title, I got carried away. I went for a weekend in Berlin in December 11 and stayed here. First things first, it is very easy to find this hotel as it is one of the highest points around aside from the BT building. If you exit the correct way from Alexanderplatz station it should be right in front of you. We did not but that was our fault! Negative points; we got there early and had to wait a few hours- partly our fault so no biggie. The layout of the shower/toilet facilities may not be to some peoples taste (see below), the foyer/entrance area is a bit shambolic with the public able to come in an out and the toilets in reception asked for money. Positives: The room itself was very nice with a view of the square which had Christmas markets, it was warm, the bed was cosy and bed bug free (yay), the shower was so powerful and warm. If you are in a couple it should be fine but the format is one of those space saver designs where you pull a curtain round the shower area. The toilet door was also semi transparent! Overall a lovely place to stay. The sights were either within walking distance or a short train ride away and the bar was nice. From the airport we flew to (second biggest one) it was a couple changes but it only took about 35 minutes. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time there”
Reviews.Author: ViajandoBr
Reviews.Content: Been there two times, Jan 2011 and now, Jan 2012. Rooms always spot clean, breakfast very good, not fancy, but does the job on the winter time, hot food, some fruits, bread, coffe, etc. Check inn always blazing fast; sometimmes can be long lines, but this is due to a Bus arriving with tourists, not common . They also are not very strict with check inn or check out times, what I found fantastic ( imagine arriving at 9 am, long flight, and the Hotel turns you out, only at 2pm check inn.?) that doesn´t happen at Park Inn. Only and big downturn is the internet, no wifi at rooms, and very expensive internet data cable options.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Eve in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: chernova_st
Reviews.Content: In November I have visited Berlin for business trip. So in the afternoon I took part on the conference. I stayed at the hotel Park Inn by Radisson. It’s business-friendly hotel, located in the heart of Berlin, within walking distance of the hotel's Alexanderplatz and TV Tower. Also nearby: the Reichstag and Museum of Pergamum. Besides 4.5-star property offered us all business services and meeting room. It offered 3 restaurants, as well as a bar / lounge.The service was wonderful, the rooms were clean and comfortable. If there will a possibility in the future I'll stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Up Grading”
Reviews.Author: Elaine1
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely central hotel within walking distance to every place, added advantage if you wish to use the train it is next door and trams readily available. We stayed for 4 nights in December we had already booked up before we left, on arrival everyone was so nice and made us feel very welcome. We upgraded our room to a corner Panoramic room with the Tv Tower as our front aspect this was worth the extra and the side view was just as amazing it cost us apx 12 Euro a night but was well worth it and a very large room with all you could want. We stayed on Floor 27 about 3/4's the way up the lift is amazing supersonic fast. As the christmas Markets were on it was great to be able to view them from the room as was the Ice Skating rink. The breakfast you could not fault Full range from cereal - smoked salmon - hot food and such a range of variety even if you are Vegatarian. We would come back to Berlin it was an incredible amazing break and would not go anywhere else other than this Hotel. One tip is if you go into the train station from the Hotel and turn left once inside there is this lovely small bar which serves amazing beer Light and dark for an excellant price 3.50 euro for the large litre- pint ?. You will not be dissapointed and the upgrade was well worth it for us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: WeaverDK
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel at 30 dec 2011 to celebrate New years eve in Berlin. But were shocked by the que to check in. Waited in line for over 30 minuttes. That why we dont give it 5. But we got checked in and got our nice room with city centre view at 24 floor. The room is small, nice and acceptable since we were only staying there for 2 nights. The Hotel is situated perfect just next to the metro and alot of shopping opportunities nearby. We were a bit dissapointed of the wellness area, since there were no spa nor pool. But the massage and sauna was great and needed. After a big city walk. This was our third time in Berlin. The earlier trips we stayed closer to Kurfurstendamm but at new years and just for the view, this hotel is the most recommendable one in Berlin. We booked the gala dinner at the Spagos restaurant, with a 5 course gourmet dinner. And Wow we were inpressed. Good service, a very nice selection of wines and live music. Later on we went to the 37 floor to get the best view of New years eve. Was a very special night, and thanks to the perfection, it made our minivacation and unforgettable one.

Reviews.Title: “Good location; average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fruity_kiwi
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel and chose it because of its central location and good transport links. Coming in from Schoneburg airport is a DB train directly to Alexanderplatz. The hotel itself was ok. Clean. A large hotel too and so breakfast was always busy, queues etc,. Breakfast itself was good so get a deal if you can to include it. Staff are efficient but not welcoming or friendly. The bathrooms are awful. I stayed with a friend and there was no privacy with a partially frosted window glass door separating off the toilet. Hugely inconvenient because neither of us felt comfortable to use the toilet. I won't stay here again if I return to Berlin but I would recommend it if you don't mind your travelling partner seeing and hearing you use the toilet.

Reviews.Title: “Huge hotel, with a great location”
Reviews.Author: PHR67
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right on Alexanderplatz, within easy walking distance of the Museum Island and Unter den Linden. It is huge, with over 1000 rooms, which causes some queuing here and there, especially at check-in. The rooms are fresh and functional, and many with an impressive view.the breakfast buffė is good. There is decent sauna area, but I would not go as far as calling it a spa. There is also a tiny fitness room, that holds four exercise machines, but it lacks both windows and proper ventilation. Overall, a perfectly good hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cosmos-flower
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in old East Germany part. You can take a bus (about 30-40 mins) directly from Tegel airport to Alexanderplatz with cost just Euro 2.5. It is at a very convenient location, you can go to Alexanderplatz by bus, U-Bahn and S-Bahn. The hotel was okay, but not as good as some readers claim. The room was average, shower and the view were good. We were a bit disappointed, as the hotel review that we have seen was over 4 stars. So, we were expected this will be a 4 stars hotel, although the price was rather cheap to believe! This is a Park Inn hotel by Radisson, but do not think this is a “typical” 4-5 stars Radisson hotel you have in your mind. It has a fast food burger shop in the ground floor of the hotel, and the setting wasn’t great. We also not sure about the glass toilet and shower room set up in the standard room too. My opinion is this hotel is more like some of the travel inns in UK.

Reviews.Title: “SURPRISE!”
Reviews.Author: VFitaly
Reviews.Content: Just a one-night stay, but pretty good test during busy tradeshows/fashion-week. Huge hotel, fully-booked, but still functional and well run. Central location: right on Alexanderplatz...can't miss it! Nice, recently refurbished "design" rooms. Quiet even at busiest time! Full breakfast buffet. If not truly "friendly" - we're in Germany, after all... - very efficient staff. Comfort, value/money, location. A true surprise! PS: still wondering why most European hotels still DON'T offer their guests free wifi...a time will come when travellers will really start considering this issue while choosing a hotel...I'm starting tomorrow!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location, stay away from the low floors”
Reviews.Author: MonoTraveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms are great, but we had the room above the Burger King, and our room had constant grease food smell. We insisted, and got moved to a much higher floor. The view was amazing, and the bed was cozy. Next to hotel are many supermarkets, food stands and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Zizza55
Reviews.Content: We staid in this hotelinjuring a 4 days trip to Berlin. The hotel is amazing! The staff is extremely polite and helpful. The lobby is huge, but sometimes there was a bit of smell. The room was very nice, big, modern and the bed was very comfortable. One highlight was the breakfast! The buffet was incredible, from mini croissant to cereal, from cheese to salada and I had one of the best omelette ever! As per most of my trip, I also tried the SPA of the hotel. The swimming pool is very small, but the spa is clean and the massage was great!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: TraceyH050
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights over the Christmas period and it was excellent. It was the second visit to this hotel, I had stayed there early December the previous year and wanted to return. The hotel was much quieter over Christmas and I really enjoyed my stay. I had booked the flight and hotel package through easyjet and got a really good value package which included breakfast. I had requested a high floor room again with a view of the TV Tower and I was given this on floor 35 without any problem. I took the direct train from the airport to Alexanderplatz which was easy to use. I arrived early at the hotel but was able to check in without any problem. Reception staff were excellent and there was no queue as the hotel was quiet at Christmas time. I had no problems with the room. As a single traveller the bathroom wasn't an issue for me. The views of Berlin were fantastic. The room was spotless and had everything I needed. As a single traveller I felt safe at this hotel which is important to me. Breakfast was very good with lots of choice. All the restaurant staff were friendly and helpful. The location was excellent and the U Bahn station is just outside the hotel and the train station 5 minutes away. The Christmas markets were on the door step and shopping centres 5 minutes walk from the hotel. There is lots to do in the area of the hotel. It is about 25 - 30 mins to walk to the tourist attractions such as Brandenburg Gate and Postdamer Platz. I really enjoyed my stay here and Christmas was the perfect time to visit Berlin. I will definitely stay here again and hope to return next Christmas as there is still a lot more I want to see in Berlin and Christmas in Berlin is magical.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful views of my favorite city.”
Reviews.Author: gratedunicorn
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for 3 nights on a cheap getaway. The hotel is just by Alexanderplatz station and is the tallest hotel in Berlin. On arrival we were given a room that was already occupied but for the inconvenience we were given a room on the 32nd floor and 2 free drinks tokens each to use in the lounge bar. The views from our room were spectacular and the room itself was small but very nice. The bathroom was walled by clear and opaque glass so wouldn't be suitable unless the person you're sharing with is your partner. The location is ideal, in the heart of what was East Berlin. It's next to the TV Tower from which there are many tours of the city available. We like to walk but Berlin's transport system is cheap and really easy to use if you're not the walking type. We liked to finish our nights in our room with drinks looking out over the city all lit up. Magical, would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: marzas
Reviews.Content: Hotel located very centrally, it is very easy to get to the place from airport (approx. 25 min. by taking direct train). It takes approx. 15 min. walk to reach main touristic points. Hotel was built in Soviet time with limited space and services, therefore the room was small, but clean. I had a problem with my madras the first night and complain about it the next morning, have received apologies and it has been replaced almost immediately. Hotel staff was helpful and friendly. FYI: If you might need to use Wi-Fi it costs 6,5 EUR per hour or 18 EUR per day. To get on the roof terrasse 3 EUR.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor internet”
Reviews.Author: HappyBelly
Reviews.Content: Great location, will definitely stay there again. Service is as good as can be expected from Germans. But we stayed there for 4 days and couldn't get internet working the entire time. That was solved with a prepaid card. Still, the location was fantastic and we will definitely stay here again when we come back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the experience at Christmas time”
Reviews.Author: buddy070
Reviews.Content: I have always wanted to visit Berlin and i am delighted to say i had a wonderful experience. I chose to visit at Yuletide when the Christmas markets are in full swing. The hotel is in a great location and is ideal for the single traveller. My room was excellent and had every convenience. I believe it was an up-grade so would urge the traveller to do this. I did an excellent package with british airways. The food in the buffet restaurant on the 2nd floor was superb plentiful and to a very high standard. In the hotel bar the service was non existent, very slow i walked out having waited 25 mins for service and it never arrived, sad, I will definately return to this hotel. Loved the Cathedral and the signtseeing trip. The sight seeing bus terminus and starting points are outside the hotel, Very convenient, and inexpensive..

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great view.”
Reviews.Author: Drake_Sheldon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with the better half on a recent trip to Berlin and it was a good experience. The room was clean and modern, although the bathroom arrangements were just bizarre. The toilet and the the shower were in seperate and the sink was actually in the bedroom; this is fine for a couple but if it was a twin sharing then I could guess it would be kind of awkward. Ask for a view toward the West and you'll get a good view of the TV Tower and the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great base in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: lysi1977
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here for a couple of nights on a few occasions now. The proximity to public transport and relative ease to get to/from the hotel, make it one of my favourites in Berlin. The rooms are comfortable and some have good views. Rooms are good for single travellers or couples but wouldn't recommend for sharing since the shower room is quite exposed in the room.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: The terminus for the airport (Tegel) bus is right outside the hotel. You can find all kinds of transportation around this hotel. The bus station is just outside the hotel. Also close to the museums and an easy stroll down Unter den Linden to the Brandenberg Gate and all the other signts in that area. The room and whole hotel was kept clean and well maintained. The staff were very helpful and able to offer advice and information to enhance our stay. The breakfast was excellent, the beds and the view were great. Elevators are occupied during rush hours.

Reviews.Title: “Tallest hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: JannyC1980
Reviews.Content: The hotel is the tallest in Berlin overlooking the city and TV tower. Conveniently located next to shopping mall and train station. The room is a bit tiny for a twin room. Hotel room is clean but the shower room has a glass door and glass window. Although you can always pull the curtain to cover up but recommend to share the room whom you feel intimate with!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: PeterBean
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in December. The rooms are basic although perfect for a comfortable base to stay. Spacious, clean and a powerful shower. What more could you want. The views from either side aren't too bad at all. The location is fantastic. A 1 minute walk from Alexanderplatz station, a main transport hub. The only negative (in my opinion) is the glass shower. Depends on how comfortable you are with whoever you are sharing your room with I suppose! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Andreajr
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location for trains, trams and buses. Hotel great, breakfast superb.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bowie_10
Reviews.Content: enjoyed our stay here. right outside the train station so very accessible for the airport. very central to all the sights. lots to do and all within walking distance. hotel room comfortable, bathroom was "different". wouldn't be to everyone's taste as you don't get too much privacy. great views, good restaurant and bar. staff are helpful, only one staff member on the desk rude. everyone else pleasant to deal with. the three night stay was good value for money too.

Reviews.Title: “Stay only if you know the person you are with well”
Reviews.Author: G M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel early December on a weekend trip to the Christmas markets. Great location...easy journey from Airport, great for underground trains and Christmas Market. Service ok drinks expensive, food average....can be difficult to get a table in restaurant unless you go down early for breakfast. Rooms basic clean...we had a high floor room so had great views. The toilet/Shower arrangement is unique I have never seen this in a hotel before......integral part of the room separated by flimsy curtain if you don't know the other person well it could be embarrassing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chris3oct
Reviews.Content: just come back from a weekend in Berlin and stayed at this excellent hotel. We were offered a room on the 35th floor (of 37). Didn't have views of the TV tower but they were still amazing. The rooms are smallish but ours had everything including a mini bar, hair dryer and trouser press. The hotel has a front and back entrance if you are coming in on the train to Alexanderplatz use the Karl Liebnacht Strasse exit and you can then go in the back exit which is next to Burger King. BK is also handy for a cheap breakfast although it doesn't open until 10am on Sunday. Final tip: if you are travelling by train from Schoenfeld remember that the station is in zone C. The ticket machine isn't very clear and offers you the chance to buy a ticket in zone AB or zone ABC. We didn't think that you would be able to buy a ticket for a zone that you aren't it so plumped for the AB one and got fined eight euros !! Not to do with the hotel but I thought it might save someone some money!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice....”
Reviews.Author: Wizardoro
Reviews.Content: If it's within budget def worth a stay. Rooms are good- amazing hot shower- much needed in the winter months! nice piano bar downstairs staff very helpful near to train station

Reviews.Title: “ok, but costly internet and no way to control room temperature”
Reviews.Author: David_W111
Reviews.Content: ok, very central, easy to get around, nice views from the upper floor, good breakfast and decent restaurant. Staff are helpful. The room was far too hot and there was no way to turn down the room temperature (thermostat didnt respond) or open a window. Internet was very pricey. I expect free wi-fi in a hotel of this price/quality.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: Blue_Norseman
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Park Inn in December, and it was just what we needed. The room was a little small, but clean and good layout. The bathroom/shower situation is different - and probably not ideal for most couples: A glass wall is all that separates the toilet from the shower - which has a curtain to the rest of the room. The breakfast was superb, and being able to get a double espresso at the table was also nice. The hotel bar is very cozy, with comfy sofas and a nice dark ambiance. The prices are a bit high, like one would expect. Also, paying 18 Euros for 24hrs/wifi is exorbitant, but that´s a different discussion.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: WestendCPH
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times and have never been disapponted. Park Inn has a very centrally location right on the Alexanderplatz. The staff is friendly and welcoming. The queue at check-in can seem a bit long, but the staff are very efficient so check-in only takes a few minutes. If you have booked a standard room it will be from the 4th to the 20th floor. Do your self a favour and upgrade your room. It is 15 EUR on top of the price but worth it. The view from the top floors is magnificent. Rooms are not big nor small. But they are very clean and the bed is very comfortable. The breakfast buffet is a bit pricy - 19 EUR - but it is absolutely worth is. Lots of choose from on the hot and cold buffet. Many of Berlins best restaurants are just outside the door. And there are plenty of sights and shops in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, incomparable views.”
Reviews.Author: opinionatedsurrey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for a short trip to the city. Alexanderplatz is about as central as it gets and is a hub for the U-Bahn and trams so getting around is super simple. It was an easy walk to the Brandenburg Gate. One bonus is that it's hard to get lost when you're walking as you can see the hotel and TV tower from miles away. Definitely ask for a room on a high floor. We paid a 15 euros per night supplement and were on the 34th floor facing the TV tower with the most spectacular view right across Berlin. It was money well spent. Sure, it's a Radisson, so not quaint and characterful, but one look out of the window tells you you could only be in Berlin! The staff were helpful and pleasant, the breakfast buffet is generous, varied, with loads of staff, so tables are clean, coffee is replenished etc. The other reviews about the shower/loo arrangements are true. It didn't bother my husband and me, but, yes, if you didn't know each other that well, there's no means of soundproofing or isolating the lavatory, and if the other person is in the shower, the loo has no door! In spite of this, I would definitely stay there again as it was very comfortable and excellent value. The only meanness is that you have to pay for internet use and there's no WiFi in the rooms - very unusual nowadays.

Reviews.Title: “Very central hotel, ask for a room on high floor :)”
Reviews.Author: DimaEastGermany
Reviews.Content: Very central hotel, ask for a room on high floor :) We stayed just one night, our room was on 24th floor - the view was just amazing - see photos attached. The hotel is immaculate as always by Raddison brand, rooms are quite small, then again we were very comfortable. Staff was very pleasant, allowed us late check-out even thought I lost my Silver Member status awhile ago. Highly recommended for sightseeing as this hotel is right in the middle of Berlin, next to TV tower, Alexanderplatz, etc, etc There is a bar available on the top floor, we did not have time/energy to check it out, but it must have great panoramic view of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: MarciaBoaventura
Reviews.Content: Very good location, near everything. The only thing we did not like is that you have to pay for wi fi internet.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay in as many years and even better!”
Reviews.Author: Herts15
Reviews.Content: The rooms have had a refresh since December 2010 and now the hotel is flawless! Check in is simple and friendly, and the service is just fantastic! The hotel has a perfect location to explore the city, which is what we all did for the Christmas markets...and I will be back next year! The bathrooms are immaculately presented and it feels 5* quality!

Reviews.Title: “general impressions are good”
Reviews.Author: odnobro
Reviews.Content: +convenient location +easily accessible from Tegel Airport +excellent staff +good restaurants -rooms need to be updated -a little cold in the room as i think +impressive view from the window

Reviews.Title: “Its best feature is its central location”
Reviews.Author: drdemento
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for "quaint," "atmospheric," "charming" and the like, this is not for you. What you get from the Park Inn is a central location, at reasonable rates. The Alexanderplatz is a major transportation hub for the U-Bahn and the S-Bahn, for the surface trams and buses. The bus to and from the Tegel Airport (marked TXL) originates and terminates a block from the hotel. The Park Inn is oriented toward the business traveler but serves everyone well. The rooms are small but efficiently laid out; if you want a larger room with a splendid room, ask for one of their "panorama rooms." We found the hotel staff, especially the young concierge staff, very helpful. I recommend you buy all your rapid transit tickets here in advance (there is no premium to be paid). Another asset: the health spa, where you can spend time to decompress at the end of a tiring day of sightseeing. There are restaurants at the hotel, but the budget traveler may want to eat, as we did, across the street at the Galeria Department Store, which, on its top floor, has an excellent cafeteria at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms and good service.”
Reviews.Author: jisierra
Reviews.Content: We choose the place and location. The rest was surprisingly better than expected. Both rooms and service (reception, cleansing,...) was good enough. Definitely, good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value!”
Reviews.Author: DickG
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 days stay at the Park Inn. Took the TXL Express bus from Tegel airport and it dropped us 100m from the hotel (Alexanderplatz is the terminus so don't worry about missing the stop!). Great location, right on Alexanderplatz with access to both 'S' and 'U' bahn stations, tram and bus. We arrived quite late but there were 4 members of staff at reception who welcommed us and dealt with us quickly. We had a city view room on the 20th floor (well worth any extra payment) with the famous TV tower right across from us and a wonderful view over the city. The room was clean but seemed only to be vacuumed once during our 4 day stay. It had no wifi but had a cabled connection, I asked about free Wifi (as I have a Carlson Gold Elite card which gives free Wifi at Radisson Blu hotels) but even though it is 'Park Inn by Radisson' you don't get free Wifi. Wifi is €6 an hour or €18 a day!! Top tip, walk the 200m to the base of the TV tower and get 2 hours free Wifi in Starbucks for the price of a great coffee! There was no kettle or coffee stuff in the room but we asked at reception and it was sent up to our room. It was supplied with one days worth of coffee/tea but more was available from the maid. The hotel didn't mind us keeping fresh milk in the minibar fridge. The double bed was a good size but 'firm' and a little odd as it had 2 single duvets which took a bit of getting used to. Breakfast was included in our deal, it was well laid out with all the usual cereals, cold meats, cheeses, fruit etc plus a separate section for hot food. Excellent choice and quality but was €17 if not included in your room rate. You really enter the hotel by the side door as this is the one onto Alexanderplatz. Lots of kids skateboarding around there in the evening, didn't cause any problems but the sidewalk (pavement) could do with a steam clean. Other than breakfast, we ate out in Berlin so I can't comment on the restaurant. There is a great Italian place across the road, "Pizza Romantica" which gets busy. Really nice folk run it and took the trouble to made a vegetarian dish specially for my wife. Across from the holel is the Kaufhof Galeria department store. Great place to shop and fabulous self service restaurant on the top floor. If you are a veggie, head here but be warned, when you pile your plate up from the salad bar, it's weighed at the till! The Park Inn is a great location for 'Museum Island' and there are several 'biggies' there. These are within walking distance but equally you can take the tram for just one stop and walk the rest. I will certainly stay here again on my next visit to Berlin. Don't forget the Berlin Museum Pass' for €19 or 3 days free admission which is available from the Concierge at the hotel BUT remember to ask for the booklet that goes with it as that tells you which museums accept the pass. Don't forget to visit the DDR Museum just next to museum island, by the cathedral. A small but excellent 'hands -on' museum for all the family but sadly not covered by the pass. If you are doing a lot of travelling round the city, buy a 1 day pass for €6.40 which is good for all forms of transport! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, but too big and busy for my liking. The "bathroom" setup was weird!”
Reviews.Author: BSesay
Reviews.Content: My partner took me away for a lovely 4 day break in Berlin last week. We stayed at the Park Inn hotel on Alexander Platz. The location was good, as most of the main attractions were just a 10-20 minutes train or tube ride away. The square that the hotel is situated on is also very good with market stalls and shops around it. The hotel itself was too big and busy for my liking. When we checked in, we were offered an upgrade to a room higher up the building which offered better views of the city. My partner decided to go for the upgrade at 15 Euros extra per night.We were on the 34th floor. The views were great. The room itself was a decent size; however, they had this weird thing whereby the toilet and shower were effectively IN the hotel room! The sink was actually in the room (that made it look a bit like a student halls of residence room). The shower was behind frosted glass, with diagonal peek-a-boo slants at the top. When you are in the shower, your partner or whoever you are sharing with can see you showering! It's the same for the toilet, they can see you in the toilet, and there was only one door which doubled up as the shower door AND toilet door. So, if one person is in the shower, the other person can't really use the toilet, as there would be no door there. This provided no privacy and did take a lot of getting used to. To be honest, I hated the exhibitionism of it all. I love my body, but I love my privacy more! Another annoying thing is that the chambermaid always came by around 8.15am to knock on our door to clean the room. So, she woke us up every morning with her knocking on the door. She even knocked on our door at 8.30am on the morning that we were checking out. She should have been informed by reception staff that we were checking out at 12pm that day, therefore she should not have gone to clean our room until after we had checked out. The hotel reception staff were always nice and friendly and they all spoke English, so it was easy to communicate with them. There was a spa, but you had to pay to use it. We felt that it should have been included in the price, so we never used it. The hotel bar was very nice with mellow mood lighting and a good piano player/singer. We went there for pre-dinner drinks on a couple of evenings. The bar staff were very attentive and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel, staff, location - all we wanted and we're going back”
Reviews.Author: The Great Dad
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at this modern multi-storey hotel in the old East Berlin and were not disappointed. Bedroom was of reasonable size for two, very clean and kept tidy by staff. Shower and toilet facilities were rather odd and probably designed to be stylish (eg glass, albeit opaque, walls with one door which can be swung and used for either cubicle) rather than "usual"/simply functional, and the wash basin seemed out of place within the bedroom itself. This said, none of it presented a problem and we had no real cause for dissatisfaction. Breakfast was a magnificent buffet (the largest we'd come across) with delicious hot and cold international fayre. Staff generally were very polite and friendly, eager to help at all times. Location is ideal for a major Dept store (Galleria), C and A, a shopping mall and various small restaurants and cafes. Also, there are several stalls and, at the appropriate time, a substantial Christmas market. We found the straight walk from hotel to Unter den Linden and the Brandenberg Gate quite comfortable and took in a number of "must sees." These included the Marien Church (where we joined a Taize service), Berlin Dome (get free pass over the Net), DDR Museum (with vivid inter active exhibition of life in E Germany - pretty grim, sometimes evil), Museum Island. Still walking and "do-able" were visits to Checkpoint Charlie, the Jewish Memorial and Potsdammerplatz. Other sights needed a bus (we didn't use the U-bahn or trams) but the journeys (eg to Kaiser Wilhelm Church and Ka de We Dept Store, a German Harrods) were interesting and not long. Good hotel. Excellent staff. First class location. We are going back!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, good service”
Reviews.Author: Swaan53
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on good location, good value for many. Due to the weather, my flight to Berlin was delayed and might be cancelled. I informed the hotel. They told me that they would "hold my room the whole night". When I arrived very late in the evening, they did not hold my room, but sold it to someone else. They solved this problem very well: they transferred me to a 5-star hotel, payed my taxi and breakfast. The second night, I finally got a room in the Park inn. The rooms are great, very efficient furnitured.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Room. Solid Location.”
Reviews.Author: DrummerMan27
Reviews.Content: Seems like your standard large hotel you'd find in the U.S. with a large front desk, concierge and long hallways. Rooms were clean, staff was great, and breakfast was very good. Its location at Alexanderplatz is also great as it is relatively close (i.e. a short bus or train ride) to a lot of the Berlin attractions and tours that tend to be in the former East Berlin. It's not all that close to the old West Berlin areas (i.e. the Ku'Damm) but the trains are very efficient, so it's not bad. One thing my wife and I found interesting was that there was no real separate bathroom in our room. Instead, there was a frosted glass partition dividing the bedroom from a small shower room and toilet room, which each shared the same door, not making for a whole lot of privacy. So if you're staying here, I guess just make sure you're with someone with whom you're comfortable hearing bodily bathroom noises and/or seeing in the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very good”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at this hotel and overall a pleasant experience, The hotel is well situated and near Alexanderplatz U and S Bahn and regional railways so good links to airports and Berlin generally. The hotel is modern, comfortable and well looked after, the staff were friendly and helpful and any lack of German is not a problem. The rooms were comfortable if not a little small and were kept very clean. I cant comment on the food and breakfast but ducked this as I though Euros 19 was a bit expensive and there are plenty of food places nearby Th

Reviews.Title: “Affordable modern hotel at excellent location”
Reviews.Author: cemozBrussels
Reviews.Content: Park Inn at AlexanderPlatz, Berlin is an excellent hotel with very clean and modern facilities. The staff is friendly and efficient. The breakfast is superior than those of many similar hotels. My only criticism is the sound insulation at the door of the rooms. You can hear the people in the corridor. They are also charging (a lot) for internet. They should either reduce it, or make it free.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: Ron H
Reviews.Content: Always a pleasant stay. internet could be better. good location near all. nice views from upper floors.

Reviews.Title: “Hot Young Fast & Loose”
Reviews.Author: mbearpa
Reviews.Content: The Park Inn by Radisson was recommended by a young professional who told us the latest, smartest place in Berlin is Alexanderplatz (in the former East Berlin), and that's where things were most happening. He is right, and if you are under 35, go for it. The rooms are tight efficiencies with no real wall dividing bath area from bed space, but my room overlooked the TV tower and street life so the view compensated. In a way, Park Inn is a window to the new Berlin and at night the huge plaza teems with buskers, cafes, and youngsters out on the town. There is a "Spago" restaurant in the lobby that serves a good pizza, with some live night time music. A crowded concierge desk that runs independent of the hotel, selling tours and other services -- they were polite and helpful but usually overwhelmed. This place has 1,000 rooms or so, and the lobby is a bee hive. Even the doors on to Alexanderplatz often require that you give way to tourist mobs. Luckily, the elevators only permit guests with room cards. My guess is that conventioneers like it for the anonymity and bustle. All of this would have been OK (for this older reviewer) were it not for the final sting. I accidentally left some expensive personal effects in my room and inquired several times from the next day onward. No one in management found anything. So, just be careful if you decide to stay there, and double check everything upon departure.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SiouXsie7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for a Berlin short break. It is very comfortable, clean and is in a fantastic location. Alexanderplatz has great transport links to everywhere including the airport (Schoenefeld Airport is a 20 min ride) and the surrounding areas are very interesting if you are into exploring cities by going off the beaten track. There is also the free alternative Berlin tour that meets at the tower every day which is fantastic (For those interested in urban street art and culture.Don't expect visit to historical sites). On the downside the hotel does not offer free WIFI and charges are quite high.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: Ashalt17
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location. Right beside u bahn/s bahn. Busy square good atmosphere. Bathroom/shower situation is a little wierd alright. But it all depends who your sharing a room with i suppose! Staff are very friendly and helpfull. Great view also

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: taffma2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well placed in the old eastern sector, to use as a base to explore Berlin. A railway station is in walking distance, with a direct link to the airport. The hotel is large, and a typical ' American' type hotel. The dinning room on 1st floor, is equally large, and at breakfast time hot, busy, noisy and very full. Sometime to the point of not being able to find a seat. Other than that a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: harri05
Reviews.Content: Took the Airport Express Train from Schoenefeld Airport which was included in the Welcome Card. Lovely hotel but expected to have free WiFi in room. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great location in the city centre”
Reviews.Author: Matthias M
Reviews.Content: Really big hotel with a great view from the room, room has been great and was worth the money, the staff was really helpful and let us check into our room already at 10:30 in the morning, we didn`t try any breakfast or restaurant there as you have a great variety of coffee shops or restaurants around this place.

Reviews.Title: “did what it said on the tin”
Reviews.Author: davidgoodchild
Reviews.Content: a huge hotel, excellent view from my room, rooms absolutely fine, breakfast excellent though very busy one morning, excellent staff throughout, bar prices a bit steep!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, really helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: salfordmasher
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 3 nights in this hotel and loved the location and the standard of service. Have to agree with other reviewers that the bathroom arrangement in the room takes some getting used to and it is probably best to share only with someone you know really well - if you don't know them well at the start of your stay you will be on intimate terms by the time you leave - However, the room was perfectly clean and the bed very comfortable. Our room was at the back and very quiet. The staff were extremely helpful, friendly and efficient. It is really well placed to take advantage of Berlin's excellent transport links, giving easy access to all parts of the city. Great place and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: fionadesmond
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel recently while on business in Berlin. Great location, friendly staff, good rooms (if a little small, and with a shower within the room but outside the bathroom, which I found weird), with a great bar downstairs and a good cafe for breakfast nearby. Location for travelling about berlin amazing. I had no complaints and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Kuttappi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in June this year. The hotel is large with a very big breakfast spread. The rooms are good quality and service good. My room was towards the back of the hotel with a lot of construction around. One thing I would like to highlight was that I forgot some dressing matrial at the hotel and realised this couple of days after I left. I called th hotel which was able to locate my dress and and promptly mailed it to me. The whole process was easy and efficient. Worth staying again just for this reason.

Reviews.Title: “I keep and will keep returning here!”
Reviews.Author: Danny G
Reviews.Content: The Park Inn was built in 1969, as the East-German authorities were building the entire Alexanderplatz. It was essentially called the Berlin Mitte Hotel, later to become the Forum, the Park Inn and somewhere in the last year (I was last there in September 2010) Park Inn by Radisson. Now there are basically three centers in Berlin. First, there’s Alexanderplatz, the heart of the former east-Berlin, next to which most attractions are located. The Park Inn is right there, close by foot to just about everywhere. Second, there’s the area between Potsdamer Platz and the Brandenburg Gate, the later a 20 – 30 minute walk from Alexanderplatz… Finally, there’s the Kudamm area of west-Berlin, the area for shopaholics… From Alexanderplatz all is near, either on foot or by public communication. Bus TXL goes to Tegel Airport. Bus 100 takes you to almost all attractions, near and far. Bus 200 takes you to Potsdamer Platz. And then there are U-Bahns to take you to other, further places. The standard rooms are not big, but certainly not tiny. They are much larger than, say, hotels in central Paris. This is probably because the hotel was built in the GDR era. All standard rooms have TVs, bathtubs, a safe, a hair dryer and a mini-bar. As for TV channels, there are plenty in German, 3 English news channels (Sky, CNBC, France 24), 3 French channels (TV5, Arte, France 24), 2 in Italian (RAI 1+3) and 1 in Spanish (TVE), Polish (TVP Polonia) and Russian (Russia1). The main change since Park Inn became Park Inn by Radisson is the possibility to get a room with a view to the TV Tower. In all my previous visits (and there have been quite a few), it was enough to request it. Now, unless you have paid for it in advance, you can only get it by paying an extra fee upon arrival – in my case, they asked for 50 extra Euros daily. I humbly decided to stay with the standard room and the view towards the eastern-town. The rooms are THE SAME anyway. At any case, if worse comes to worse, change to channel 29 on your TV set, and you’ll have a live view of the TV Tower… The breakfast is superb! I won’t go into details as it would be too long. There is, believe me, plenty to eat. You won’t feel hungry until the late afternoon hours, or until you crave the famous Berlin Currywurst (the best way for it, BTW, is halfway between the Brandenburg Gate and the Reichstag, in my opinion). Remember that you can also ask for tea and coffee making facilities brought up to your room for free. There has been much discussion over the bathtub not being separated from the room. As I don’t believe most people go into interior décor while booking a hotel, I’ll skip it. There is a curtain (as you can see in my attached photo) and really it has never disturbed me. Internet is a bit of a problem. There are three computers in the lobby (remember it’s a huge hotel with over 900 rooms…) and Wi-Fi in the room. All options cost money. To sum up, a lovely hotel, excellent location, great breakfast and a friendly staff. I have stayed here many times and will keep coming here. I love it!

Reviews.Title: “Not good enough...”
Reviews.Author: contactmagic
Reviews.Content: We did a last minute night in Berlin a couple weeks ago at this hotel. We couldn't be too picky because that would involve driving around all night looking for a nice hotel. We saw this one and it seemed good enough so we got a price (125euro for one night). We had no choice really so we took the offer, which in my experience with hotel bookings is not a great price for a 3 1/2 star hotel. But we accepted this. It was our disorganisation that brought us here. When we saw the room, we were at a loss for words, for just a moment. To round up the room, it was about 20m2, ok interior design, good view... but the shower, toilet and basin were IN the room. You slept literally under a meter from the basin, woke up to this view. The shower and toilet were simply glassed in, with half frost, so that the other occupant could just have a wee peak while you do number two. The shower and toilet had a shared door so that you can only use either the toilet or shower at the same time. It was appalling for the price. And to top it off, the wireless internet was 6-8 euros for a short period of use. I'm still not over the whole experience. The staff were friendly enough. But it's robbery to take 125euro's for such a room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but exhibitionist showers..”
Reviews.Author: goldfisharenice
Reviews.Content: My parents chose this hotel while my wife and I visited Berlin with them.. nice centrally located hotel overall, pleasant staff, and modern rooms.. the only odd thing for me personally was the glass showers.. I felt unless I used the shower curtain, all I needed was a stripper pole, and I could've given my wife a show.. interesting idea architecturally, but a turn-off personally.. Our room, while on the 15th floor, also had umpa music from the square below, with no fans in the room to drown it out.. a nice stay beyond these comments though..

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: andy139
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay at the Park Inn, but nothing about the hotel stood out as particularly exceptional. Overall, I would consider it just above average, but the value for money, the location, and the views from the upper floors makes it worth a stay.
