My major complaint would be the noise from what seemed to be the hotel’s ventilation system. It made a very annoying and rather loud tone that sounded similar to a vacuum cleaner running in the distance. The tone would be heard for approximately 15 seconds, then stop for 5, and then start again. This was continuous for the whole stay. The noise could be heard throughout the building. I had to use earplugs to sleep as once I focused on the noise it was impossible to sleep. We had few minor problems with the room: The room was quite dusty. I don’t think it had been used in a while, as there was a soft layer of dust over everything. Other than that, it was very clean. The satellite/cable signal on the television kept cutting out. I don’t go on a trip to watch television, but trying to watch the morning news can be a little annoying when the TV keeps going on and off. There were only two English language channels, one of which was France24. There was no heating. There was a temperature control dial on the wall, but it was not functional. The room was very cold at night, but the bedding was very warm which made sleeping comfortable. The cold room was very noticeable when stepping out of the shower into the cool air. The ‘bathroom’ is within the bedroom area of the hotel room. There are no walls separating the ‘bathroom’ from the room itself. For privacy, there is long shower curtain that can be pulled across the width of the hotel room to separate the bathroom area from the bed. The toilet is located in it’s own small cubical. Despite the minor problems with the room and the bizarre noise, there were many good aspects to the hotel: This hotel is in an excellent location - great links to public transport, within walking distance of many sights, and many restaurants and bars nearby. The staff members at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. The receptionist allowed us to check in to our room a few hours early, this was excellent as it saved us having to carry our luggage around and allowed us a few extra hours of sightseeing time.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: axel m
Reviews.Content: A great location for this big hotel in Berlin. Very convenient for any place to be reached, just in front of the main train station of Alexanderplatz. the room was nice and simple, but comfortable and with a great view on the city. Spectacular terrace on the top, where to spend the time for a nice drink. The only bad point was the Wi-fi, which was extremely expensive, 6 euros for 1 hour!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: samppa
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for five nights. The location is fantastic and if you are lucky (I wasn't) or rich (I'm not) you can get a room with a view in the direction of the massive TV-tower. The room was not very large but that did not bother me, as I mainly only slept in the room. The room design was somewhat exotic with the shower booth having a transparent wall located almost at the side of the bed (see the photos). There is apparently a curtain, but I noticed it only several days after I checked-in... To go up with the elevators you need your room card. During several occasions the card refused to work, but the personell explained to me that keeping the card next to a cell phone may deactivate it. The service was very friendly and nice. I guess there are two breakfast areas ("buisness" area on the ground floor and for "common"(?) people on the 1st floor). I had a breakfast on the ground floor and was very satisfied with it (I've never seen before such a huge variety of teas). For the summary, I recommend the hotel, both for location and service and price as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ako
Reviews.Content: Just returned with 7 friendson a long weekend. Hotel is right by train station and out of the hotel is a great square with market stalls and large beer garden (good laugh here). Within walking distance lots of nice retsaurants and bars. You can get a day pass for the train which was great. We booked a walking tour which I found on trip advisor and that was well worth it. Also took a river cruise for 3 hours brilliant but only German commentary, although I asked the tour guide for help and he leant me a home made picture journal which was invaluable. The hotel serves a great breakfast and as anther review poins out its hard to get lost as for the height of the hotel. Only downside was I emailed in advance for high rooms and did not get them also the check in clerk said we could not book in as we were too early only to find out later the same people in our queue actually booked in. There were 8 of us and obiously too much trouble for her Would I use the hotel again ? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Thoughts”
Reviews.Author: oliver w
Reviews.Content: I have mixed thoughts on this hotel. The plus points are defiantly its location near the train station and very close to an underground stop. Also its massive, one of the tallest buildings in Berlin which is handy because if you get lost you can find your way back! The rooms in the hotel are quite small. They also have the now infamous glass shower in the middle of the room (rather than a separate bathroom) so make sure you visit with somebody you like… I would add that the toilet is in its own room! The hotel is quite hot and we were on the wrong side (i.e. not overlooking the city but a rather grey concrete lump of city (which sums up much of Berlin). All in all, reusable base to explore from but not somewhere you would want to spend much time.

Reviews.Title: “Great convenient choice”
Reviews.Author: immer-sonnig
Reviews.Content: Park Inn is in a great location near a station stop. We were very happy with the room. Clean and comfortable. Perfect for business travel. Breakfast was exceptional - they have everything you could want. Concierge was very helpful. No issues checking in. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons.”
Reviews.Author: mstryde
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is it's central location. It's right across the street from the metro station and there are tons of shops, restaurants, malls and grocery stores nearby. Overall the hotel was nice, nothing special and definitely not worth the money. When we arrived there was a huge line up of about 20 odd people in front of us with about 4 staff working to check everyone in. It wasn't too long of a wait, maybe 15 minutes. The hotel is HUGE and therefore almost everytime we went through the lobby there was always a line up of people either checking in or out. It was a very crowded hotel that's for sure. The room was nothing special, European standards, small and compact but clean. The only complaint I have about the room is that the maids never once changed over our sheets in our 5 nights there. The towels were replaced daily and the room cleaned. There is a safe and a mini fridge.There are NO english chanels besides France 24 news, so get used to watching a lot of news. There are movies available on demand, at a price of course, like everything in this hotel. The price of wifi is CRAZY. It is not available in your room either, so you have to go down to the rather crowded lobby to use it. We bought a 45 minute card which gave us access to their computers and that cost us 10 euros. The bathroom downstairs regardless of what the staff say DOES charge you regardless if you are a guest. Nowhere on that sign does it say that guests do not have to pay. Now mind you, I went in once without change and never paid and the lady sitting outside never said anything to me but they look at you and watch you expectantly waiting for that 50 cents. This is the case in most public areas in Berlin. In the mall, at tourist locations, in the restaurants, they all sit outside the door with a sign with the price and a plate for you to pay...so have change on hand. It's never been more than 50 cents anywhere we went. We never had the breakfast the hotel offered as it was 19 euros, per person, per day which is insane, instead we bought some bread, fruit and cheese from a nearby grocery store which cost us about 15 euros and lasted us the whole 5 days. There is another restaurant in the hotel towards the back and a Burger King directly attached as well so you won't go hungry thats for sure. The staff at the front desk are not overly happy in my opinion. There was one point on the day we checked out that we had a bit of an emergency with the shuttle service and my husband asked the lady at the front if we could use the phone to call the company, she said no problem, showed him the phone and how to dial, he tried a few times but it was busy, so I went back a few minutes later to try again and after I got off the phone the lady behind the desk literally snatched it away from me and gave me the WORST look. She asked if I were a guest, I said I had just checked out and then she was SO rude in telling me that I had to PAY to use the phone, for the whole 2 minutes I was on it, after the other staff member showing my husband how to use it and saying it was fine. It was very embarressing how she reacted towards me and I had to pay the 85 cents!! I thought this was absurd, I just spent over $600 euros to stay at your hotel for 5 nights and you are making me pay your 85 cents? Her reaction and how rude she was to me was enough to make me never want to stay here again. Overall the hotel was clean and nice but way to expensive for what they offer. However, the staff are much to impersonal for me and the prices of the breakfast, wifi and the crowds just did it in for me. I'm sure there are a lot nicer, cheaper hotels nearby that would be better and in keeping with this location.

Reviews.Title: “Superb views and quirky modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: DutchLassie70
Reviews.Content: We had asked for a room on one of the top floors facing west and were not disappointed by the fabulous view of the city. Even though the room was not very big, it was large enough for the two of us. Windows don't open up though Breakfast was fine and had everything you'd expect. The bathroom consisted of a glas cubicle in the room whic might not suit colleagues travelling together, Good shopping in the area and close to public transport. Take the bus 100 to see the whole city. I would return here next time I visit Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: Comedinewithmegalway
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Berlin for my partners birthday. Flew in on Ryanair (barf) but made a seamless transition to Alexabderplatz. I can't stress how great this place is. 2 minutes away from transport that will take you anywhere you need to go, shopping, bars, Burger King (very handy) and so so much more! The hotel is beautiful, the room was comfy and well laid out. We didn't care that we could see each other shower although if you're travelling with friends, you may want to re-think this (although you can draw a curtain). Excellent views of Berlin. Breakfast was included in our rate which was ok. Its not a hot breakfast really. I enjoyed the huge selection of sliced meats, cheese and bread. I made many many lunches from breakfast! :) Berlin is such an awesome city and this hotel makes it an even better experience. Search the discount websites for this to make it even better value. You won't be disappointed! PERFECT for couples!

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Cosmimi
Reviews.Content: The Park Inn Berlin is located in the center of the city next to the Alexanderplatz. You can reach the parliamant buildung (Reichstag) and the Brandenburger Tor within a few minutes by using the subway. Several shopping malls are available in the hotels neighbourhood. Though the hotel is from outside not looking that good, it has a modern core. The lobby and the restaurant are modern designed and my room was well equiped. The cleanlyness of my bathroom was also ok. Regarding the cheap rate, it is really a recommandable accomodation. I will choose the Park Inn again for future stays.

Reviews.Title: “hotel food”
Reviews.Author: quarms
Reviews.Content: the buffet style menu was second to none .breakfast was out of this world everything you could imaging including smoked salmon. evening meal of the same standard only thing missing were biscuits for cheese. super !!!

Reviews.Title: “Top Spot - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: mcribbin
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel for its location and Decor. The room was a little bit small but it was spotless and well furnished. The lobby area is spacious and modern and the staff were very helpful. The surrounding area is safe and good for walking. All sights are within reach. We were after travelling from Amsterdam and were delighted with the rates for a hotel of this quality. It was actually cheaper than poor quality hotels in Amsterdam and Paris. We loved our stay here and hope to return again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great location but the rooms are small”
Reviews.Author: Business_or_leisure
Reviews.Content: First of all, the rooms and the desks look great, but are very small. Especially the desk. If you open your laptop and want some small space for your hand to write on it comfortably, the laptop will not fit under FIXED desk lamp. Super stupid. If the the lamp was 10cm higher, all would be fine. Not sure if this is in all rooms or only in renovated rooms. My room seemed newer and had bigger TV, but in return there was no mini bar, which definitelly was in some older rooms. Lobby is ok. LOCATION IS EXCELLENT! If price is good, I recommend this hotel. Especially if you dont plan to work long at the desk in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Smilingguest
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife for five nights in mid August 2011. Arrived at 11.30am and told that although room was ready, we could not check in. Allowed to leave luggage and told to come back after 2.00pm. On return, check-in was efficient if not particularly welcoming. Rooms are bright and clean but certainly on the small side. Had high room with views over city. Had to ask for extra pillows - one each provided. Room had safe which was hidden in side table on the floor between bed and wall - squeeze to get to when lying on floor. Lots of people have commented on built-in bathroom before. Glass walls in bedroom with one door shared between shower and toilet - not recommended to use toilet if good friend having shower. Provided with very small gel for one shower per person per day. For the variety available, breakfast scores well. Huge dining room with plenty of staff and food. Bit of a scrum at times if you go at the wrong times. Again, staff here are efficient if not particularly friendly. Large bar on ground floor is usually empty. Did notice that this hotel caters for a lot of over-nighters - large bus parties that seem to come and go and this impacts on bar, restauarant etc. Biggest plus for hotel is location. Backs on to Alexanderplatz and the train station - go anywhere in Berlin. Also close to Berlin Dom, Unter Den Linden and Marionkirche. I booked on web for B&B basis and paid same price as hotel wanted for room only. Would go back if the price was right but only with wife/good friend in view of bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding hotel :-) breakfast amazing :-) cant wait to return :-)”
Reviews.Author: richiemurch
Reviews.Content: excellent location :-) excellent breakfast :-) excellent staff :-) excellent room :-) excellent bar :-) fantastic city to vist with loads of history :-) great christmas markets :-) all round amazing experiance :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, super view, ok room, lovely hotel lounge, good location”
Reviews.Author: zenpotter
Reviews.Content: Just besides 3-4 big shopping centers, most things are at this place, Starbucks closeby. We really had a good time here, but we also travelled around in Berlin, its all the transportation you need here, above or underground.

Reviews.Title: “Going back this Christmas!”
Reviews.Author: Herts15
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed here for the christmas markets and hasten to say we've booked again for this year! The second you enter the building you feel incredibly safe with onsite security guards, staff at reception With big friendly smiles and rooms that are immaculate!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: ThePirateWitch
Reviews.Content: Yes, the bathroom is a bit odd but our room (or our sons room) did not flood when using the shower, which was a lovely strong shower and the toilet behind frosted glass was not an issue. The rooms were a good size, with comfortable beds and great storage. The view from our room (3329) was amazing, you could see for miles. We did not eat at the hotel (breakfast was not included and is expensive) but there are so many places round the hotel to go. We liked going over the the Galleria Department Store, there is a cafe next door, Burger King and snack places to fit every taste. The reception staff and concierge were helpful and even helped me print my boarding passes for our return journey (you do not need to pay for Internet to do this). If Internet is a problem, there are plenty of Starbucks about use theirs, it's free. Concierge was so useful, transport tickets and advice, directions, bus tours and a little gift/essentials shop. Location is the best thing with this hotel, being so close to all means of public transport means that Berlin is amazingly accessable. The U bahn (2 mins walk), S bahn (4 mins walk) and buses (5 mins walk) on on your door step, the airport is a bus journey away (possibly the easiest journey from an airport ever and the cheapest). The surrounding area has a few shops and a massive shopping centre is just over 5 mins walk away, we didn't find this until our last day :(. Outside the hotel does seem to attract groups of youth but they are just sitting on the steps in the square, they did not bother us or cause any issue, they do not come into or anywhere near the hotel. I will go back to Berlin (this was our second visit) and I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amenities average, abit of a disappointment for 5*”
Reviews.Author: sara2687
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We wont lie to feeling a bit disappointed when we entered our room. It was very basic and small and the bathroom was kind of in the room with the bathroom which was a bit weird and because of this, when we took showers, it flooded half of the bedroom! We stayed on the 33rd floor which was a great view. The bed was so well used that either side was slanting so if either my husband or I slept on the edge we would fall out so ended up having to sleep in the middle which was hot and uncomfortable. No free wi-fi which was a disappointment and was expensive to buy and no English channels on the TV except the news except one film channel to buy. The staff were all friendly and helpful and even though Alexanderplatz was a good location, we didnt particulary feel safe there at night and the whole area needed a bit of a renovation! Alot of "youths" were hanging out by the entrance to the hotel day and night and was abit intimidating to be honest! We got on the TXL bus to and the airport and this was easy and cheap!

Reviews.Title: “A few tips...”
Reviews.Author: Divehigirl
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for public transportation. Very friendly staff. Late check-out possible on Sundays at 1800, which is very convenient. The rooms are small, and the bathroom is in the room, i.e. when you step out of the shower, you are in the room, so TIP #1: dry yourself while still in the shower booth, otherwise you'll have a wet floor in your room. Breakfast pretty basic and NOT cheap, so TIP #2: pay for room only and have breakfast somewhere else (f.ex. the small café next to the hotel entrance on Alexanderplatz).

Reviews.Title: “OK but we will not go back”
Reviews.Author: Petite32
Reviews.Content: We satyed for 2 nights. The room was nice, very clean, great bed, but the bathroom is not user friendly. No door, just a curtain to separate it from the rest of the room. The door to the toilets is not isolated. Great view from the terrace (40th floor) but you have to pay 3 euros to access it even if you are staying at the hotel! Breakfast is OK but nothing special. This is a huge hotel, no character at all and definitly not intimate. Great location. Really easy access to and from Schönfeld airport and also to the main attractions by subway, bus or by foot. If we go back to Berlin we will not stay at Park inn but we will stay in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty typical big hotel”
Reviews.Author: eskimodave
Reviews.Content: Pretty standard for an expensive hotel. Nice clean room, good bathroom. No free wifi, and internet downstairs was very expensive. Great location, car rental right next door, train station 5 minutes walk away and tourist buses a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Laurspa
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and the rooms were modern and clean. The breakfast was very expensive for what we got at the buffet and the internet access was out of the ball park expensive (19 euro/day). The location was great; close to many buses, metro, shopping, restaurants and Hombolt University.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent once again”
Reviews.Author: Dol123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located. Very easy to reach from Schonefeld Airport on the Express Airport train (35-40 mins). . The train station is only 5 mins away from hotel. Next to the hotel is an excellent department store where you can buy anything you may have forgotten - or even if the weather is unexpectedly hot (or cold) a much needed item of clothing. We did buy food and wine here too. Once again the reception staff were very helpful-this is the 5th time we have stayed here and they have always been accommodating and helpful. Room: Brilliant, with city view. Modern, clean and very comfortable bed. I am not going to say anything negative about the bathroom facilities because the glass walls don't bother us at all and I don't understand why people comment about it when they know that's the hotel design before they visit? Berlin is a great city and I would highly recommend this hotel. It's just what we like - good location, friendly staff, clean rooms and always a good night sleep. I am sure we will visit again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: sally123stockport
Reviews.Content: we have stayed in berlin on 3 seperate occations and this was the best hotel. staff were very friendly room was on a corner so really good views over berlin plenty of shops right on the door step an eating places. good for getting about as the train station is directly opposite the square very clean and tidy otel we loved the fact the bathroom was open plan so could watch the televion while having a bath may be off putting if your not with partner or new to each other although you can pull a curtain across but this is accessible from bedroom side over experiance very pleasent stay would return and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Hallo Berlin!!!”
Reviews.Author: elenaAthens
Reviews.Content: Me and my mom stayed at Park Inn before Christmas!!!Christmas lights, sweets and sausages all over Berlin!!!And white days!!!It snowed every day!!!I believe Berlin is the ideal place to be in christmas!!Park Inn is a huge resort.We had a room at 33 floor with amazing views at tv tower and christmas markets all over!!!we booked through otel.com an unbelievable price!!!Breakfast was very good. Next to the hotel there is a nice place where you can have coffee take away.Just outside there was a huge christmas market, where its difficult to choose what to try or to buy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel central to the sights”
Reviews.Author: nannerp
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a standard double room on the 33rd floor. The room itself was typical, not over the top, but not disappointing either. The only thing that we found a bit strange was the positioning of the bathroom. It isn't surrounded by walls, but instead, is enclosed in semi-frosted glass. Most of it wasn't transparent, but you could definitely walk by and look in if you wanted. It didn't bother us, but if you really crave privacy in the restroom, it could be a little awkward. The one thing that sold us on this hotel though was the location. We enjoy walking and almost all of the sights we went to were close enough to walk to. Another plus is the really nice breakfast bar; definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Best location worst service”
Reviews.Author: medoc143
Reviews.Content: I have been there for 5 days .location is the best for tourists, but if facilities and cleanliness is important for you, forget it. my room was freezing and nobody came and fixed it .they said always so sorry.when i checked out ,they told me sorry for 100times,as you can see in the website.enough is enough.Please dont say sorry for me.I donot need your apologize,do something for your hilarious service.

Reviews.Title: “Big hotel, good base for a few days.”
Reviews.Author: Pippped
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 days and it was fine - suiited my requirements - comfortable, some space, in a convenient location and not too expensive. Ate at the restaurant twice and food was good. This hotel is not a stunning beauty but a very large, good value convenient hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a Berlin short trip”
Reviews.Author: locheil
Reviews.Content: Huge hotel, good facilities, seemed a mix of business and tourists. Rooms have fantastic views across Berlin. They are very functional and not particularly large but great value for a centrally located city hotel. Restaurant bar a bit pricey but restaurant is very good and the service is very efficient. the big attraction of this hotel is the central location in Alexanderplatz. For a tourist trying to take in Berlin and the surrounding area, Potsdam etc being so close to all the transport hubs and good links to the Airport meant we could make the most of a busy schedule.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and well priced”
Reviews.Author: ILOVEHOLIDAYS2009
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with friends back in march for a weekend away in Berlin. It is a two minute walk from the train station. It is walking distance from the centre of Berlin. The tourist bus runs directly across the road from the main reception. It is well worth to go on in this tour. As it stops at all the main tourist attractions in berlin. The hotel rooms are up to the Park Inn standards. They are compact but very comfortable. The shower was very strong as well. The staff were very friendly. But the hotel bar is your typical hotel bar, So i did not drink in it. There was no free wifi in the hotel. The internet on the terminals in reception was quite expensive. I would recommend this hotel to visitors to Berlin. Their is a large radio tower opposite this hotel. So you can see it from anywhere in Berlin. So you will never have any problems finding the hotel. Their is a shopping centre around a five minute walk from the hotel. Where you can purchase beers, water etc very cheaply. I would recommend this rather than using the shops in the train station. Their is a fantastic kebab shop at the end of the shops in the train station in alexander platz. They are delicious, but not very healthy. Berlin was a really fantastic place for a break. I would give it a nine out of ten as a destination.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: annrosso
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a nice accommodation in its own right, but its biggest asset is its location. It is within walking distance of many of former East Berlin's best sites, it is on the Alexanderplatz with many shops, cafes, and restaurants--plus many talented buskers playing on the plaza! If you fly into Tegel, Park Inn is across the street from a bus stop for the TXL bus which transports you for just over 2 euros. (25 euros for a taxi) Great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Chamberlain1
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean and modern. Easy to reach from airport. Very convenient for transport links and many sightseeing attractions. Sightseeing bus stops outside hotel. I would definitely recommend and return next time in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Weird Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: pilotHampshire
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok and the staff also but those bathrooms were so weird with their glass walls. We always went to the public toilets downstairs when we could as its a bit off being in the loo in the living room with just a glass wall between you. I hear the Germans dont mind this. The hotel is ideally placed and clean. The lifts go a long way up but very fast. Berlin is fantastic but cant understand why they want a monument to celebrate their reunification when they are broke. The place is full of monuments. We found the food to be quite good and there is plenty to eat but don't try to take any with you for later as they have been known to chase people and charge them. We quite enjoyed our stay there and the building site outside at the time wasn't so bad and we didn't use that side of the hotel much. We were high up in the clouds and could see a lot of the city. The station is near and the trams with easy access to shops. I would go back there as its so handy for the city.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive, but you get what you pay for ...”
Reviews.Author: billygoat001
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in July. Alexanderplatz is the new chic part of Berlin, located in the center of what was once East Berlin. The hotel is large, very large ... huge by European standards, and has the feel of claustrophobic, cheap, Las Vegas hotel. Nothing quaint, charming or inviting about this hotel. The rooms are small, a little run down, with a weird glass enclosed shower in the room, and NOT in the bathroom. Expect huge crowds of guests/tourists since a lot of tour buses stop here. The only positive aspects are location, and central air conditioning (still a rarity in Europe). If you can book this hotel at a decent price ($60-70) a night, go for it. Otherwise it's a toss of the coin. Definitely NOT a 4 star hotel as it's advertised. Also, the internet connection is very expensive, 18 Euros a day. No wifi in the rooms, only in the lobby and you have to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room”
Reviews.Author: Eventtectraveler
Reviews.Content: I had a reasonable priced single room on one of the upper floors, the sight was great. The room itself was tiny, one of the tiniest I ever had. Worst thing was, that the TV was mountd to the wall in a way that made it imposible to watch it from the bed. It is annoying to sit on a chair if you want to watch TV. Another thing is, that it takes very long before you get hot water out of the shower. Also the polocy of pricing several services is to be questionned. If you booked a cheap room rate, the welness area will not be included, you´ll have to pay an extra fee. Location is perfect, directly on Alexanderplatz, right in the middle of the city, staff was friendly. Alltogether a nice hotel in a perfect location for a city trip to Berlin, but one should stay away from the cheapest rates and the standard single rooms. I´d have expexted a little more from a park inn hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nothing more than a dormitory”
Reviews.Author: matuk78
Reviews.Content: Overall quite disappointing. The hotel is a tall tower in the middle of a building site, very impersonal, hoards of tourists in organized tours, guests are treated as numbers. The rooms are extremely small, design pretends to be chic but it clearly looks cheap, do not stay here if you are slightly claustrophobic. Pictures in their website are certainly misleading. A very average experience that, as it happened to me, can be quite expensive too (160Eur/night).

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for sightseen tour”
Reviews.Author: maximich
Reviews.Content: really good situation - close to U-Bahn / S-Bahn / Tram / Bus we lived on the 21 floor - nice view breakfasts was really good hotel is very popular and it seems it's impossible to have there early check-in and late check out.... hotel is no-smoking area and it's prohibited to smoke anywhere, so i had to go out from 21 floor down and outside just for have my sigarette. and another problem - around 9 a.m. relly rush hours in elevators. they are totally full! and easy to go from 21 flor to 33 and then to 0 floor than catch the free space in elevator from upstairs. Glass wall to shower and toilet is strange a little, but no problem for me. Meanwhile it's possible to close the curtain between room and shower. Anyway I can recomend this hotel for travellers who want to visit Berlin and see as much as it's possible and free to go by any public transport

Reviews.Title: “Worth it for the Views Alone”
Reviews.Author: jemipie
Reviews.Content: This was a very reasonably priced option for us. We checked in early with no problems and were soon being whisked up by the amazingly fast elevator to the 33rd floor! The room was a little odd, semi frosted windows marked the bathroom from the bedroom, but that was fine as I was with my husband. Bed could have been bigger but was v. confortable (firm) and the windows opened so there was no need to depend on air con - always a bonus. We didn't breakfast in the hotel, choosing instead to explore - we found the department store just over the square - the Galleria - had a great buffet restaurant on the top floor with amazing views and great food - Sekt for 1 euro a glass too if you really want to push the boat out. We signed up for a late check out (25 euro for 6pm departure, nice option) Aside from some hiccups when our key got cancelled prior to our departure and a bit of a wait getting our left luggage back we really enjoyed staying in this hotel. Another small gripe is that there is no wifi in rooms and English speaking tv is severely limited; News, yawn. That aside, staff were lovely, Aplatz is a great location and we'd stay here again. We had a Panorama room and it was ace.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest hotel we have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: TomandEmma
Reviews.Content: Good points: -The hotel was in a very good location with train, underground and tram links on our doorstep. -The bar staff were very friendly and the bar offers a nice relaxed atmosphere Bad points: -The bathrooms seem to be designed more for show than for function. The shower leaks all over the foor as te glass panels do not cover the shower area. The toilet is very noisy and as the room and bathroom are not seperated by walls(just glass) the noise carries even more. -The restaurants are very over priced for what they offer and the restaurant staff are probably the rudest Ive ever encountered. - If you are in the bar or lobby and need the toilet I would go up to your room as they charge you for using the toilet! -The beds also seemed to be more designed for style than for comfort, the headboards are about a foot wide. -The 'gym' contains two running machines, a cycle and a cross trainer. Overall it wasn't an awful experience but we would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel we've ever used, ruined Berlin for us”
Reviews.Author: carl20
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here if you value privacy. The bathrooms are a statement of design over function. The toilet door is one big sheet of glass and doesn't lock, the shower is open to the room and is mostly glass and the sink is in the corridor leading from the entrance door to the bed. I can't think of a less practicle bathroom. Obviously I complained and was offered a different room with a self contained bathroom. This self contained bathroom had glass walls! Clear glass walls! After much arguing with the manager I ended up paying an extra 75 Euros for a junior suite (for 3 nights). Originally they tried to charge me 120 euros and also told me to go and find another hotel! So in summary, the staff were mostly sullen and probably wouldn't smile if they were tickled, the rooms were stuffy as the inner windows opened slightly but the outer windows were completely sealed, the bathrooms were designed for an exhibitionist and the basics that you expect from a hotel (privacy, comfort, customer service, politeness) are totally non-existent. Berlin itself was wonderful, I loved the city. Unfortunately our romantic trip was undermined by the Radisson Park Inn trying to make me and my girlfriend defecate infront of each other. Truly terrible hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very central”
Reviews.Author: johnnugent
Reviews.Content: Really nice time had by us all. The Berlinners were so very friendly

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, excellent view of city to the horizon”
Reviews.Author: Maikle
Reviews.Content: Good central location at Alexanderplatz in the old East Berlin beside the Berlin television tower. The hotel is clean with friendly staff who provide good service. The views from the bedroom are excellent. Local transport links are good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Little_Miss_Aero_Eng
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in May with my boyfriend for a weekend in May 2011. We picked this hotel because it offered views of the TV tower and it was located in the city center. When we arrived we were given a room on a high floor and just as we were admiring our TV tower view some fella fell past our window!!! We quickly noticed the cables and read the sign on the window telling us the hotel offering a free fall experience. Its extremely hard to relax when someone is flying past your window screaming "WHHHHOOOOOOO"!! As well as that the cables create a considerable amount of irritating noise from swooshing in the wind. This goes on all day, and they start testing the equipment early in the morning which makes a lot of noise too. If you do intend to stay make sure you ask for a room away from this. The rooms are very cramped and in order to get more space the shower and sink are all in the bathroom which just a curtain for privacy, it didn't bother us but if you were staying with friends it would be quite uncomfortable. The TV is small and old so the sound quality is quite poor. You can get bathrobes and slippers (something I love) by ringing housekeeping and the beds are quite comfortable. The breakfast offers a lot of choice but it is quite bland and a bit expensive considering it was cooked about 2 hours ago. The restaurant in the lobby is ok, nothing special, overpriced again but I suppose all hotels are. The room service was a real disappointment! We rang and asked for room service and this is the conversation went: "Sorry room service stops at 10. Oh ok and what time is it now? Ahh its 1 minute past 10" They refused to serve us despite the time and the fact that it doesn't tell you anywhere what time room service finishes, so we had to get dressed an leave in search of a restaurant which are not plentiful in Alexanderplatz. The hotel is located in the city center but all the best restaurants, tourist attractions, bars clubs etc are located elsewhere so maybe this wasn't such a good choice. Decide what you want to do and pick your hotel and area accordingly. We decided to rent bikes underneath the TV tower and spent all our time in other parts of the city. I feel like I was extremely overcharged by this hotel and I will not be returning again. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LolaSweden
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location! Nice clean and well equipped rooms. Helpful staff. Delicious breakfast with all kind of food: eggs, sausages, cereals, fruit, yogurts, cereals, salmon, ...everything! Probably the best high quality tea selection ever in a hotel. Only critique is for the internet that is extra charged. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Part of my tour to Vienna, Prague and Berlin”
Reviews.Author: tcdeeone
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in many Radisson Hotels around the WorId, I had expected this Hotel to be much the same standard. What a disappointment. This was a tall gray hotel building of some 35 floors in East Berlin that may have been refurbished after reunification. The rooms were small with an en-suite shower and toilet that was anything but private. Separated only by glass between the bedroom and the toilet, guests had no personal privacy at all. If you sat on the toilet you faced a wardrobe mirror and there was only one glass door for either the toilet or the shower. Imagine the reaction from guests when they walked into the room! !. The reception staff were in the main helpful, but don't expect any help regarding unworkable TV's etc. The concierge was very helpful and knowledgeable. The ground floor lobby of the hotel had a front and rear entrance/exit that was accessible by all and sundry. Beggars wandered into the lobby at regular intervals from the rear exit that leads onto a rather noisy square. There was a Burger King Restaurant in the lobby at the rear and a 50p charge for hotel guests using the lobby toilet !! Dining was good and access to East and West Berlin very easy by # 100 or 200 bus and the metro or tram. Berlin seemed to be rather a sad gray place and local people appeared quite serious. If I returned I would choose another hotel further into the city or nearer to the river Spree.

Reviews.Title: “Park Inn Alexanderplatz”
Reviews.Author: Wil04
Reviews.Content: While the Park Inn on Alexanderplatz is undoubtably in a great location, its a bit of a soulless hotel experience. The room I had was a corner room, which made it really bright and gave great views out over Berlin. Unfortunately they don't seem to believe that couples might want a bit of privacy from one another when they are in the bathroom as there was only a an ill-fitting curtain shielding the bathroom from the rest of the room and the toilet was attached to this. I hope to visit Berlin again but will keep my eyes out for something with a little more character and privacy in future.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good location, service and facilities”
Reviews.Author: derekn093
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel along with our Easyjet tickets. Location: The train from Schonefeld takes 22min to the Alexanderplatz railway station which is 150m from the hotel. There is a U Bahn entrance 50m from the hotel and it is a 10 min walk to the numerous fine eateries in the Nikolai Viertel. A 5 min walk takes you to the TV tower which is the meeting point for the Bike Tour (recommended). Service: Efficient check in by friendly staff, helpful concierge. We were able to keep our room until 7pm on our departure day (Sunday). Facilities: Our room was clean, well equipped and the bed was comfortable. The open plan "washroom" is unusual but not a problem - there's a curtain for the shy types. (The WC is enclosed). A minor flaw is that the window curtian lets in too much light. The breakfast is extensive, generous and requires self control. As a senior couiple we were very happy with our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very good price”
Reviews.Author: marinasweden
Reviews.Content: Iäve stayed at the hotel Park Inn by Alexanderplatz twice, once in october 2008 and once in May 2011. The hotel is situated in a great location with walking distance to the lovely area Mitte with lots of restaurants and shops. Both tube ad S-bahn is just outside the hotel so it is very easy to get around. This was very convenient when flying with ryan air and then taking the s-bahn directly to the hotel in 20 minutes. The hotel is well equipped and with nice rooms with an overall good standard. The shower has glass doors so this might be a minus if your not travelling as a couple. The breakfast buffe is amazing, the best I've ever had! A minus for not providing free internet access and the pricing for using the wrireless was ridicolously high!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean & nice hotel. useless concierge and weird toilets”
Reviews.Author: rosiem333
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect for a city break in Berlin and is an easy train ride from the airport or S/U-bahn, bus or 25 minute walk to sites like the Reichstag/Brandenburg gate etc. The rooms were clean and view was great from 23rd floor, the only problem was having the bath in the middle of the room with no proper door. We got this hotel on a top secret deal so for the price (under £100 for two nights) it was briliant value for money. the concierge was rude and unhelpful, they wouldnt look up a restaurant when we asked where somewhere was and they didnt know. luckily the receptionist was fantastic and did it for us instead. Go on a walking tour when you arrive, they leave at 10am and 1pm everyday from Brandenburg Gate's Starbucks. they are free and survive through tips (5-10 E is usually plenty) good way to get your bearings, see the sights and learn a lot int he meantime.

Reviews.Title: “very nice view, not the newest mattrace”
Reviews.Author: econtraveler
Reviews.Content: the hotel is an old, highrising east german hotel property on alexanderplatz. all interiors have been nicely redone and the views from the rooms are a treat (i was on the 11th floor). only my mattress felt a little worn out.

Reviews.Title: “What a disaster...”
Reviews.Author: joistori
Reviews.Content: ok, we came in on airlines points programme, but expectyed service anyway... we got rooom number 3513 which had a fabulous view over city..but that was it. you couldn't sleep in the morning because of the noice from the banging of the doors of the service people figthting the service room next door. The room was terrible small. I guess we got the odd number becuse of coming in on points but, hey, this shouldn't be allowed for grownups... toilet and shower inside the room... f..k... we had to send eachother downstairs for the heavy s..t... no, never and I am a regular fan of Park Inn's... i'm never stayin'g again at Park Inn Alexanderplatz, Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “No surprises (if you know your room mate well), good value”
Reviews.Author: hak2269
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate for this hotel, which is a standard high rise so we knew what to expect. We had read about the odd bathrooms in reviews before we booked, but as it was my boyfriend and I we weren't shy (basically you get glass walls with a curtain to pull around the entire bathroom, so probably best not to book with someone that you don't want to see naked). The hotel was in a great location for transport connections and sightseeing, as it's in the heart of East Berlin. The staff were certainly helpful and friendly, and of course fluent in English. Now that I've been to Berlin once I might stay somewhere with a bit more character on a return trip, but this was really very good value, clean, and met expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid location and acceptable rooms”
Reviews.Author: thesaint01
Reviews.Content: I can only repeat what others have mentioned regarding the location. It is really central, close to Mitte and many of the main sights in Berlin (Museum Island, Brandenburger Tor, Berlin Cathedral etc) as well as the charming area of Prentzlauer Berg. If flying in to Berlin Schönefeld it is very easy to get there by train (3 stops, around 20 minutes and only €3). Alexanderplatz is also a transport hub in Berlin (S-bahn, U-bahn and tram) so it easy to get to other parts of Berlin as well. The hotel is huge but check-in was nonetheless efficient. If possible try to get a room on a high floor as the views are great from the higher floors (if that does not work there is also a terrace on the top floor). The room we had was rather small but efficently planned. The bed was not huge but still enough room for two normal sized persons but it was very soft so not a great bed. The shower and toilet were both behind (separate) glass doors. The shower did have a curtain that sort of could block some of the visibility from the room.The toilet did luckily enough have frosted glass but it is sort of a strange design. The room also had a small desk that was possible to sit and work at. There is no wifi in the room but wired Internet is available but the charges are outrageous, if I remember correctly it was €16 or something like that for 24hr hours. The room also had a (too) small TV, safe (very inconvenient location, have to bend down on floor with high risk of hitting head when getting up). The whole lay-out of the room is done to fit as much as possible in a small space as possible and they have done a decent job. Some annoying things are the lack of water kettle,iron and ironing board (noted info that it was possible to have ironing board sent up to room on request but still prefer to have it in the room). The breakfast buffet was included in our rate and it was better than average. Good selection of hot and cold food. I did like the fact that it was possible to order an omelet. The draw-back was that it was crowded, noisy and also the beverage selection was poor (and the quality of especially the juice was equally poor). All together it is a good option if you do not plan to use Internet at the hotel and do not mind small rooms with soft beds.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal base for basically, everything!”
Reviews.Author: DeetheDub
Reviews.Content: Huge hotel, can be seen for miles. Very central with every mode of transport on your doorstep which makes for hassle free sightseeing. This was my 2nd stay in this hotel and still cant fault. Odd bathroom/WC so don't share with stranger if you're "modest" (frosted glass walls although this time there was a privacy curtain to pull around too which was better!) Very popular hotel with group tours so reception area always bustlng. Rooms spotless and our beds really comfy. Huge buffet breakfast caters for everyone so if you can get a good B&B rate, you're in for a treat. (if not there's a burgerking in the same building and lots of snack places beside the train station, you won't go hungry) The Concierge is a mine of information with perfect english so do wave your sightseeing map at him before you go out the door, he has invaluable tips, travel passes, entry tickets for sights etc that really saved us a lot of stress getting around. Taxi to Airport averaged €30 but S-bahn runs you in or out for €3 each way. If you travel light, and want to start your adventure early, take the train.(one easy change on S9 line) The staff were a right mixture of personalities but overall the good outweigh the surly when you consider the "busy-ness" of the hotel. Will use again as a base next time I go because have nothing bad to say!

Reviews.Title: “Solid offering but no luxury”
Reviews.Author: Flowwolf
Reviews.Content: Very good central location, within walking distance to most city center attraction. Average, smalls rooms, lobby crowded. No Wi-Fi in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vykye
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this for 2 nights hotel after securing a fantastic deal (£33 per night - Hotel's 40th birthday rate) The hotel is centrally located and very accessible to Transport links. Check in was quick and I did not have to wait too long for my room. The room was very nice and clean. The bathroom was very unusual; It was in the room and you had to be careful when showering in order not to flood the room. This was Ok for the 2 nights as was out most of the day anyway. I did not have breakfast in the hotel as was very expensive. There are other cafes in the area that do breakfast. Try the Back Factory - Wide variety of bread rolls, pastry, coffee etc at very reasonable prices. The hotel is within walking distance to Bradenburg Gate, Parliament House (Reichstag), Museum Island, Berlin Cathedral so you do not need to take the Bus/Train. It is better to stay in this area as most of the important Tourist sites are located in the Eastern part rather than the Western part of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel (if you can get deal on room)”
Reviews.Author: Ray-Cork
Reviews.Content: I wanted to get away for weekend for my birthday, some sight seeing and dinner and few drinks and found a great deal on Park Inn website, i was so lucky to get the 40euro room rate for 40th birthday of the hotel. The hotel for my money is in a great area in Alexanderplatz, we only had 3 days there and i wanted to see some of the city, i had booked birthday dinner in the TV tower across from the hotel, if you time it right you can be having dinner in the TV tower when the sun is setting, memorable view i can tell you. The lobby was very busy when we entered, a bus load of tourists had arrived just before us but we were seen to pretty quick, check in was easy and the reception desk staff were nice. The rooms were a little smaller than i had expected but i had the room to myself and even if two were sharing the room, the size was enough, i just expected more room thats all. It was a very modern and clean, we were on the 8th floor overlooking Alexanderplatz. Some really nice reasonable restaurants near the hotel. When i get away for city breaks i like to use the hop on hop off buses to navigate the city, i found them invaluable in Rome and i did in Germany, one of the many operators stops right outside the hotel, a day ticket was 10euro and you could hop on and off at most places and easily back track to the others that it didnt stop at. We got this hotel at a great price, some of the rooms i have seen going for 150euro per night, i wouldnt pay that for it but if you can pick up a special then i cant fault this hotel. The bed was comfy and the room was always clean on our return from our day sight seeing, its a perfect based for exploring the city and a great shopping centre near by if your looking for some retail therapy, your right across from the train station so very handy for getting to hotel and back to the airport. If its night life your after, from what i could gather we were not near the main hub of bars/nightclubs but that wasnt my purpose for the visit to Germany, its nice, its clean, staff are good, its great for the sights and good places to eat out near buy, i would go back again but only when the hotel have special deals. Its well worth it when you get the offers.

Reviews.Title: “Still Good”
Reviews.Author: morgangeth
Reviews.Content: Our third stay In the Park and still good value.location great.and only 3 train stops from the airport which takes 20 min to Alexandra platz..The only "down side" Is the price of a beer and a soft drink In the hotel bar lounge "way over the top"also price of breakfast . But apart from that we would stay here again the location does suit us and very easy to find the hotel from any direction.Please review your bar and breakfast prices .

Reviews.Title: “stay here if you like saggy beds and dirty carpets and no fresh air”
Reviews.Author: auserLondon
Reviews.Content: For the price I paid and the star rating I thought this hotel would be OK. However I was thoroughly disappointed. 1. saggy beds 2. dirty carpet - and filthy remote control which I had to wash with soap and water before I could touch it 3. non functioning air conditioning (there was a thermostat that didn't do anything) and yet the windows didn't open 4. no wireless internet

Reviews.Title: “Good location, acceptable room but few annoyances”
Reviews.Author: cspark
Reviews.Content: Really good location within minutes of the S and U Bahn (I found the public transport system in Berlin to be EXCELLENT by the way, and not at all confusing, I wish it was like this in London). It was also easy to get to the hotel from Tegel airport by the TXL bus which takes about 45 minutes. The hotel itself didn't impress me however- quite a small room, you have to pay extra per night if you want a room with a view of the TV Tower (one of the pulls of this hotel), breakfast was not included and extortionate (go to Back Factory nearby for a cheaper alternative and good coffee). I think there is a gym and sauna in the hotel, but I'm sure there is a fee for this too. For only a touch more money I would have gone to 5* Swissotel which is also in a good location. In summary, ok but not amazing. Best thing about this hotel is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, Great value, Good location”
Reviews.Author: aussiesteve83
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night but the room was brilliant. Location was fantastic. Staff were friendly and helpful. All round great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “An ( 4 star?) hotel for tour bus operators - on a budget”
Reviews.Author: alpinahed
Reviews.Content: Not a very attractive hotel except for those on business or on a tighter budget and staying for no more than a night, The rooms are small and the bathrooms are in the middle of the room area with the shower unit a metre from the beds with only a light curtain to shield one from t'other. Breakfasts are fine but you are a part of a mcahine designed to feed the 5000 - unless that is you are alert to the possibility of a more leisurely and pleasant petit dejeuner in the bar on the reception floor. For the shoppers amongst you prices are good relative to those charged by the same (clothes for ladies) shops in UK and there is a shopping mall ( galleries) right next door to the hotel and connected from the second floor of the hotel by a walkway. There arent enough lifts tocope with the number of guests checking out with suitcases on a friday morning meaning that i was late for my appointment. I waited for seven lifts before there was one I ( unburdened) could bully my way onto ahead of the half dozen other people waiting on my floor laden with their cases. Excellent travel facilities ( rail and U bahn ) really close and withing walking distance of friedrichstrasse shopping street and the river, boat trips and the unter den linden museums. You will need the u bahn for the Kurfurstendam high end shops

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, spotless room, perfect for Museum Island”
Reviews.Author: Zelda48
Reviews.Content: The room was spotlessly clean although the bathroom was a bit strange with just a glass partition so all bathroom noises were heard in the room. The evening buffet in the Humboldt restaurant was excellent value for money but don't bother with the over priced breakfast. There are plenty of food places in the train station for coffee and snacks. The beds were so comfortable. Be warned though the roof terrace for panaramic views is very small with just a dozen or so deck chairs. You have to pay 3 euros and when I went up there were so many people that it was difficult to get a view. Travel from the airport is so easy you can catch a bus that goes straight to Alexander platz.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced , very bad with helping when child had accident.”
Reviews.Author: paultUk
Reviews.Content: Not so great hotel , I would say a little over priced for what you get, no double bed in family room.Bathroom small , very few staff to assist. I had a bad time due to daughters accident and the hotel would not help, I had to get a taxi to go and buy a wheel chair as this hotel does not help or assist if you have an accident. Very unfriendly staff (apart from the 1 girl who called around for us). Not a place for children as no assistance is given.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - great location”
Reviews.Author: mghagens
Reviews.Content: Rising from the heart of Berlin's Alexander Platz, the sunset from the 20th floor was beautiful. The breakfast buffet was very good, and the bar with its very cool sofas was different. I enjoyed every aspect of my stay. well done.

Reviews.Title: “great location, worth coming again”
Reviews.Author: shimonz
Reviews.Content: Great location close to several attractions and to all transportation means. Staff was helpful and room which was too hot was changed quickly and efficiently. Days were hot, I wonder if staying in room in hotter days will be possible without air conditioning. Didn't like the high price for internet connection (should be free nowadays. same as you don't think of charging for hot water in the faucet!)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with weird bathroom”
Reviews.Author: BrazilianCouple1976
Reviews.Content: Location, bed and breakfast are great but the bathroom is really weird. It's impossible not to wet the room while taking a shower and it's separated from the room only by a curtain. that means the room is like a sauna after the shower. But the rooms are new, modern and clean. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: NinaogJohan
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a three night stay at this hotel with our 11 year old. The location of the hotel is perfect! Train and subway at the doorstep, and major sights within walking distance. We had a standard room on the 23th floor. With an extra bed in the room, there was really not much floor space left, but this was not a problem for us. The room was quiet and beds were comfortable. The breakfast buffet was fresh and of good variety. Breakfast was served both at the ground floor and the 1st floor, we found the breakfast room downstairs more attractive. Didn´t use the internet, as the wifi connection at the hotel is unreasonably expensive. We really expect internet connection free of charge at a four star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, but beware of extras”
Reviews.Author: PeteyBLondon
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a stag do because of the location - very central, and ideal for tours around the city. However, we had all requested twin rooms, but most of us were given doubles. Not a huge problem as we're all good friends, but disappointing nonetheless. Beware of "extras" too - the breakfast buffet is EUR19 (needless to say we didn't partake!), use of the sauna is EUR5, and even drinks are EUR5+ for a small beer. They even charge residents EUR3 to get onto the roof terrace!! Staff were businesslike, but surly, and quite snooty and unfriendly. Do not expect service with a smile! Probably brilliant for business travellers, but would not be recommended for a stag do.

Reviews.Title: “"Wonderbar"”
Reviews.Author: SMTM1952
Reviews.Content: Easyjet citybreak hotel the Park Inn, Alexanderplatz, Berlin fitted the bill perfectly. A family birthday celebration thoroughly enjoyed by choosing this hotel. Alexanderplatz Banhof station literally 200m from hotel so easy transfer from airport to hotel. High rise hotel with speedy lift service, rooms compact but clean and comfortable. It should be noted, bath, shower and washbasin are integral to the bedroom, only seperated by a privacy curtain with glass panels for shower etc. Staff extremely friendly, polite, attentive and english spoken throughout hotel. A superb buffet breakfast, both hot and cold offering many variations depending on tastes. Only negative aspect noted is the room temperature, despite lowest thermostat setting, room remained relatively warm.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Impssupporter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the heatwave of July 2010. Hotel clean, air conditioning wonderful Rooms a little strange with a curtain rail around the bathroom area. Didn't have the view of the tower however the location was super within walking distance of checkpoint charlie, parliament building, cathedral, Brandeburg gate etc Didn't eat at the hotel so couldn't comment but emailed ahead to ensure housekeeping provided a kettle for us in the room (which they did) as many European hotels do not offer that service. Concierage service helpful.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic central location”
Reviews.Author: Suz_Cols
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during our recent european road trip. We drove into the centre of berlin wth no planned accomodation, plan was to park car and then find hotel. We parked the car in Alaxenderplatz and we were impressed by the convenient location of this hotel and were delighted to find the nightly rate was reasonable for such a great location. Couple minutes later, we were given a room on the 30th floor and the view over the city was fantastic. My little boy was very impressed and enjoyed gazing out of the window. It was brillant that we could dump the car and not use it until we checked out. We were able to walk to all the attractions we wished to visit like museum island and the brandenberg gate which was great. Infact we were able to see everything much quicker than we anticipated due to the central location of the hotel. A big thumbs up from us.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location, comfort room”
Reviews.Author: GavrilovMike
Reviews.Content: I'm stayed in this hotel with a colleague by business at the end of February 2008. First of all I want to say that now Park Inn is most stylish hotel where I have been. My standard room with queen-size bed was clean and fresh. Stuff very friendly and helpful. So i can recommend Spagus restaurant with great menu of food & drinks. I recomend this hotel to business because it looks good, have a lot of services and located in heart of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice!”
Reviews.Author: EFI24
Reviews.Content: I have been many times in Berlin! the last two times I chose Park Inn Hotel as I would like a more central hotel to be more comfortable with the transportation! it is absolutely the most central point considering the metro, the buses everything! also there is a commercial centre and plenty of 24 hours food stores! About hotel: it is a wonderful modern and well-designed hotel. it is very clean and the breakfast is great supposing that you are used to European breakfast. Staff in recepcion is very friendly but it is not the same about the 'breakfast staff' but really who cares?(as there is a buffet and you do not have the need of serving) All the rooms are beautiful but if you are lucky you will have the 'corner rooms' where there is a great view of the city! there are few sites that offer in satisfactory prices! I strongly recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “RELAXING and COMFORTABLE”
Reviews.Author: sallyw90
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself are just back from a three day stay in the Park Inn it is a lovely hotel very comfortable and the breakfast excellent. We had a room on the 21st floor with a great view over the city and Post office tower. The rooms were nice and quiet which was just as well as i had a terrible cold and spent half the night coughing great thick walls,couldnt hear a sound from the other rooms.Glad nobody could hear me. The one complaint we had was the heat in the rooms couldnt get the air conditioing turned down so stuffy. The girl who checked us in and out could have been a wee bit more happy she was a bit dour for a young girl. But all in all i would recomend this hotel as it is in the heart of everything. The transport system in Berlin is second to none. We bought a three day ticket and just hopped on buses and trains,great!!! One thing I thought was really good you could leave your luggage on checkout day if you had late travel arrangements gave you time to go out and about without pulling luggage everywhere with you.

Reviews.Title: “Micro rooms and watch out for thieves”
Reviews.Author: jtiburon
Reviews.Content: If you're going to double-up, this is the not the hotel. I recently stayed at the Park Inn for a major travel trade show and found the miniscule rooms way too small for two people. But the hotel itself is relatively unsafe from unsavory theirves that inhabit the area. My mobile phone was stolen when a panhandler approached our table in Spago's restaurant asking for money. Next thing I knew the phone I had laying on the table was stolen and the hotel did very little to help recover it. The hotel referred it to their insurance company for restitution and when I arrived back in the states a letter was waiting for me saying essentially, that it was my negligence. Well, if that's the case they should be warning guests not to leave anything of value out on a table in the restaurant. Given the fact that there were pickpockets in the vicinity and a questionable neighborhood, the porous security system was what was really negigent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for the Tourist!”
Reviews.Author: TheSuperSupervisor
Reviews.Content: A Short City Break in Berlin made even more Special by the Location beside main Transport Links. If you want to go anywhere in Berlin, it literally is 3 minutes walk away. The Hotel primarily suits the Business Traveller, (Although Internet Access expensive, no printer available on the day it was needed!) but is clean, modern, and with a view of the TV Tower if you ask!

Reviews.Title: “Too many extra charges for everything.”
Reviews.Author: JKKlevins
Reviews.Content: This is quite a big hotel. I did not realize the magnitude when we booked, otherwise I would have gone with something smaller. EVERYTHING was extra at this hotel. It is now owned by Radisson. Internet was very expensive to use, Breakfast was 19 Euro a person, it was not included in your stay unless you paid ahead of time. Rooms are very small, two twin beds pushed together. If you wanted to check out the top of hotel for views of Berlin, you had to pay 3 Euro a person. To use the bathroom in the lobby, you had to pay 50 Eurocents. I will say it is a great location. You arrive at Alexanderplatz and you can't miss it. There are a handful of restaurants outside the lobby on Alexanderplatz, the S & U Bahn and tv tower right there. There is a nice restaurant/bar by the Lobby. The price is not bad, but not exactly what we expected. I'd say if you book it, just don't expect a lot to be "included".

Reviews.Title: “The perfect con and cheat in town”
Reviews.Author: BmwinVietnam
Reviews.Content: Arrived on the 9th after having changed the arrival date a week prior, went for ITB hence all had to be pre paid, company paid Euro 2,000, when arrived informed that return of funds was in place due to changed dates. Statement no worries not a problem. Change of dates was done one week in advance, as we were coming from Asia.The rooms horrible, the Panorama suite turned out to be a youth hostel large bed, split in the middle, cleanliness beyond any standard, amenities missing and could not get them until the 3rd day of the day. Staff assured all was cool, not worries you will get your funds returned, all is clear, no worries. Aft a five day stay, checked out, got some of the funds returned, the rest was going to be returned to a credit card, after arriving in Asia, returned funds were charged back again onto the credit card and other funds are missing, con answer to e mails claiming the return of funds and asking for unauthorized use by the hotel of the credit card and getting rightous answers. The perfect con setup and management, charged in excess of Euros 670 and still are going on about it. So far refuse to return the money they have taken illegally and kept without any legal reason. The worst hotel ever I have ever been to in my life, being a hotelier that is quite a sensation, ITB must shun them from getting any business in the future and certainly I advise you not to stay with them, as they will use and abuse your credit card in any way they can and you can not imagine, worst hotel in town in a gang neighbourhood with plenty of hard core social drop outs and the police at every corner, dirty and run down and a setup that is below any standards. Treatment below any hostel standards, agressive and unreasonable, abusive if they feel or knowl you come from an emerging economy destination. After having had to prepay everything they keep everything and return nothing even though they owe you, cheat you and lie to you. This goes from the very bottom of the management scale to e very top. Incredible and never seen of felt before in more then thirty years of being in the industry. ITB and any visitor should refrain from using such an establishment of such ill management, staff and operational standards. Abusive in language, rude and outright cheating their customers, using anything to their advantage, without regard for the law, rules and ethics.

Reviews.Title: “good walls, poor staff, many problems”
Reviews.Author: teresabattista
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 5 days and i had a lot of troubles, The hotel is a modern design one. Long queues to check in, staff has a poor knowledge of languages than german and poor english. The room key didn't work properly for 20 times I was obliged to go up and down to change it. We asked the help of an hotel tecnician who said "I don't understand the problem and I cannot solve it" we asked the help to a duty manager " I see the problem but I can't solve it". They didn't clean the rubbish in the room for 3 days (paper, glasses and so on). I was blocked in the elevator and the alarm didn't work so I was obliged to shout 20 minutes before they took me out of it. I made a complain and all they said was " we apologise" . Sorry but this is not the way a complain must be managed.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, great location!”
Reviews.Author: DebbieMoon
Reviews.Content: This hotel was selected for me. Great location!!! Right by the train station, easy to commute using train. Also, many places to walk to from this location. Rooms were decent size and immaculate. Wifi not an option, I had to use a hard line but connection was flawless. I really enjoyed this property and will stay there again during my next stay to Berlin! Only flaw was that it mentioned a fitness center. Only two treadmills, one bike and one eliptic machine. Not much of a fitness center unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally placed on A-Platz for the regional train and UBahn”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyAsbestos
Reviews.Content: This hotel is big, clean, and slap bang on the A-Platz. Ideal for travelling to other parts of the city, just 500m from Hackescher Marky and 800m from the museum Insel. Enjoy the city from this excellent location. The rooms seem quite small and under air conditioned, but offer excellent views across the city and the Fenser Turm. Looking from my window, and using my 8x12 binos, i looked from the F-Turm to U-d-Linden, the Brandenburger Tor, Golden Elsie and right through to the Funk-Turm out the other side of the city. To the N was the humbolds Park Flak-Turm. Its an excellent Radisson hotel, run in the best traditions of being very comfortable but expensive. A 2 night stay cost me 280 Euro for a double room inc breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, best location”
Reviews.Author: RodbarryBeechworth
Reviews.Content: We recently had 8 night's stay at the Park Inn. Great value booking thru www.zuji.com.au, so try this before other sites. Location fantastic..right near action, busy, walk to many historical sites, plenty of food places around. The disappointing aspect of the stay as others have mentioned is the exorbitant internet costs.. There is a restaurant in the building which offers free internet if you have a drink or meal there and there is free wifi at the McDonalds at Alexnderplatz, but you need a German phone number as ID..the staff are willing to let you use theirs! Otherwise internet cafes are rather sparse. Must see is Friedrichstadtpalast...a wonderful show with acrobats/singing/dancing very like Moulin Rouge...the songs are nearly all in English also..fantastic night of entertainment...near Orianburger Tor station (subway) All transport is easy and efficient. Very safe walking everywhere. Many tours and museums of course..the Undergound tours are excellent. The 5 day pass (or 3 day) is great value also for transport and discounts into museums/tours etc. any other questions galdly answered. We would definitely stay here again..the bathroom in the same room didn't worry us at all, being partners, and there is a curtain if you are just friends! Forget the expensive brekky also and there is plenty of good cheap eats on the streets Go to Potsdam by train and Dresden tour by bus..great towns/cities to visit also

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cat065
Reviews.Content: A central, and efficient hotel situated right on Alexanderplatz. The reception booked us in within minutes and our room had a great view over Berlin at no extra charge. The room was pretty spacious,warm, and clean. The only odd thing was, as previous reviews have stated, there is no separate bathroom/wc- these are in two frosted glass cubicles next to the door. The lifts are fine- if a little too efficient, covering twenty floors in literally two or three seconds. If you don't fancy the rather expensive breakfasts, there are plenty of take away places in alexanderplatz station 5 minutes away and there is a BK restaurant literally in the foyer to the hotel. The hotel is handy for the Nikolivertel area 15 minutes walk away for dozens of traditional german pub/restaurants (try Georgebrau especially) and there is also a classical museum complex nearby in the same direction. Unlike some previous reviews we did not feel unsafe at any time and there was a good police presence. Would definitely go again and had a really enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but not a 4 Star and space for Improvements”
Reviews.Author: NorthsideCrew
Reviews.Content: We stayed last December in this hotel and when we checked in we were asked to pay the full amount of three nights straight away before we even got the key for the room. Luckily I insisted to see the room first just to find out that it wasn't the room we booked. We were brought to a double bed room on the top floor and the girl wanted to sell the room to me for the "excellent" view etc. but with a child in a double bed room where the child was suppose to sleep on a small couch was just not good enough. So I insisted on my booking (which wasn't a cheap one mind you) and finally got the keys for our room. They still insisted on immediate payment so I did that after we got our bags in. The room we booked was lovely, very clean, neat and bright. I pictured it bigger online but that's ok. The hotel is right in the city centre and as a Berliner myself (living for years abroad) it was great to see all the Christmas markets. Public transport (trains, busses, trams) are right outside the door so perfect for us. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel as it was way overpriced. I think they wanted 15 Euro per person and although they had a buffet, the food they offered wasn't much different to what I usually get in a B&B. We went to the nearby bakeries and enjoyed our breakfasts there. The Hotel also has a great restaurant but again very overpriced. Rouladen for over 20 Euro gives the hotel a huge margin and the customer a feeling of being stupid to pay such a horrendous price. Mind you, the rouladen were delicious BUT the price does not justify it. These aren't lobsters! Because the Hotel is so central you find restaurants everywhere, good ones as well as bad ones but mainly good ones very reasonably priced - same with bars and coffee places. For the money we paid, we won't stay in the Park Inn again but if we'd get a discount we would consider. There are many Hotels in Berlin far cheaper so the choice is really down to the customer.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a good location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: endofcity
Reviews.Content: When in Berlin, I usually opt for better quality hotels in the West of the city but since I was with friends and the location suited well, I thought I would give the Park Inn a try. First impressions of the room is that it was very small compared to how it looked on the web. Other than that, I did enjoy a great view over East Berlin. The bathroom was adequate, without being amazing and there was a decent selection of functional toiletries.
