The thing I did not like about the room was it was far too stuffy and I couldn't keep it cool, even with the temperature set to minimum. Other than that, it's pretty much an ordinary / very average hotel with pleasant service and efficient check in and check out. Gets very busy in the lobby area at times, so I organised a late check out to avoid the mad crowds around noon. One disappointment is the viewing terrace on the top floor was hardly ever open (only a few hours a day), so I didn't get to use it. Overall, if you don't plan to spend a lot of time in your room and are visiting Berlin to see the sites, I think this hotel makes a good value for money choice. Don't go with high expectations though.

Reviews.Title: “Not as great as it could have been”
Reviews.Author: wraggle
Reviews.Content: I think we got really unlucky with this hotel. We stayed over a weekend and got a really great rate for the hotel. However, we arrived to the hotel to find that there was an international teen dance convention staying at the hotel for the weekend. The place was swarming with teenagers in every nook and cranny. The hotel itself is massive, it has 37 floors, 2 restaurants, a casino and a large lobby complex with 4 lifts which serve the rooms. However there was not an inch of the hotel not covered by swarms of noisy rude kids riding up and down on the elevators and pushing past you in the lobby. This meant that we had to wait for the lifts a long time and that the room was very noisy with groups of kids congregating in the lobby and by the lifts. Of course it doesnt help when the hotel place you in a room right by the lifts as well. The room itself was very clean and with a very comfortable bed although it was 2 single beds pushed together, not a true double and it was quite small. The staff also forgot to replace the towels when they cleaned, the rooftop bar was closed and all in all I just wasnt very impressed with the hotel. Its good value for money and in a central location but I wouldnt call it 4 star and I certainly wouldnt stay there when large groups are staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “the best location and room with great view!!”
Reviews.Author: marianina
Reviews.Content: the best point to sightseeing berlin! they upgrade our room to higher floor with an excellent view! train right next!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: SergeLuxembourg
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms that have been refurbished recently. if you are on a higher floor, great view over Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!! You wont find better value for such a location”
Reviews.Author: Craigando
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd trip to Berlin (would have been 4th if not for the ash cloud) I must say this hotel was absolutely perfect for our 3 day stay. Only 25 minutes from Schönefeld airport by express train, and the hotel is directly outside Alexanderplatz station (you literally can't miss it it is that tall) We stayed on the 21st floor with an amazing view across the city and the express lift gets you up there in 2 seconds!!!! My only 2 very slight criticism's are: no free wi-fi the bath/shower location which is actually next to the bed that can be partitioned by a curtain (never seen this before in a hotel) but having said that you can watch tv in the bath, and we had no problem because we are a couple, but could present a problem for other groups??? But all in all if you want luxury at a great price in a fantastic location please dont hesitate in booking this hotel!! We will be staying here again in March no question

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AstaSoi
Reviews.Content: Very nicely located hotel. An unique solution with bathrooms in rooms. Stayed in 22nd floor and the room was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Cental hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: ifbourg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a great spot, in the centre of East Berlin which allows you to do your walks easily. The room was clean. The staff was halpful.On the other hand, i did no like that there is no wi-fi in the hotel, and you have to pay enough money for having Internet access. Also, i found expensive the breakfast. It should be cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “great landmark location”
Reviews.Author: smallluxuryitem
Reviews.Content: very busy in a good location. Bar tenders could not cope with the amount of customers and some people waited 45 mins for drinks. Though advertised the hotel failed to provide internet service in my room. Rooms are small and stylish but offer little privacy for showering and toilet if you are sharing - a curtain seperates the basin from the bed and the glass shower wall. Breakfast buffet style with everything you could want

Reviews.Title: “The location is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Brk21
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend visited Berlin from 20-24th November 2010. As complete strangers to the City we were keen to find a reasonably priced hotel which was of good quality and centrally located. This hotel ticked every box! A short train journey from the Airport we arrived at Alexanderplatz station, one step outside and the hotel was in sight. The hotel was modern, clean and inviting and the staff were friendly and helpful. The room was of a decent size but the shower proved to be an issue and on more than one occasion we suffered a flood. Thankfully the staff were quick to come and assist us. All in all this hotel was perfect for a City break and I would definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: ModVixen
Reviews.Content: At the end of a busy trip travelling round various European cities, we found ourselves at the Park Inn - and what a lovely way to end our trip! We were all rather tired, but excited to be in Berlin for the first time. Check in was a breeze, the check in manager managed to get us two twin rooms on the 21st floor clse to each other with views over the city. The super-fast lifts impressed us all and the rooms themselves were amazing! The views over Berlin were phenomenal and the market in Alexanderplatz was in full-swing! As we freshened up we heard a noise outside the (open) windows. Shortly afterwards we saw what looked to be a harness being drawn up past the window. A few minutes later we saw someone flying past the window - one of the base flyers from the hotel roof! I was sorely tempted, but at nearly 100 euros I decided to leave it until another time. The hotel was spotlessly clean and the rooms were extremely comfortable. The 02 world where we were attending a concert, was easy to get to via the train. The transport links from Alexanderplatz are first class - S-Bahn, U-Bahn, bus, long distance/ICE train - take your pick! The breakfast was lovely in the chic restaraunt. Couldn't have faulted the service that we received, the reception manager booked a lunch table for us at the Hard Rock Cafe and provided detailed directions on how to get there, they also held our bags until later in the day when we were ready to collect them. We were all very sad to leave the hotel and the city, and I can safely say that I will definately return to both at the nearest possibility! I cannot comment on value for money, as the hotel was booked for us as part of a prize - but with such a high standard of accommodation and facilities I would be prepared to pay a lot of money to stay here! If you are planning on travelling to Berlin this hotel has to be your top choice!

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel in Alexanderplatz”
Reviews.Author: JohnScale
Reviews.Content: Good quality hotel in Alexanderplatz, only a couple of minutes walk to the local tram, U-Bahn and S-Bahn station. Breakfast is very expensive, would suggest eating at one of the cafes/bars near the TV tower for a fraction of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a citytrip”
Reviews.Author: TenM
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gigantic, but actually, you dont realize it when you stay here. It is quiet n the rooms, the check-in went fast and there are plenty of elevators who bring you up very quickly. We have no complaints at all, except that it is not possible to have breakfast on the room (roomservice). The breakfast in the hotel breakfast room is expensive (18 euro) but outside the hotel there are more than plenty nice places where you can eat. The hotel is located above all the metro-lines of Berlin so you can find your way through Berlin easily. Its worth to buy 30 euro extra for a room with a view... its great to look out over Berlin, even when the tv-tower is in the fog.....

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: overlandunderwater
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a christmas break and no sign of any building/ renovation work as has been mentioned. Room was great with a full city view and very clean, shower and toilet is a great design and no real issue with regards using with a partner but i guess if you are a bit of a prude then it might be. Breakfast was a really good set up with lots of variation and not too busy. Be warned there are 2 porn channels on the tv's which are free 24/7 and I would class it as hardcore porn (and I am a man) !! Just if you wonder why your teenage son wants to skip breakfast and stay in bed....................

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Views. Spectacular breakfast! Convenient for airport”
Reviews.Author: Rutlanders
Reviews.Content: By sheer fluke, this hotel couldn't have been better placed - only a 21 min. S-Bahn ride directly from Schoeneberg Airport to Alexanderplatz, followed by a one minute walk across the square. It's also just a 20 sec. walk from the nearest U-Bahn and very convenient for the trams. It's just a 20 min. walk down Unter den Linden to reach the Brandenburg Gate, and for those wanting to see the old East Side, hop on a tram and go as far as you like into the poorer areas. German-speaking abilities come in very handy if you get lost around that side of Berlin. Perfect! I wrote directly to the hotel beforehand, to ask if we might have a room overlooking the "west" side of Berlin. We were given the best view possible, floor 34 and opposite the Fernsehturm. (TV Tower). I agree that the bathrooms are somewhat bizarre and you do have to be mighty good friends with your room companion, but they are spotlessly clean and the goosedown duvets and softest pillows provided me, a chronic insomniac, with better sleep than I've had for years. The windows are triple-glazed, vital in the temperatures we encountered, -15 degrees C. The only disappointment with the room was that there are no tea-making facilities provided. The hotel does seem a bit intent on squeezing extra money out of you; charging to use the loos in the foyer (so don't), Internet access and charging to use the roof terrace. However, this was out of bounds over Christmas, so we escaped any extras. The breakfast buffet is one of the most comprehensive we have had anywhere in the world and the restaurants serve top-quality food at reasonable prices. If you're on a budget, you can walk directly into a heated Mall where there's a good restaurant serving local cuisine. You can also access the Galeria department store from the hotel's second floor. We did wonder whether we might have chosen a hotel a bit far from the sights, but the integrated public transport system is so good, that most places can be reached in a very short time by either walking, tram, bus, U-Bahn or city train. Do buy a run-about pass. We weren't asked once to produce it, but there are hefty fines if you take the risk. The 5 day one was excellent value, and the purchase time is on it, so you can use it for 6 days. There were over 60 Christmas Markets and fairs whilst we were there, including one in Alexanderplatz itself, and several within easy walking distance. I recommend the Gendarmenmarkt for a wonderful Christmas Day lunch, beautifully decorated, and with warm, welcoming "conservatory-style" buildings, geared up for the purpose, and loads of stalls, quite unusual. (The Germans ar well geared up for winter and have quadrupled-banked snow ploughs at the airport and special ones for pavements, but for added safety, I recommend Bergsteiger boot chains. We used them all the time) We fell in love with Berlin and all it has to offer, and will definitely stay at this hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “GREat view, strange open showers nice big bed”
Reviews.Author: LTinka
Reviews.Content: Room room size was good, view xcellent to the tv tower, whilst I found it weird showering in see through glas while being able to see the tower and wondering is they had binoculars...fun though.. Didn't eat breakfast here as it was not included the special rate i had due to renovations. But the renovations were really extreme the noise was during the whole day.....so you had no choise but to go out and have breakfast anyways and enjoy Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Helee77
Reviews.Content: Went to Berlin for the Christmas Markets this year and the hotel was picked out without knowing much the location of the hotel or even Berlin. Couldn't have picked better, hotel was clean, tidy and staff were on the whole friendly and helpful. The buffet breakfasts, were huge. Kept me going most of the day! Hotel near to the alexanderplatz train station (only 6 euros to the airport by train) and the television tower - so you can always find your way back to the hotel. Within walking distance to all the main tourist sites. Beware in the bar though.... Staff seem to understand english well until you ask for a 'small' drink which comes out as a large with a 'i don't understand' look when you complain about being charged 18 euros for 2 drinks! The only let down of this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Single room, twins may be different”
Reviews.Author: SCC2104
Reviews.Content: For me a hotel is a place to sleep and rest between excursions and I rarely use any of the facilities a hotel has to offer so I review hotels on this basis. The location of this hotel is excellent and the view from my 32nd floor room was very good but these were the only saving graces. The room was too hot and the temperature was not easily adjustable. The TV was unviewable. It is mounted at ceiling level and angled so that it cannot be viewed in bed and the only chair made it a neck aching experience. The bed is in the middle of the floor so that the pillow disappears several times each night. There is no light switch near the bed but this is not a problem as the curtains do not block enough of the external light so the room never gets dark. The bathroom is a little weird being frosted glass with clear panels and it could be embarrassing if the hotel staff enters, or you are not on very intimate terms with your partner. The main attraction was the rate for the single room but next year I will go back to Motel One.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel right in the centre of Berlin with excellent staff and facilities”
Reviews.Author: laycockk5
Reviews.Content: This was my third visit to the Park Inn on an annual coach tour from the UK. I requested a particular room by e-mail before the visit and was delighted to be given it. The room was on the 35th floor overlooking the majority of the centre of Berlin. I was just level with the rotating restaurant on the TV Tower which is adjacent. What stunning views y day and night ! The staff were excellent and responsive. The largest dining room caters for a wide range of tastes and the buffet presentation means that you can get what you want easily. There are copious lifts split into two sections, one set serving floors 1 - 20, and the other high speed set serving floors 21 - 37. The acceleration/deceleration must be experienced ! A GREAT PLACE TO STAY IN THE CENTRE OF THE CITY, YET PROVIDING A GREAT SLEEP QUALITY.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Niamhsara
Reviews.Content: Staff were friendly and helpful. Not enough staff in bar and restaurant La Spada at night. Buffet breakfast excellent. Location excellent - beside shops, Christmas Market and underground. Rooms very small with bathroom incorporated into room. One door to cover shower or toilet. We had to move 3 times due to room being extremely small and heating not working. It was no problem for the staff and they gave us vouchers to use in the restaurant. final room had fantastic view but one could not use toilet or shower without having light on in the whole room because bathroom was part of the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and value”
Reviews.Author: spectacledgirl
Reviews.Content: I was so impressed with this hotel. I was a bit apprehensive due to the size of the place, but the staff were so friendly and helpful. My sister decided to come on short notice, but they didn't have any rooms for her and her boyfriend. Because we were tourists and didn't know the area, the gentleman at the desk phoned another high quality hotel down the street for us and reserved a room for her!! This was a huge relief as it was the middle of tourist season. The rooms are a bit small, but it really doesn't matter because they are very nice and very clean, and you'll be wanting to spend most of your time in the city anyway! I especially loved how the beds have two separate, extremely warm blankets for each person on the bed. Much more comfortable sleeping than sharing a blanket. I paid roughly £75 per night for a 4 star hotel. Excellent value for money! The location is excellent as well, as it is near Alexanderplatz station and lots of shopping and food. I rated location slightly lower only because it's in the East part of Berlin, which overall is not that nice although still fun. Definitely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; eccentric but acceptable room configuration”
Reviews.Author: flipflogg
Reviews.Content: When we considered this hotel, we were very strongly aware of the near hysterical reaction to the configuration of bathroom facilities. However, wondering how bad this could be, we ended up fascinated to find out what could be so wrong with a basin located in the body of the room etc etc and so booked 3 nights. We are glad we did because the location of the hotel is fantastic for the old East: 3 minutes from Alexanderplatz U and S bahns and the trams and, if you are lucky, a fantastic view of the TV tower in all its socialist realist glory. Now this used to be an old communist hotel and so it seems that some years ago, the new hotel owners undertook a radical refurb to squeeze some more space out of the relatively long and thin rooms. So what they did was to find a way of doing away with the internal space that is normally a feature of a discrete bathroom by separating the shower, wc and handbasin and having them face outwards into the room.. Voila, you have an extra square metre to play with in the room proper. The downside is that the basin is part of the entrance to the room which is aesthetically odd but, more important, means that there is a tendency for the floor area around the basin to get dirty (from outside shoes) and for water to drift from the sink to the carpet. That was the only practical issue I identified that was unavoidable but there were some avoidable issues which should have been addressed..... like a shower door opening onto the wall which contains the towel hooks prevents you from getting to your towels without dripping water everywhere....... and a see-through shower cabin which means the person shaving at the basin gets a ringside view of the action in the shower. Also, the glass and marble materials mean that anyone in the room can not be in a state of ignorance about the activities going on in the wc. So, if you are sharing with a partner or wife with whom you have no secrets about your ablutions or bodily functions, this is a modern, well-fitted hotel in a fantastic location that will just bring you closer. If you are bothered by the minor inconveniences of a misguided attempt to save space and make room for a desk, then perhaps you should try elsewhere. Oh, just one thing, Park Inn, if you are listening....... the knock on the door at 8am followed by another at 8:20 to clean my room was not appreciated. I dont care how many rooms you have to clean or that I could have put a notice on my door not to be disturbed..... no one expects the cleaning staff to be pestering guests this early so dont expect the semi naked guest to use particularly polite words when denying the maid entrance!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - ideal for short stay”
Reviews.Author: thenewblackisgreen
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and was overall very pleased with the standard and service. Despite some confusion with our booking at both check-in and check-out, the staff were extremely helpful and spoke fluent English which really helped. The rooms are smaller than the website suggests but well designed so that they don't feel cramped. They have an interesting idea of ensuite with an open plan bathroom and just a curtain separating the shower from the bedroom. The toilet is, thankfully, enclosed in frosted glass walls. Don't be fooled by wine, water, crisps and nuts that appear complimentary in a basket, you pay for all of these if you have them. The views are pretty great if you get a clear day and, if you can, request a higher level for an even better view. 'Spago's' restaurant within the hotel is good for drinks later in the evening and they have live music every night. I'd suggest heading out of the hotel for breakfast as you'll get a decent 'fruhstuck' in nearby streets for less than half the price the hotel charges. Make sure you use the toilet in your room as they charge you to use the toilets in the reception floor.

Reviews.Title: “Internet connection in your room for 6 euro / 1 hour”
Reviews.Author: dfundfun
Reviews.Content: We travel alot but have never seen a hotel hoo charges for surfing the net - more then a room cost... Ironiclly we could say its very low room rate, even though the rate for double room is equal to about 12 hours of serfing the net (72 euro...:). We think that free (or at least reasonable price) internet connection in the room is elementary , basic and Obvious more then free TV or toilet in the room...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, big breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: NonWalker
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 3 nights. It was a good price in a great location, just across from the train station where we arrived from the airport. The check-in queue took 20 minutes however, on a Saturday afternoon. We were warned about the glass shower wall and frosted toilet wall in the rooms, so we weren't too fazed. Unfortunately, there was no free wifi in the room, and the charges were very high, which was disappointing. They repaired a crack in our toilet seat very efficiently and even offered us a change of room as the repair would not be done until the next morning. The breakfast was immense. I can see what people mean about the staff's demeanour, but we were so busy stuffing our faces that it didn't bother us! I'd recommend this hotel to anyone who is going to Berlin for their first time.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel, Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: PhysioAthens_Greece
Reviews.Content: Very easily accesible from Tegel airport with TXL bus.Excellent location to discover Berlin's treasures!Very good service though a little expensive charges on extra's (ie. breakfast, massage).Very clean rooms though a refridgerator is needed.Would like to come again with my child also.

Reviews.Title: “Do not expect much when you pay that low price”
Reviews.Author: Rabirab
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very very well located in the center of Berlin with the subway well connected station. But the service of the hotel is poor and to be honest I cannot get used to have a simple glass to separate the room with the toilets. The close area of the hotel is "dead" on the evening so you better count on the subway by freezing, raining or windy weather.

Reviews.Title: “Superb choice”
Reviews.Author: Eggs_Benedict
Reviews.Content: The Park Inn at Alexanderplatz is an amazing deal in an amazing city - stayed 10 days with a killer deal. Although built originaly by East Germany, it was redone after the wall was taken down. Don't expect a historical, traditional hotel. This is a modern up to date facility. It is in a great location for walking to major attractions and sites, right at bus, tram and train trasnportation, about 20 minutes from Tegel Airport. Rooms are modern, everything works great, staff is friendly and efficient. And...for extra excitement, you can even jump from the roof (attached by a cable of course). Downstairs restaurants (one off the lobby, another at the entrance, several at the platz) are very good and reasonably priced. Like other German hotels expect to pay thru the nose for Internet access. Otherwise, all in all, a superb choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very very good and exquisite!”
Reviews.Author: Prima_ee
Reviews.Content: Been there at January 2008 and ever since have very good memories! A huge plus - location: near several metro stations, and underground connections take you to any part of the city. And the city is amazing and I'm not the one to tell you this. Hotel itself and its staff make you feel special: the attention and care is given any time, with true patience and generous smile :). Admit breakfast is rish in variety and absolutely no complains, as any tourist of many nationalities can find something suitable for their cultural taste. Rooms are clean, nothing less, nothing more. All you need is at hand, and beautiful views to the city if you're staying at high floors. My main suggestion: book the hotel and you won't be disappointed as its a sure bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Good but dont expect too Much”
Reviews.Author: Marcysmm
Reviews.Content: Yes, the price is cheap, location is good but the rooms, even clean and recently refurbished, are veeery small - only go if u r alone or in a couple. The hotel is huuge, hundreds of rooms, and the front desk is really willing to help with the necessary. The concierge is lost and trying to sell tickets that is not always the best ( for the guests ). The extreme negative review goes to the food and beverage area. Breakfast leaves an egg smell to the entire building - really disgusting. People really rude and unpolite - not willing to help you in basics as "getting a spoon". The first floor lounge restaurant is better, but with really expensive price - compared to Paris and with not same quality in food neither in wine. You may find better and cheaper restaurants around berlin - for sure! Good hotel but FAAAAAR from what they consider to be a 4stars....

Reviews.Title: “Pretentious and Judgemental”
Reviews.Author: Michealtbh
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend I decided to stay here as it was in a central location and seemed quite nice. It seemed a little above our usual standard but we thought we would treat ourselves. Unfortunately the only good thing I can say is that the beds are comfortable. As soon as we set foot in the place we were constantly stared at. The majority of staff were less than helpful unless you were middle aged and wearing a suit. The basic rooms are tiny and the bathroom facilities offer no privacy. The breakfast restaurant is an absolute nightmare when busy. We felt constantly judged and looked down upon and did not feel comfortable at all

Reviews.Title: “small rooms,amazing buffet breakfast”
Reviews.Author: johnsoea
Reviews.Content: got a good deal for 4 nights here including breakfast.Rooms are quite small,and no tea/coffee facilities but very adequate and clean.the weird bathroom setup did not cause us any problems and there is frosted glass to protect your privacy but there's not a lot of separation between the room and the toilet/shower.The breakfast buffet is amazing!i don't know how much it costs if you have to pay separately but we stocked up each morning with hot food,croissants,bread,cheese,meat,salmon etc...Didn't need lunch most days.would def recommend this hotel as good value in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for price”
Reviews.Author: FGE04
Reviews.Content: Very good location, nice rooms and views. very convenient. Good value for price

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: litentuva
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at Berlin park inn plaza, a bit impersonal due to the size. Breakfast was good but expensive (18€/person). Smaller room than expected, since we booked the panoramasuite we expected a little bit more. Spagos bar were perfect for a nightcap. Minus for the fact that they charged even hotelgusets 3€ to visit the roofterrace.

Reviews.Title: “Location counts”
Reviews.Author: TomOpo
Reviews.Content: I had a short but pleasant stay at the Park Inn, the location could not be better. Rooms are spotless and quiet, but smallish. The breakfast is plentiful, but the place where it is served can be quite busy. Overall, a rather safe bet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: simpsob
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at the same time as our flights through the Easyjet web site and did not really know what to expect of such a large hotel. It is the tallest hotel in Berlin with fantastic views of the city but remember to ask for an upper floor. The room was a good size and although some reviewers had commented on the "strange" glass panelled bathroom arrangements we thought that this was fine and although the sink is essentially in the room rather than contained in the bathroom, we were quite happy with the toilet and shower cubicles. The room was spotless and well equipped with a safe and small fridge (packed with very expensive mini bar!). We just took most of the mini bar contents out and used the fridge to keep water, wine and beer cool! The staff were very helpful and responsive to requests and the lobby was very busy all the time. There are high speed lifts and we had no problem getting to and from the room. The buffet breakfast was amazing with a fantastic choice of hot and cold foods and it ran from 6-11 am every day which was great if you wanted an early start or a lie-in. Berlin is a great city to get about and travel was cheap and very easy. We visited the usual sights and also took a couple of very cheap rail journeys to Potsdam and Spandau - both well worth a visit. Alexanderplatz was buzzing and great fun with plenty of places to eat and the Galeria Kaufhof opposite is a great department store to visit. All in all a great holiday in a fantastic location and the hotel could not have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin.....such an amazing city !”
Reviews.Author: squinthorizon
Reviews.Content: Berlin is a really exciting city to visit. The Park Inn is ideally situated for all forms of public transport, and we loved being where the Bourne films were shot.....remember the tram scene and the snipers in Alexanderplatz........well that's right outside the front door. We had faults with the tv and the bath in our room which were rectified straight away. The room cools nicely if you open the windows on the inner side, and the breakfast was very nice but overpriced considering you could pop round the corner to Starbucks etc etc for a fraction of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly people ..but beware of Cafe Rossi!”
Reviews.Author: ianhanes
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very convenient, just across the the road from the railway station. The staff at the hotel were excellent especially the concierge, Gerhardt, who provided us with an excellent restaurant to celebrate my 40th birthday-Reinhardts. This restaurant had the best service imaginable in a lovely, 3O's setting with food and wine to die for. Unfortunately, on the second night we chose an Italian restaurant Cafe Rossi, just off Alexanderplatz, the service was thuggish, food awful and I'd advise anyone to avoid it like the plague. For a different taste of social life try the fun bar on Alexanderplatz, looks like a ski chalet- an eye opener, with everyone dancing and a relaxed atmosphere. We'd also recommend taking the red tour bus as it stops at the main tourist stops and is really convenient to get your bearings in under two hours. To finish off a great night try Spagos which is the bar at Park Inn. The Pianist, Charlie Rae, was excellent. To recover from the night before we recommend the excellent breakfast at the hotel - real value for money. Enjoy Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Too Compact and Air Con that does not Exist”
Reviews.Author: pip510
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a good location for visiting Berlin and the Sites of the area, however the hotel comes out on to a square that was full of drunks and vagrants at night although there was no trouble when we visited it may not be suitable for the more timid traveller. Very good transport links with the U Bahn, Trains, Buses and Trams all stopping neat to the hotel. The rooms are extremely compact and intimate and you are certainly cosy in there, they were clean and the fixtures were of good quality. We had a room on the 22nd floor and the wind whistled around the room making it noisy at night. The Air con in the room never worked (if it existed) we opened the window on other nights which let in a little fresh air. There are no Tea and Coffee making facilities in the room and I think that was sorely missed. The Shower is part of the main room only separated by a curtain that can be pulled across for privacy, the sink looks straight in to the shower so you had no privacy in there if sharing with a friend not an issue with a partner. The beds were comfortable though hard to sleep at night die to the heat. The internet in the hotel costs 6€ per hour or 26€ per 24 hours which is bit on the pricey side. The hotel does have leisure facilities but you have to pay 5€ to use this if you are a leisure traveller which I think is a real rip off. Breakfast was 18€ and a little pricey but the food was adequate. The staff in the hotel were friendly and courteous when we spoke to them however due to the lack of privacy in the room and tea and coffee making facilities I would not stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Five days in Berlin at a hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Holtster
Reviews.Content: The Location was the best thing about this hotel as it is close to most of the places of interest in Berlin,. The Hotel itself was located very close to Alexanderplatz train station, had very modern and clean rooms and was excellent value for money. The views from the hotel are really good and the staff were quite friendly - not as rude as some people on here have said. The only issues with the room was there was bedside clock and no coffee/tea making facilities. On the whole we would recommend this hotel and Berlin itself at it is a fantastic city to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service, room, landmark hotel.”
Reviews.Author: IngaH
Reviews.Content: Sightseeing and airport bus will come and go front of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Beki77
Reviews.Content: Topnotch Hotel and first class service. Excellent breakfast with ample variety. Room immaculate and cleaned daily. Lifts to all floors were plentiful and very swift. Splendid location for all transport, shops and eateries. Given the choice I would have preferred a concealed toilet and shower room. However, this issue put no blight on our holiday whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant views of the city”
Reviews.Author: Lilhawhaw
Reviews.Content: The rooms were small but very comfy and quiet despite it being a large hotel. A great breakfast buffet and the food in the restraunt was excellent with good service. Really enjoyed the bar service and the atmosphere in the piano bar into the small hours, there was even a smokers bus for the smokers to sit in. We were on the 24th floor and had good views towards the city. It was the ideal location for shops and short distances to other areas with places to eat and drink. If you ask the concierge for advice on trips make sure they are english spoken, we were sold tickets for a boat trip that was only in German so we missed all the information!

Reviews.Title: “great v.f.m”
Reviews.Author: liranmalka
Reviews.Content: great value fo money great room great view great location

Reviews.Title: “Rude customer services, unprofessional staff”
Reviews.Author: adnanrx
Reviews.Content: I have recently stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. The staff at the hotel are one of the most rude unhelpful people whether you are at front desk or resturant or even at concierge. when I 1st arrived they could not find my reservation and they would not let me use the internet to find it. I went to an internet cafe next door to the hotel to check on my reservation dragging behind me my luggages as the manager refused to let use their lobby to store my luggage until I come back from checking on my reservation. In the resturant I was mistreated very bad. the resturant hours for breakfast were 7 am to 1030am but if you get in the resturant around 10am every thing is removed i.e food and they questioned you as why are you coming late. In addition while I was eating , I went to pick more food and came back to my table only to find out that thay had cleaned my table and put another guest . they also start cleaning before 10am. At concierge whenever I asked for help they were not welcoming or answered my question coldly and rude. at the reception they pretend that they do not speak english and were very arrogant. I had such a bad experience that I checked out 1 day before my time because i want to leave that hotel Asap. I certainly do not recommend this hotel to any body. The assistant manager katrin cora was suppose to get back to me when I complained but never did. The manager of the property was avoiding my complaints and was too busy to see one of his guests. I was told by Frank Newman front office agent that The manager is writting a letter of apology to you which I never recieved. I fell sorry for all guests that stayed at the hotels as they will be be simpley ruining their vacation which happened to me and will encounter very unpleasant experience

Reviews.Title: “not a 4 star hotel, but reasonable value for money if you don't mind a non-bathroom”
Reviews.Author: AJC32
Reviews.Content: The rooms we booked via booking.com were supposed be spacious and have panoramic views over the city. Instead all we had were views of the extensive building work going on at the front of the hotel. After considerable hassling of rather disinterested staff, one of the rooms was changed to a higher floor with promised views but not the other as the 'hotel was full'. However, the internet connection did not work in either room , and this took 48 hours to fix. Charges for internet were ridiculously high - even the hotel staff recommended going to a nearby internet cafe, but this is not really an option if you have serious work to do. as I did. None of the rooms were spacious, and are much better described as cramped. Worst of all, however, are the dreadful bathroom arrangments as there is no separate bathroom. Is this a hangover from the communist days of collective bathing?? If you like a degree of privacy when performing your ablutions, this hotel is definitely not for you! On the plus side, the location is convenient (but Alexanderplatz is decidedly seedy,so go elsewhere if you want a little sophistication) and I have only praise for the housekeeping team, who were extremely helpful and efficient. All in all, this hotel is not up to the standard of other Park Inns we have used, and we will stay elsewhere when visiting Berlin again.

Reviews.Title: “The views are worth it”
Reviews.Author: travheller
Reviews.Content: Were it located somewhere else, you might feel ripped-off. However, the views from the hotel are AMAZING. It doesn't even really matter which direction your windows are facing. (Obviously the best views are from the windows facing the TV tower.) You might even want to book a so-called panorama room which has windows on two walls. Berlin is beautiful, whichever way you look. But as implied, apart from the views and the height the hotel is nothing special. Err, except for the see-through bathroom wall which is special in a funny way. I'm not a prude, but you do want a bit of privacy sometimes, no matter how close you are to your companion. A good mid-range hotel, but worth the money only if you appreciate the view. If you do, you're well off staying in because the room service is extremely good and the minibar selection is surprisingly affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Made our holiday !!”
Reviews.Author: willo-p-78
Reviews.Content: First of all, Berlin is a magnificent city and we had a wonderful time but I really do believe that this hotel contributed to that opinion greatly. We were on the 23rd floor in a standard room overlooking Alexanderplatz and opening the curtains every morning was amazing.. The view was stunning to say the least.. Upon check-in we were given the 10th floor but when I asked for higher floor the response was, " no problem sir, lets see what we have". The location of the hotel for the average visitor I think is perfect, centrally positioned so virtually every point of interest is one bus ride away, 10 mins from Reichstag, Brandenburg Gate, Holocaust memorial while being a 10 min walk to an array of bars and restaurants (Oranienburger).. As mentioned previously the bathroom design is...lets just say revealing but the girlfriend and I thought it was quite funny..Staff, very friendly, rooms not massive but clean and modern, Spagos bar and staff very nice, all round good experience, oh and just to clear up a previous comment by somebody, the lifts are superb, not slow, I should know Im a lift engineer..

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4-Star property...”
Reviews.Author: hokiegirlArlington
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at the Park Inn for a weekend trip to Berlin. We were very disappointed in our stay. This hotel should be 3-Stars not 4...As other reviewers have mentioned, the "bathrooms" are very odd. What really bothered me though was the the lack of quality in amenities provided in the room. The towels were paper thin, and we were not given any washcloths. When I called and asked for some, I was told they don't have any at all! Also, I didn't pack any shampoo or body wash, since we were staying in a "4-Star" property, I figured they'd have decent stuff. I was wrong! All we got was a tiny bar of bad soap and a little bottle of something called "hair and body wash". I've had better shampoo in a Quality Inn! Oh and the hair dryer they provided was horrible! Ladies, bring your own if you stay there! Also, the bed was strange...we requested a double bed and what we got was 2 twin beds pushed together, each with a separate comforter. I've seen this in other European hotels and I just have to wonder...do Europeans not like to sleep with their spouses? Oh and the keycard system to use the elevator was a major pain! Our cards stopped working twice and we had to get them re-keyed. The first time, we were not even asked for any id or proof we were actually staying there! The elevators took forever to get to our floor, so plan that into your schedule. Breakfast was included in our room rate, and was about what I expected for that. Not horrible but not great either... I would not stay there with children - the Alexanderplatz gets very sketchy after about 7pm. Lots of drunks, panhandlers and people talking to themselves. Plus it is filthy out there!

Reviews.Title: “Not much privacy at the Park”
Reviews.Author: PatriceCardiff
Reviews.Content: The Park Inn, Alexanderplatz, Berlin is ideally situated for the underground and buses and some of the tourist sites are within walking distance. The hotel is modern, clean, comfortable and quiet. We were situated on the 19th floor so pretty good view over the city. However, the shower and toilet cubicles jut out into the bedroom which wouldn't be so bad if they weren't surrounded by clear glass and completely see-through! I travelled with my sister and we laughed about it but if you are travelling with someone that you don't know all that well, you certainly will do by the end of your stay! The Internet access at the hotel is expensive - 7.50 euros for 30 minutes. Berlin is a fantastic city. We were only there for four days and only scratched the surface. There is so much to see whatever your interests. Museum Island has many of the main museums in one area, all within walking distance of the hotel. We visited the Pergamon Museum which was amazing. It's worth buying a Berlin Welcome card at 22.90 euros for 72 hours as this will give you easy access to the underground, buses and trams. We hopped on and off trains and buses all the time and made good use of our card. The Welcome card also gives discount on many of the stores and restaurants. It's worth checking out Alberts on 35 Karl-Marx-Alle as mentioned in the Welcome book but please note the free drink on offer is lemonade and 25% discount is off the main menu, not the BBQ that we had which was classed as a special. Still worth a visit though as the food was really good! On our first day we joined the free walking tour, led by Sam, a Cambridge graduate, who really knew his stuff! The tour was supposed to last 3 hours but ended up being 5 (although that included a half hour stop for a drink and bite to eat!) We needed it after so long a tour but it was well worth it as Sam took us to the Brandenburg Gate, Reichstag, Book Burning Memorial, Holocaust Memorial, Checkpoint Charlie, Potstdamer Platz, SS Headquarters, Berlin Wall, etc. etc. We didn't need to do the bus sightseeing tour as he had taken us around most places and given excellent commentary. If you don't want to walk, Sam did give us a tip and told us that the 100 bus did the same route as the sight seeing bus. We also visited the Reichstag, well worth the 2 hr queue! Either go very early in the morning or in the evening as last entry is at 10.00 pm. The trip to the Charlottenberg Palace was also amazing. Other places we visited were the Sony Centre, the bank by the Brandenberg Gate (to see the metal whale!), Potsdamen Square and of course the Berlin Wall. A really fantastic city and we will have to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Citytraveller38
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location...within 3 mins walk you have either the underground, overground trains, buses and trams at you disposal to get around town very easily. Transport system is clean, quick & efficient. Now the hotel, friendly staff, clean rooms (would definitely recommend upgrading to a city view room)...the shower set up is unusual, but there is a privacy curtain you can pull round. There is a mini bar and a safe in the room. The hotel offer a continental breakfast for 18 euro's per person...but if you go to Bistro Kaffeehaus next door, you can get eggs & bacon for approx 9 euro's per person. Overall, a great hotel that i would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome view”
Reviews.Author: Everton73
Reviews.Content: The hotel is directly at the Alexanderplatz close to the big museums and the cathedral. Take a room that is level 30 or higher facing the television tower. It is EUR 15 more expensive than the lower level rooms but worth it! The rooms themselves are not the biggest I ahve seen and I personally wasn't to fond of the little cabins for the toilet and the shower in the room (instead of a seperate room) but that is the only negative I have.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: paudie85
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the best I have ever stayed in. The staff were very friendly. We were supplied with maps and all of our questions were answered. We arrived several hours before we were meant to check in but we were given a room straight away. The room was clean and had everything we needed. In the resturaunt and bar the satff were great. They were very helpful and there was no request too big.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great views”
Reviews.Author: happytravellers73
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel due to the central location and views. We even went for a shot at the casino at the top. Breakfast was overpriced, but there are plenty of places to grab a pastry and a coffee. My only gripe was the bathroom set up. Its a sort of a double cubicle, so I would suggest you know your room mate very well because there isn't much privacy!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: sham1399
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife just returned from a trip to Berlin and stayed at the Park Inn Berlin-Alexanderplatz. The location of the hotel is perfect. The main entrance of the hotel is congested due to construction. The entrance that opens up into Alexander platz is great. There is a big mall 200 meters from Alexanderplatz, cafes, and the train station is about 100 meters away. The famous TV tower is just on the other side of the train station which lends great to the Fat Tire Bike Tour(You must do this). The only negative thing about the trip is that everyone is trying to make some money-beware of the "Do you speak English crew". Overall, it was a high end hotel by German standards. I would recommend this hotel for younger, or more active couples. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location and great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: alliegalland
Reviews.Content: We are in our early 20s and thought this was a great hotel. The rooms are very modern and clean and the location is wonderful. There is plenty of food and entertainment nearby and we felt safe around our hotel. Heads up, the shower just has a glass wall all around it, however there is a curtain you can pull around. Also, the internet is really expensive, about 7 euros for one hour and 18 euros for 24 hours. We really couldn't have asked for a better experience and the people were nice and helpful, willing to answer all of our questions.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Badly Designed Bedrooms more 3 star than 4 star”
Reviews.Author: travelling_tasha
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights booked last minute with BA and were very impressed with the price we good for holidays and flights for a 4 star establishment. The hotel is very easy to get to from Tegel airport on the TXL bus which is only 2.40E each goes straight to Alexander-Platz (it's the last stop - approx 30 mins). You can't miss the hotel it's the tallest in the city and towers over the square. The Underground is right outside the hotel so you can easily get to all other parts of the city easily plus the S-bahn (overground train) station is also only a 2 min walk from the hotel. There is no swimming pool at this hotel. The staff were friendly when we chacked in all spoke very good English at the desk, we had a standard twin/double room, no breakfast. Breakfast is expensive 18E each but there are loads of little bars and cafes in the square where you can get breakfast from for much much cheaper! Our room was on the 17th floor about half way up. the view was to the back of the hotel (not the square) which was ok but a bit of a building site below. The room was very small and the bathroom is sort of open planned so you can see the shower and sink from the bedroom, they have a shower curtain that you pull round for privacy...!! No tea and coffee making facilities but a reasonably priced mini bar (beer was 3.00E). No iron either but you can ring for one.and no full length mirror. First night ok but in the morning whilst taking a shower in their rather fancy modern rain shower I noticed the basin filling up and the water not draining away, it was then that my boyfriend begain shouting that the room was flooded! The ENTIRE floor of the bedroom was covered in water, it had gone under the bed and all the way up to the door and out to the corridoor(no exagerration). The design of the shower is terrible the water spilled out over the entire floor and because there is no door to the sink/shower area it simply spread out into the room and everywhere! Anything we had left on the floor - including clothes, magazines, chargers, phones etc were soaked. I had to leave the shower still lathered up! I phoned to explained wht had happened and they said they would send soemone up, they did but that person spoke no English and so I rang down again and they asked me to go downstairs to sort the problem out so still soaked with shampoo in my hair I did. Quite embarrasing. They did however apologise and change our room, we got an upgrade to a corner room with a BATHTUB so as to avoid a repeat of the last bedroom we did however have to fashion a fixing to hold the shower head onto the wall as it was broken and would not stay up. They even admitted that it is a poorly designed bathroom. The new room was no different in total sq footage but had a double aspect window with a view over Berlin and the main city which was lovely. All in all we would not stay at the Park Inn ALexanderplatz again, it says its a 4 star and they do charge 4 star prices for food and internet but the accommodations are small and badly designed. Having stayed in many 4 star hotels this was missing the basics that you would expect from a 4 star especially with regard to bedroom size and facilities available.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room With A View - But Not Too Early”
Reviews.Author: Smilingguest
Reviews.Content: Keep going back to the Park Inn, Berlin - 5 visits in 6 years. Was there 9 July - 16 July 2010. Made sure to book B&B through Otel.com rather than room only - same price on other sites. Contacted hotel in advance for upgrade room but replied that this would be €20 a night. Refused to pay but was given one at check-in. Super panarama room with double windows on 26th floor. However, had to pay €25 for early check-in at 11.55am as check-in opens 2 hrs later at 2.00pm. Bit of a take-on but did not complain because of the room! Anyway, room was comfortable, well cleaned every day, staff were always smiling and helpful and the choice at self-service breakfast was super. Location beside Alexanderplatz station makes travel to any part of Berlin easy. Would reccomend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice rooms, good view... but rude staff”
Reviews.Author: FlyingFinn1980
Reviews.Content: Centrally located and with convenient public transportation connections everywhere, including a bus directly to the Tegel airport. The rooms are nice and beds extremely okay. The view from the windows is breathtaking, especially if your windows are westwards (where the TV tower is). However, like someone said in an earlier review, they do charge extra for everything - entering the rooftop terrace (which is under construction and the view obstructed), just having your boarding pass printed out, using the internet in general, etc. Some members of the stuff are also exceptionally rude, not answering your hellos and giving the impression that the last thing they would like to do is talk to you (especially the concierge). I'd still recommend it, because the location and the view are extremely good.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic city and fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sunfor
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews on the strange bathrooms in this hotel i was a bit worried as to what i was going to find.....well the bathroom was strange but very modern and we thought they were pretty cool. There is a curtain that you can pull around the whole shower and washing basin, bathroom was not a problem at all. The hotel its self was spot on, clean, modern, clean towels everyday, mini bar in room restocked everyday, staff so friendly and made us feel very welcome, as this is sometimes not the case in Scotland these days. You were always served with a smile which was so good to see. Drinks were a bit expensive in the hotel, but the chilled out atmosphere in the drinks lounge was well worth paying the extra. The hotel is excellent for sight seeing, it was beside the u bahn and the s bahn, and travelling with this form of transport is well worth the money. Easy enough to jump on the s shuttle at the airport and its 2 minutes from the hotel, dont do taxis! The city itself is amazing and we will be returning next year and taking the kids!

Reviews.Title: “Berlin is great, the Park Inn is not!”
Reviews.Author: Keeponexporing01
Reviews.Content: The location and facilities are good, with all areas of the hotel spotless, especially the bedroom which was of a nice/modern standard. The main downside is the lack of warmth from the hotel staff, everything felt a little impersonal/distant. Also the roof terrace is not as seen on the hotel website, it gives a picture of an unobstructed roof terrace all nice and spacious, it isn't. It is a small area cordoned off with mesh/barriers and as a paying guest it is a surprise you pay 3 Euros to have a look. The lounge/bar was not inviting, which was something of a disapointment having seen the pictures and the last thing you want after a long day sightseeing. Also the drinks were on the expensive side at 8.50 Euros for a Jack Daniels and service was not with a smile, while the piano player/singer was of a poor standard, though to be honest not something I would usually listen to. A good tip for a hotel is the small/simple Motel One, across the road heading toward Hackesher Market, where young/pleasant/smiling attentive staff were pleased to see me and only charge 3 Euros for a Jack Daniels (don't get the wrong impression, I'm not a heavy drinker!!) As for Berlin I would be happy to live there, let alone visit on holiday. The locals were friendly and approachable and there is quite a bit to see (it is a cycling city, hire a bike from the Fat Tire Company either for the day yourself or join one of their tours, they are based under the Fernsehturm (big silver ball, communications tower, AlexanderPlatz) Like most big cities abroad, the onset of the evening is enjoyed by families out together as opposed to English towns which are taken over by drunken louts. Only saw four drunks pushing each other, and yep it was four English lads...brilliant. Visit Berlin and you shouldn't be disappointed. It isn't Rome, but it has something. Also, don't waste money on a taxi from the airport, take the TXL 'bendy' bus, caught just outside the front door of the airport. Runs 7 days a week, every 15 mins and costs 2 Euro 10 cents and you get to see a few sights as it stops all over the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: 0utlier
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Park Inn as a solo traveller whilst attending a conference in Berlin. The location really is amazing, you can quickly and easily navigate the city if you're based here. It's literally a few minutes from the train station (S & U-bahn), taxis & buses. In addition, it's just across the road from the Alexa centre, which is a pretty good shopping mall if you're in need of any gifts or forgotten essentials (I forgot my euro-plug adapter!). Alexanderplatz itself is a fairly lively square, there are a few bars & coffee shops (Starbucks, among others) within easy walking distance. The room was comfortable and clean, and the air conditioning was a bonus given the high temperatures at the time. My room on the 12th floor had a small writing desk with chairs, a telephone, high-speed internet access, TV & minibar and more plug sockets than you could ever possibly need! I also had black out curtains & triple glazed windows, so noise & light wasn't a problem. The shower, toilet, & sink area was spotlessly clean. And I personally found the beds (with scrumptious fluffy duvet!) to be very relaxing. The staff I delt with during my trip were very approachable, and happy to chat and share travel tips etc. All in all, although Park Inn is a little on the pricey side, the convenience of having Berlin at your fingertips is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel when visiting Berlin”
Reviews.Author: SverreMonsen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is surrounded by parks, pedestrian areas and streets without traffic, and very close to trams and U-bahn. Silent area perfect for people in all ages. Lots of shopping centers close to the hotel (the best is just 10 meters from the hotel, which contents a large delicatessen and wine shop). Safe and good parking house close to the reception. The hotel is a typical for the East Germany style, but that is the exterior. Inside very nice and reception, restaurants, lifts, corridors and the rooms (for sure our room) restored and in perfect condition. Our room was located in 35th floor, clean, new furnitures, perfect beds, had AC and separate bath room and toilet. Perfect solution when three family members stayed in same room. I read in advance on Trip Advisor about glass walls between toilet and rooms - but NOT in our room - perfect! The breakfast is not included, but we anyway eat breakfast outside in the sun because there are lots of nice restaurants and outside bars in the neighborhood. Just 10 minutes walk to Unter den Linden. The only minus - they charged € 3 for entrance to the nice terrace on the top of the hotel. Should be free for guests! Professional and friendly receptionists - even when Germany played soccer match in South Africa :-) Burger restaurant in the basement - a plus for the youngsters, and the famous TV tower one minute walk away- a must when visiting Berlin. Wherever you are in Berlin you may use the TV tower to find the way back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location..”
Reviews.Author: pbafna
Reviews.Content: The location is the primary reason you must be basing your Berlin trip around this hotel. Well connected to the whole of Berlin from around here. Smallish rooms which is the case all over Europe. Great check-in experience although we were waiting in a line, given the amount of rooms this hotel has. Spagos their in-house coffee shop was a great place as we discovered, apart from the breakfast we opted for meals here after we were given coupons and I must say it served one of the better meals we'd had around our European tour. Great pizzas too, when I really didnt expect much to begin with! Their smoking bus parked outside was the nicest experience too. There's also a Casino in the same building, not the best of the lot but decent bit of a crowd and vibe going on. We had no trouble getting around anywhere and even the city tour buses departed from near the hotel which was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, mediocre service, no WiFi”
Reviews.Author: dlf66
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, this hotel looks rather better than it actually is. While convenient for shops, museums etc., the rooms are extremely tiny, the showers strange [no drain meant the water flowed all over the room], the curtains aren't thick enough to keep the room dark at 6am, and the food is expensive and not very good. It's not particularly bad, but I doubt if most visitors will ever return as you can find better value elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Room 8 feet (240 cm) in width and 21 feet (630cm) length - a double room!!!”
Reviews.Author: jillrussell
Reviews.Content: We had booked two double rooms for 3 persons for four nights. On viewing these rooms we could not believe the size deemed suitable for two persons - see through shower and toilet - no privacy. Couple asked to be moved and had to pay 160 euro on top of 421 euro previously paid. The single person was also charged 421 euro for four nights for the box! Each day the swipe card/key failed to work on both lift and room door - a very frightening experience when stuck in lift. How is this hotel room size deemed suitable for two people and have a four star rating is amazing. However seems to have a captive audience as it seems to cater for mainly bus tours due to its proximity to Alexanedrplatz. Query under 'health and safety' in the event of an emergency how would one exit this hotel safely?

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but no personality. Bring your wallet”
Reviews.Author: brucewh_ie
Reviews.Content: First, all the positive notes: Beautiful rooms. Beautiful location. Beautiful view! and all at a good price! Now the rest.... The woman who checked us in seemed to have a chip on her shoulder. Not very pleasant. Not sure if its a german thiing or what. They charge you for EVERY LITTLE THING! Internet (18 euro for 24 hours), if you want a room with a better room, (they're doing construction on one side of the hotel so they stick everyone on that side and then charge you 10 euro a night to switch to the other side. The breakfast is 20 euro and it is rubbish! I strongly recommend you skip the crap hotel stale food and grab a coffee and a doughnut at dunkin' donuts in alexanderplatz train station.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: roxyrocks84
Reviews.Content: It is close to the TV tower where most tours meet. Practically next to the to the their subway system (S+U Bahn). You can walk to museums around there. The only thing weird abou this hotel is the restroom. It's right next to the shower which is all glass but you can pull a curtain all the way to cover it. The restroom wall is very thin and you can see the shadow of whoever is in it and hear everything! I mean everything, so me and my husband would turn on the tv so we would have more privacy. When going to a restaurant be prepared to wait 10min or more before the waiter ask for your drink and order. We learned to be ready with our order when the waiter ask for our drinks because you sometimes will wait 15-20 min for the waiter to come back around. So don't wait to go eat right when you are hungry. There is not a lot of variety in foods in Berlin. Most of the food has to do with sausages, sauerkraut, potatoes and meats. The only seafood you can find is sushi. We would eat breakfast in the restaurant under the hotel by the Burger King and they had eggs, bacon, toast. There are some bars around the corner of the hotel and some lounges. The hotel bar is good, they have someone playing the piano while you have drinks. The concierge helped us out a lot with finding where we wanted to go. The hotel is in a very safe area so you can walk around late at night. We went on the Third Reich bike tour and that was really good. Also when to the Qi show and that was also good

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for first time in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: rhartogs
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a good hotel for a first timer in Berlin. It is a two minute walk to the TV tower. From there, one can take bike or segway tours from Fat Tire Bikes. The hotel was clean. The bathroom is the only thing a bit odd. If you are traveling with someone, make sure you are comfortable with them, as there isn't much privacy when showing. The toilet area is fine though. The staff was friendly when I checked in...and had a room ready for me before the check in time. The restaurants have decent food too if you need dinner in a pinch. I would stay here again if I had to no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely going back”
Reviews.Author: Tulppa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect. It is modern and yet situated in the "retro" part of Berlin. TMore importantly, the staff is really helpful. During our stay we had a family emergency but thanks to the staff our holiday didnt become the disaster it might have been. Thank you again for everything!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good staff, but mind the 'bathroom.'”
Reviews.Author: SpottyBogTrollop
Reviews.Content: We are happy with our stay here: the staff was helpful; the room was clean & maintained; the location is convenient; all went well. There are only a couple of caveats: the bathroom is a toilet and shower, separated by opaque glass (from each other and the bedroom) that does not reach the ceiling. The sink is beside them. As long as couples are comfortable with this arrangement, it need not be a problem. The other mention is the roof: for 3 Euros, one can see the view from the roof; however, it is not as panoramic as the photo implies. It is a small area with a couple of chairs, and a pay-viewer (binoculars). We didn't use the pool or other facilities, alas, so, can't comment. It was good value, and the overall impression was good too. I would recommend it, though I'm a bit squeamish on the bathroom issue. Many thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Really Expensive Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: WoltersWorld
Reviews.Content: 1. Great Location. Right at Metro and S-bahn line Alexanderplatz. Walking distance to many major sites. 2. Clean rooms. Nuff said. 3. Expensive Breakfast. The only really bad thing I can say is that they charge 19 Euros per person for breakfast. So staying there for 4 nights it was quite a surprise when I had to pay almost 60 euros extra per day. They charged my 3 year old son 19 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Not my thing...”
Reviews.Author: missmONetherlands
Reviews.Content: Good things about this hotel: great location, you can go anywhere from here very easily, it's very clean, superfast elevators and it's hard to not find your hotel because it's the tallest in Berlin and you can see it from almost everywhere (if not you'll find the 'fernsehturm' and it's right next to that). Breakfast is not included, but costs an additional 18 euros per person per day, but there's absolutely no reason to do that, because there are lot's of nice place around where you can eat a lovely breakfast for a lot less money. Also the room was very warm and noisy, we almost didn't sleep at all and since this was the main reason to get a hotelroom in the first place...well... The beds were also very hard and didn't like that either, but that's something personal i guess. And the bathroom... ah yes the bathroom.... well, you have to be very comfortable with your roommate otherwise it can be very awkward. Plusside: i'd never seen myself sitting on a toilet and now i have! ;) Anyway, i won't be going back to this hotel, for me it's not worth it's money. I'd stayed in a Hostel last year and that was a much better experience!

Reviews.Title: “Big, bustling, brash, central - great fun”
Reviews.Author: Salisbury_John
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this place. We arrived, along with several of our grown up children, to find we had forgotten the sales voucher confirming our reservation - after a stern (and well deserved) telling off this was quickly sorted out. The rooms were lovely, and very good value - modern, well appointed, fabulous views. The much discussed open bathrooms were in fact private enough. Our daughter had a problem with drainage in the shower and her room was quickly changed. There seemed lots of staff who were friendly and keen to help, and who spoke better English than you hear in hotels in London.. The location was perfect - right on the U-bahn, close to good restaurants in the Nikolaiviertel, and, if you wanted, the start of a lovely long walk to Brandenberg Gate and on to the Zoo. Best of all it had a real big-city feel: busy, brash, a bit of a swagger about it. Very good bar with pianist who knew the whole Beatles' songbook. This is a self confident kind of place that does what it does very well. One small point; others have mentioned unexpected intrusions to their rooms. We too had a maid who twice came in early after the most perfunctory knock. But it is not really a place for lying in bed - it is a get up and go kind of place. We would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location, comfy bed, small room, good view”
Reviews.Author: travellingdoris
Reviews.Content: Was on a higher level floor, this provided a really nice view, especially was the Christmas Markets had just opened, and we could see the lights and Ferris wheels. I shared a room with a colleague. It is a good thing we are comfortable with each other as the room was tiny with Euro design bathroom which meant not too much privacy. :) There was a charge for internet. Decent, reasonable priced food that wasn't of the 'fast' variety was really hard to find convenient to the hotel. I marked the hotel low on service as we wanted to put the room cost on two cards, divided equally, and the front desk staff made a big deal about it when we checked in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location only problem - rooms very small”
Reviews.Author: sadmat
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my husband for 5 days at the end of March. The location is brilliant , the hotel is very clean and the staff were very good. Location wise this is THE spot close to all public transport, shops and restaurants. Only snag we had was that we booked (and paid extra) for a Panorama room hoping for a larger room. The room was very small with a tiny wardrobe nothing like the pictures on their website so we were a little disappointed. We would most definitely return and probaly will before the year is out but wouldn't waste our money paying for the extra space.. there wasn't any!

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: AGA86
Reviews.Content: hotel perfect for business trips,near many shoppind centers,perfect rooms - and panoramic view of Berlin

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: vibebrek
Reviews.Content: Nice suite, but we where not informed about no windows. This should have been told us in advanced. The noise from the elevator and the air conditioning was terrible. The room where very, very varm and so we could not sleep. It was awful. Room 3340.

Reviews.Title: “Made me want to stay there again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mac84
Reviews.Content: Booked the Park Inn through Ryanair's website. I was impressed by the photographs of it and the reasonable price. The Park Inn is situated right beside the S Bahn and U Bahn stop of Alexanderplatz, and there are plenty of bars, restaurants and shops nearby, and more just one stop away on the S Bahn! The hotel was modern and very comfortable, the staff were very welcoming and efficient. The room was spotlessly clean, the only thing was that I found the room very warm, even with the air conditioning on cold. The shower/sink are in the room, not in a separate room, but they can be curtained off for privacy. The view from the rooftop terrace is spectacular, but I do think that charging 3 Eur p/p to go up there is a bit saucy for residents, and the area is not that big. The bar is fabulous, comfy couches with big cushions and gorgeous decor. The drinks menu is huge, you won't be dissappointed with the choice! The conceirge by the souvenier shop is very helpful, you can by your sightseeing tickets there, and also tickets for shows and Madame Toussaud's. The staff are also very good at pointing out places of interest for you, and if you are nervous of the U-bahn, they will tell you exactly what train to get and where it stops, it's brilliant! I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone I know, and I will be staying there again myself!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JB_Nice
Reviews.Content: Very nice modern hotel in the center of Berlin not far from the airport, the Messe and the cultural sightseeings of Berlin. Great staff: very helpful, efficient and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “to take a shower requires artistic talent!”
Reviews.Author: dhsGraz
Reviews.Content: to take a shower in this very small bath-tube is not a very easy thing to do! I hope, this equipment is not used in other Park Inns!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ccarabott
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in Alexanderplatz - great location for underground and going around - walking distance from the TV Tower and the Dom Cathedral. The transparent bathroom door can be a problem if you're not that intimate with the person/s you're sharing. A bit pricey I guess but I cannot complain. We had a great view from the 23rd floor but I would probably look for another hotel when I'll visit Berlin again. I would recommend it if the people travelling together are intimate enough not to be bothered about the clear doors - some of our group were and felt uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable rooms in a large and impersonal hotel”
Reviews.Author: LCBLondon
Reviews.Content: The overall experience was a bit disappointing. It's a very large hotel, which means you have to queue for service and when you finally reach the front of the queue, they are very keen to get rid of you. We only sought tourist advice from the concierge once and when we did he got it completely wrong - sending us to the Berlin bunkers for a 2pm tour that had actually happened at 11am! The rooms were OK, although the bathroom is literally in the bedroom with no privacy whatsoever - if you're travelling with a friend you can't be shy! I have travelled to Berlin a number of times and there are definitely better options, offering better value!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a view to die for”
Reviews.Author: ArjenP
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in april 2007 for 3 nights. The room was very clean and had a very nice bed. The bathroom was small, but a nice shower. The glass panels between the room and bathroom were a nice feature. We were on the 27th floor and had view to die for! Ask for a room on the highest floor, you won't regret it! Location was perfect, on the Alexanderplatz you can get on several U and S Bahn lines troughout the city (buy a 3 day city card).

Reviews.Title: “Great location but they'll charge you for everything they can!”
Reviews.Author: Jen1D
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great spot but i was disappointed at internet availability. The wi-fi was charged at approx 6.50 an hour for guests!! they advertise the amazing roof top views but you also have to pay 3 euros to get up there. the rooms are clean and small - i did find it very odd that the toilet is actually in the room with a partition round it - rather than having an actual separate room. However, the breakfast was delicious and great value if included in the overall rate. On a separate note - Berlin is a fantastic city but don't go in Feb unless you can really handle the cold.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but first night was awful.”
Reviews.Author: larede
Reviews.Content: We had our room booked on the net, not knowing really what to expect. At arrival we were informed that the best room in our category was on the 9th floor and we were recommended to add an extra €10/night to have a better room. The "better room" turned out to be a very small room at the 24th floor in which you could not regulate the heating and next to a ventilation? shaft that made the wall vibrate in an extremly annoying way. After complaining at the recption they promised to send someone to check the heating, which they either didn't do or it could not be fixed. Since we were taking a walk outside we don't really know. Afer a sleepless night we naturally complained again in the reception and this time we were offered to change room to the 19th floor, an almost similar room but with normal heating system and no vibrating walls. When we checked out two nights later we were to our great surprise and disapoointment fully charged for the first night (incl. the extra €10 for the "better room"). I just didn't have the will to start a new argument then and we were already late for the airport so I let it slip. But in my mind there is absolutely no reason why we should pay for the first night at all. Besides the fact that the bathroom is located inside the room, an architectural idea that does nothing for the atmosphere of the room whatsoever, the rest was an OK experience, but we will not come back if it can be avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Euro Hotel - friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: LaurenV
Reviews.Content: My co-worker picked this hotel (without me knowing!), she got a great deal on easyclicktravel - but it really is a great pick.
