The hotel has a great location for vacationers too - no restaurants right next store, but within a 15 minute walk there are great one's!! (just past the rat-house (government building). Subway stop 15 feet away. The staff has been great....the rooms are more like 3-3.5 (euro-style small), but the staff is 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “nice & modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Schlauchen
Reviews.Content: Stayed there overnight during a school trip. It's located directly at the Alexanderplatz with the metro station nearby. The rooms are clean and I liked especially the modern bathroom out of glass, in the middle of the room. A large choice at the breakfast, and some newspapers available.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel in Central Berlin”
Reviews.Author: magicmard
Reviews.Content: i stayed at ParkInn Alexanderplatz in early March 2009. I had a junior suite room over looking the TV tower. The room was really good, spacious and clean. Both bathroom sinks were slow in draining, but that didn't matter much. I was very happy with the room I had. i didn't like the public areas of the hotel: it was very pedestrian. The hotel is a base for tour buses, tourist groups, and school children on tour of the capital with their teachers. so if you're looking for a quiet, serene lobby, this hotel is not for you. As the matter of fact, there isn't that much of a lobby. There was some construction outside of the front lobby of the hotel, but the noise was not a factor. The hotel is very close to U and S lines, and very central to attraction points. Alexanderplatz by itself is not my favorite place though. I noticed a lot quieter (but close to action) areas nearby. i didn't eat at the hotel restaurants. Breakfast buffet is charged at 18 Euros which is a tad steep given the fact that a couple of blocks away you could get breakfast at 5-10 Euros. (go towards Hackescher Markt). i had a couple of beers at the lobby bar which is quite nice and has nightly music. i didn't like having to pay 18 Euros per 24 hours for internet access either. It is too steep for American standards. The gym is tiny. No weights, just some thread-mills at a very small/no windows room. Credit to the hotel: you don't see the gym advertised on their website. Frankly, it was more fun to walk outside although it was freezing. In summary, it is value vs. quality. If you're looking for a good price room in central location, ParkInn is for you. If you are looking for something more elegant, you might want to try other hotels in nearby areas such as GendermanMarkt.

Reviews.Title: “Awful service”
Reviews.Author: Patgar64
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 nights at the Park Inn Alexanderplatz. Because of the tempest across Europe on February 28th, 2010 our flight was canceled early in the morning and Air France put us on the 19H05 flight. It was also cancelled later in the afternoon. I immediately called the hotel. I could not believe they charged us the first night and there is nothing we could do about it. This is ludicrous, given the circunstances any hotel would have reimbursed us without any charge. Avoid this hotel because this talks a lot about their attitude and greediness.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, rooms, clear”
Reviews.Author: airpet
Reviews.Content: Hotel in great place, 100 meters from metro, quite rooms, good breakfast, clean, is a little bit expensive except if you reserve it from otel.com. We took it half a price than from all the other web sites (with breakfast). Only con is bathroom. It has only a glass so if you are with a friend it would be difficult to take a bathroom (no privacy!).

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great location, everything is an extra cost”
Reviews.Author: mattik23
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for a city break - near the sights and able to walk almost everywhere. Modern, clean room and service all great. Breakfast, wi-fi, use of sauna, roof terrace and bar on 37th floor (although very nicely advertised), are all at extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Nice overall”
Reviews.Author: thanaseto
Reviews.Content: + Location + Service + Room with view has great view indeed - Small room - Bathroom not convenient, separated with the rest of the room with a curtain only

Reviews.Title: “4 star hotel with a view in the middle of everything!”
Reviews.Author: Meneldor
Reviews.Content: It was my first stay in a 4 star hotel in the very center for 55 Euro per night (till Jan 10th) and then 70 Euro per night (beginning of January - special prices!). Everything was perfect for these money, just perfect. Not sure that I would pay 150 Euro for this, but price I found was unbelievable. And the location is the best in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mz_authentik
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Inn and were extremely satisfied. We got the suite, which included breakfast in the room rate. The breakfast buffet was SUPERB. The best I have ever seen, even at European standards. There were a bunch of options hot and cold. The room was very nice and comfortable, I was a bit apprehensive because I had not slept on a waterbed virtually ever. I dunno what is was about this one in particular, but that was some of the best sleep in my life! We did not know that our room rate included unlimited access to the wetbar, so we were a bit upset when we found out at checkout..lol. We also went to Spagos (the restaurant/bar in the hotel) and it was awesome. The drinks were perfect and the live entertainment and setting was on point, unlike most hotels that lack in the department. The only thing I did not like about this hotel was that the room did not have a window. The lady told us it was their BEST suite, but I need a nice view to go with that next time..lol. I also did not like the fact that you had to call reception to get an iron and ironing board. That was strange. The location was perfect, and it allowed you access to all the important stuff, so as a whole, it was an excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very central, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: MaryBBL
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights. No complaints. Room spacious and clean, friendly staff, great location for visiting Berlin. The room was really quiet - on the 29th floor! Great views too. It was our first time in the city and we were able to see plenty of famous landmarks quite close-by. We did not eat in the hotel as we chose to explore elsewhere. Convenient cafe beside the entrance where they serve a good choice of food and drinks if you are hungry! Hotel is near to train station also.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - cant wait to return”
Reviews.Author: brum82
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the hotel on 16 Jan for 2 nights. Room on 23rd floor, had an amazing view of ciry skyline and TV tower. Hotel rooms of a decent size, bath room area is quite open plan except toilet. Shower is a rain shower and great to wake you up in the morning. the hotel will also give you robes and slippers for your stay at no extra cost. Mini bar in room was great and not over priced like many other 4 star hotels. Lifts were very quick and have 8 in total. Berlin is a great place to visit and where ever you choose to stay its well worth using the 'welcome card' which you can get at airport to use on all transport systems.

Reviews.Title: “Fab-tastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AdrianaN2
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with a Fulbright group and this hotel was great, except for the elevator system. Sometimes it took 15 mins to get and elevator and it had about 6 of them.

Reviews.Title: “great position especially at Christmas”
Reviews.Author: EvansSylvania
Reviews.Content: Rooms were tiny and bathrooms were transparent - which could be awkward. However at Christmas the markets are right at the doorstep and there is good shopping nearby. Also, the Park Inn is easy to find and the hop on hop off bus stops here. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for singles or couples.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Clean”
Reviews.Author: suzieb74
Reviews.Content: Very impressive reception area, Reception staff were friendly and informative, was checked in and in our room within 10 minutes of arriving. The room was contemporary in style, with a mixture of carpet and marble type tile (underheated) and dark coloured wooden furniture. The room was clean and tidy. Pease note... put the do not disturb sign on the door, before going to bed....we were woken up at least three times by the chamber maids on mornings from as early as 0800 hrs The hotel is slap bang in the middle of bustling Alexanderplatz, 30 metres from the nearest U bahn platform and around 100 metres from Alexanderplatz S bahn station. Lots of shops and sights within 500 metres Breakfast buffet in the 2nd floor restaurant was quite extensive, Spagos rest and bar near the reception area had just been refurbished while we were staying there and opened the night before we left, drinks in Spagos are a little on the expensive side but worth it for little treat, Btw, Alexander, one of the bar men was very friendly

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jefito
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location with lots of public transportation options, including regional trains, U-Bahn, S-Bahn , buses, trams, etc. Several city tour buses stop in front of and across the hotel. Alexanderplatz is a very 'happening' sort of place, centrally located and within walking distance of many popular Berlin sights like the TV Tower, the Rote Rathaus,the Berlin Cathedral, Museum Island, the ''Unter den Linden" Strasse...etc Hotel was nice and clean,modern and comfortable. Staff was friendly and helpful! The breakfast was good with a hot and cold buffet, I would like also like to mention that there is an extra cost of 20euros per person for breakfast! In some cases I would consider the price quite expensive! The room had nice decoration and peculiar design.What I mean is that each room has a shower and toilet, but not exactly private. The bathroom is part of the room and not separate. If youare bashful and there is someone else in your room, they'll hear and see your silhouette in the toilet area. The shower is even less private as the shower glass is see-through. You step out of the shower to a sink area which is next to the bed. In some cases this might be disturbing for your roomate All in all I recomend this hotel and would stay again there in my next trip to Berlin, Iwould consider the hotel affordable!

Reviews.Title: “best trip ever”
Reviews.Author: VanathiT
Reviews.Content: Hotel was so central. Staff v. friendly and helpful. Gave us great recommendations on where to eat and go out. Hotel was so nice and clean and modern but comfortable. Plus affordable!

Reviews.Title: “Great view and location, but old mattress and bathroom privacy issue”
Reviews.Author: tshellthom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location with lots of public transportation options, including regional trains (the Schönefeld airport was only a 30 minute ride on the Airport Express), U-Bahn, S-Bahn , buses, trams, etc. Our room had fantastic city view, we could see (on a clear day) all the way to the Brandenburger Gate and the Reichstag Dome, this made for a comfortable and warm viewing of the New Years Eve fireworks display. The hotel is a short walk to many popular Berlin sights including the TV Tower, St. Marienkirche, the Rote Rathaus, Nikolaiviertel, the Berlin Cathedral, Museum Island, Gendarmenmarkt, etc. If walking is not for you, several city tour buses stop in front of and across the street from the hotel. The concierges were helpful in acquiring concert/tour tickets and making restaurant reservations. If you like Spanish food, one of the few good restaurants in the Alexanderplatz area is Las Olas (http://www.las-olas.de/). We did have a few issues with the hotel. First, the mattresses sagged so badly in the middle that we had to flip them over and turn the 2 twin beds width-wise instead of length-wise to avoid waking up with severe back and shoulder pain. The bathroom setup, specifically the toilet/water closet was disconcerting because it is not sound proofed and the glass door (albeit frosted) did not close securely. The hotel offers fast, reliable Internet access at a fee, obviously we would rather free access, but we are willing to pay a nominal fee; 18 euro per day or 6.50 euro per hour is hardly nominal. The hotel advertises a fitness center, which is more like a large closet with 2 treadmills and 2 elliptical machines. All things considered we would revisit this hotel if we were traveling without our children again. The room had adequate space for 2 adults, but would be difficult with additional guests.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, excellent facilities, helpful staff, great location, good value for money, what more to say?”
Reviews.Author: CultureVultureLJ
Reviews.Content: The Park inn Hotel has been beautifully converted from a former high rise block of East German flats. Alexanderplatz is a very 'happening' sort of place, centrally located and within walking distance of an excellent range of shops, as well as being right next to the station and only minutes by train from the centre of Berlin. We stayed for 7 nights between 13 and 20 December, when it was very cold. Tastefully decorated in a modern style, our room (2617) was on a corner with a spectacular panoramic view of the city, which we spent hours photographing at night. Despite the large windows on both sides, the room was warm (even in temperatures of -15 degrees C) and comfortable, with every convenience. The bathroom was beautiful. The breakfast was good with a hot and cold buffet and even although the hotel was busy, we never had difficulty finding a table in the pleasant, spacious dining room, which also served an excellent buffet dinner in the evening. There was also a small 'a la carte' dining room, a cafe bar, and room service with a small but good choice of meals. The staff were helpful and friendly: when our Pay TV wouldn't work, we were instantly offered free access to the internet instead. The hotel even has direct access from the first floor into the next door department store, so you can shop in the evening without putting on your outdoor clothes in the cold weather! The only small criticism of the hotel was that we wanted to photograph the view from the top floor panorama terrace, which should have been open at certain hours of the day. After finding it closed on two occasions, we were eventually told that it was shut due to the very low temperatures. We did feel that a notice to this effect would have been helpful, as we had stayed in till midday when it was supposed to open, which we would not normally have done. All in all, an excellent stay in a very pleasant hotel. We have stayed in several hotels in Berlin, but will certainly stay at the Park Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, but Cozy”
Reviews.Author: Two-Wheel_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Spent four days of vacation in Berlin, staying at the Park Inn Alexanderplatz. For the location, the value can't be beat, in my opinion. That said, the price is low for a reason -- rooms are modern, clean, but rather spatially challenged. Here're the good points of the hotel: - Excellent location right on Alexanderplatz, which was why we picked it. - Very clean and updated rooms. - Decent service. Note that the lobby is often crowded, but when they get to you the staff is quite professional and efficient. - Restaurants are decent. The Spagos on the lobby level served very good food, in my opinion, for a reasonable price given that it's a hotel. - Reasonably quiet -- slept well. - Fast internet (but not cheap) Here are the not so good: - Really small rooms, with limited space for suitcase, clothes, etc. The closets are functional, but if you're two people with a lot of luggage, the regular rooms won't work for you. - Each room has a shower and toilet, but not exactly private. The bathroom is part of the room and not separate. If you're bashful and there's someone else in your room, they'll hear and see your silhouette in the toilet area. The shower is even less private as the shower glass is see-through. You step out of the shower to a sink area which is next to the bed. Doesn't bother me, but my roommate complained. - Fitness center is really just a basic room with two treadmills and a stationary bike. It's better than nothing, I suppose. - Internet cost about 18 Euros per day ... but it worked well. So, if cozy rooms and see-through shower stall is ok, then I recommend this hotel. I'll probably go back again.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed”
Reviews.Author: olaopa
Reviews.Content: Staying in Park Inn Berlin-Alexanderplatz was a real pleasure. Actually I didn't plan any vacation but one day me and my friend from work were informed that we should take our holidays on a certain date, quite close to the time we were told about. So actually there was not much of a planning, we just entered Last minute travel web site and decided we're going to Berlin. We found on the site this amazing hotel for less than 100$ a night (for both) and we received a VIP service. It was excellent, we enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “For that true Eastern Block Service experience why not stay at the...”
Reviews.Author: megalon
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation through the Hotel's own website for a 25m2 room with a panoramic view, bath, etc. Knowing I would be arriving late; I made a note of this on the reservation. Not trusting Hotels; I called in the afternoon to say I was on my way and to check that they were keeping my room. So I arrive to find that there is no room you think? No. That would be just incompetence. I arrived, and was told that I would have to pay for my room in advance, which seemed strange, but it was late and I just wanted to go to bed so... I go up to my room a little disappointed to see that it was only on the fourth floor, but much more disappointed to find that it is barely 10m2 with one small window, no bath. So I go back to reception to point out the mistake, only to be told that this is actually their "Executive Room". While I appreciated the "Executive" status this gave me; really I just wanted the room that I had made the reservation for (and just been made to pay for in advance). No. Apparently my reservation was for the "Executive Room". Which coincidently was the exact same price as the much larger room with the bath and the view but no "Executive" in the name. So since it was the same price it would be simple to swap me over to the non-executive room, yes? No? Alas there were no rooms fitting my description available, if only I'd made a reservation... I hadn't expected to have to print out the reservation as evidence, but luckily managed to retrieve an email on my mobile that they had sent me as confirmation, which included the following lines: Room Type: Business Panorama Room Approximate size of room: 24 m², complete window front in two directions, marble bathroom with bath tub and heated floors, ................ Minibar, Hair dryer Aaaah, that room, of course, yes, now he understood, after seeing written evidence which I was more than willing to pass around the other witnesses on my side of the reception desk in an attempt to cause as big a scene as possible. They would issue me a new key immediately, now had I taken anything from the "Executive" mini bar during my five second stay in the room? As noted elsewhere the hotel is centrally located, and the thirty-first floor where I eventually stayed has a view. It has a view of Berlin. Don't build your hopes up, this is a city that was extensively remodelled by a combination of Bomber Harris and Stalin. It is not Paris, apparently it is not even Manchester. Google image results in descending order of popularity for: London Skyline 1,700,000 Paris Skyline 890,000 Manchester Skyline 223,000 Berlin Skyline 200,000 Birmingham Skyline 157,000 I have stayed in Berlin a number of times and it has many great features, its skyline is not one of them. Nor is the service at the Park Inn Hotel. P.S. They spammed me requesting that I leave a review at this website. More than happy to oblige.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely return to this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MargaretLiverpool
Reviews.Content: My husband , myself and our two friends have just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel. The hotel was conveniently placed for one of the Christmas markets at Alexanderplatz, which was the reason for our visit to Berlin. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful, as was the concierge , who advised us that the cheapest way for us to travel around the city was to get a daily group travel ticket. This saved us 44 euros over three days! The rooms were immaculate and the beds were extremely comfortable. The only downside to the room, and something worth considering if you are travelling with a friend, was that the shower and toilet were part of the room encased in a glass cubicle. The breakfast buffet was varied and substantial, and even included soup as an option.Wewill definitely be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location... bad bed!”
Reviews.Author: DyanaV
Reviews.Content: The Park Inn Alexanderplatz is in a fantastic location. The metro and the S-Bahn are conveniently located, easy walking distance to Hekscher Markt and fantastic restaurants/ shops/ bars nearby. The hotel itself, is a lot of things, you can climb down the hotel, there's a burger king out the front, there is a casino on the higher floor, there are bars... unfortunately it feels like they are trying to do too many things at once, that the hotel gets a bit forgotten. It is a nice hotel, with good rooms, we stayed in a "business room". I don't understand the idea of the shower though, which is basically in the room, and if you want things private you pull a curtain around the shower and the sink to hide yourself from the other person in the room, you also need to do this if you use the toilet unless you want your partner to see you. Definitely need to be good friends to stay in this room! The bed was horrible, very uncomfortable, it was too soft and had caved in the middle, did not get one good nights sleep. It was a trade off though, because you can't beat the location, and really in Berlin, you don't need much sleep as there is so much going on! The room is also too hot, tried many times to cool it down but never worked, even in the higher rooms you get a view of all the communist era buildings, but it's a great reminder of where this fabulous city has grown from. Probably wouldn't stay here again, but for the price and location it isn't too bad...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with additional 'rip-offs'”
Reviews.Author: 1777NT
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, very central, easy to locate, wonderful views if you are high up on the western side. Dining facilities for breakfast are very good, never tried the restaurant for other meals as it was somewhat overpriced compared with local dining facilities, never actually found the bar, and the supposedly bar/dining room on the roof was permanently closed. However, the what did appear to be a sensibly priced hotel; let itself down on the additional 'rip-offs' which could normally only be found in abysmal UK hotels. If the roof bar had been open you had to pay €3 to use it, even for people that are paying to stay at the hotel, and then the ultimate insult that prevents the thought of using the place again or indeed recommending it to anyone.... they charge €5 to use the internet for 15 minutes, almost as expensive to check-in on a flight as it costs to fly on it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms but shocking service”
Reviews.Author: Courts22
Reviews.Content: Rooms are fantastic as is the location . . . However I was spoken to so rudely by the restaurant manager that it has led me for the first time to complain on trip adviser - she shouted at my husband at breakfast and tried telling my husband and i where we could stand - i felt i was at school! When we asked to speak to her boss at the reception desk she came over and said she had done nothing wrong. I have never been so shocked at such lack of client understanding or failure by her to even try and appease a client In summary i would recommed hotel based on other factors but watch out for the female manager

Reviews.Title: “Central location, but missing the x factor”
Reviews.Author: Paulrhodes16
Reviews.Content: The hotel couldn't be easier to find, or more central. You get a very warm welcome, and this carries over to the room which was too hot - and couldn't be cooled. I'd recommend asking for a room on a high floor (there are 37 to choose from) to get the benefit from it's lofty position. We were staying on floor 9, and the view was unremarkable. The main downside to this hotel, as mentioned by other reviewers, is that many of the features that draw you to staying in a 4* hotel are all charged for. The viewing facility - open from 10-6 is 3 euros, while Internet access in the lobby is 6.50 euros for an hour. So a clean, centrally located hotel, with good service, but certainly missing the x-factor.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Seagreen75
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times now and always had a positive experience. It's easy to find, standards are always good and it's well located for exploring Berlin. Prices are reasonable and I've never reason to be anything but very satisfied with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to high expectations”
Reviews.Author: EUReviewer
Reviews.Content: This hotel, although perhaps a little daunting from the outside due to its communist-era concrete, is a great base for a stay in Berlin. The location right on Alexanderplatz really could not be better, as the U-Bahn, Trams and Friedrichstraße station are 2 minutes' walk away. The reception staff were particularly friendly and helpful upon our arrival and departure. The lobby is airy and fresh, as is the bar situated alongside it. Our room had a fantastic view over Alexanderplatz and the Fernsehturm - two of the key locations in Berlin's modern history. The beds were very comfortable and the layout of the room was excellent, making the best use of space possible. The bathroom has been cleverly incorporated into the rest of the room, although not to the extent at which it would be impersonal or intrusive. Breakfast was a little disappointing for a hotel of this level in Germany. The restaurant was rather tired and the selection was quite limited. However, it was still possible to be rightly satisfied and set up for the day. I would definitely not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Great view but otherwise average”
Reviews.Author: ErikFromSweden
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice when my favorite hotel in Berlin were fully booked and it was ok. Truly an amazing view from my room on the 28th floor, but the hotel is a little bit like a big ferry: no charm what so ever and a little bit worn down. One upside though: the price for the room was really good, so it's absolutely good value for the money spent! Never had breakfast there but I've heard it was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location, great service”
Reviews.Author: JaapWess
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the ParkInn Alexenander Platz during TechEd Europe in November 2009. It is a great hotel, the location is good, next to the S-Bahn. Spacy rooms, nice view over the city. Breakfast was fine as well as the bar in the evening. People work hard to make guests comfortable. Next year it's a must go!

Reviews.Title: “Ok value for money”
Reviews.Author: Karkrist
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Park Inn for four nights and the location is good. The hotel is in Alexander platz, and if you arrive in berlin from Schönefeld airport you can take the train straight in to town. the hotel is two minutes from the train station. Our room was on the 18th floor with nice view of the city. The room was small with low ceiling (maybe 2m20cm), but nice. The bathroom was a suprise. There were no walls so if you like your privacy while showering you have to draw the curtain between the bed and the shower. the shower was nice though. If you like to go to the casino on the 39th floor you have to wear a jacket and a tie, and we were told it was a 10 euro cover charge. Over all it's ok for four nights. If you want something romantic, you should get another type of room or stay at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Anguslass
Reviews.Content: The hotel couldn't be easier to find, and it seems to be near everything! We had a great view of Alexanderplatz and the TV tower from our bedroom. The room was clean and modern. The toilet layout is odd, but not a problem. I would definately stay here again, but this time I would avoid Spagos and Humbolts Restaurants like the plague. Total rip off joints. Humbolts is just way too expensive for what it is (and I suspect that that's why they don't put the prices on display), and Spagos is the same, though it is nice inside. Overall it was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great + very overpriced”
Reviews.Author: ewanas
Reviews.Content: Location is good and the hotel public areas are nice enough. However, the rooms are small and very basic in equipment. The hotels PR makes a big deal about the roof terrace but fails to mention your expected to pay 3 Euro to gain access, even if your already paying 150 Euro a night to stay in the hotel. Also having to pay 1 Euro to use the toilets in the lobby is just taking the p*ss IMO. The 18 Euro breakfast was way overpriced for a basic buffet also. For half the money i think a Ibis or Travel inn type hotel would give the same basic facilities without the expensive extras that are overpriced in the first place. I Wouldn't stay here again its just not value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Use the Welcome Card”
Reviews.Author: Icenorum
Reviews.Content: The hotel is central next to subway,tram and train stops. Also you can see the adjacent TV tower from all over Berlin so you can find it easily by foot. The bus (TXL) from Tegel airport stops on the main road just outside the Park Inn. You can buy a ticket from the BVG desk close to the exit at the airport (you'll see the queue). It costs 2.10 euros and you validate it on the machine inside the bus. You can also buy at this desk - or at the concierge at the hotel - a Berlin Welcome card. We bought ours for 5 days at 34.50 euros and it was great value because you can use it on all transport systems,(including TXL) you only need to validate it once, and practically everywhere we went we received a decent discount on admission charges. As for the hotel. It was very warm and the service was good. The concierge is helpful but ask him if you want to go to Potsdam by train

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location for a city break”
Reviews.Author: josiemalone
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Park Inn with my boyfriend on our first trip to Berlin. It's in an excellent location, right in the heart of Berlin, easy to find and great access to transport. The hotel itself is great and there are fab views from the rooms - we stayed in floor 32. The 'open' bathroom and shower area isn't a big deal so don't let this put you off as I don't imagine you would be sharing with a stranger anyway! We didn't have to deal with the staff much but when we did, there were polite and helpful. Alexanderplatz itself is quite touristy but you have great access to get to other areas of the city. We'd stay here again if we went back as the location is really what makes it. - especially when you are only there for a few days. Make sure you visit Prenzlauer Berg for fab cafes, restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Impersonal but worth staying in for the view”
Reviews.Author: Venezia41
Reviews.Content: I apologise for my late comments re my stay at the Park Inn Hotel, Berlin, for 3 nights, 1 to 3 February this year, due to being retrenched when I returned to work after my vacation. The Park Inn is a ‘high-rise’, non-smoking, hotel located on Alexanderplatz. On check-in I was allocated a very small room, which “smelled overpoweringly” of cigarette smoke. After going back to reception to complain about the cigarette smell, which met with “but this is a non-smoking hotel” each time I suggested that the room should be checked, which seemed to fall on deaf ears, I decided to upgrade anyway to a larger room and was allocated a Panorama Room (corner superior room) @ €20 p.n. extra (but definitely worth it). Dinner the first night (Sunday) in Spagos (main restaurant) left a lot to be desired re what I ate (a burger) but thankfully my waitress was excellent. The next morning, a most comprehensive buffet breakfast was served in “Spagos”, which made up for what was lacking, food-wise, the night before as the buffet had many choices of juices, cereals, breads, fruits, cheeses and cold meats as well as hot dishes, etc. For the next two nights I had excellent dinners in “Zille Stube” and was served by very pleasant and helpful waitresses. My last buffet breakfast was in “Humbolts” Restaurant, which had a good selection but not quite as good as in Spagos. I recommend this hotel in relation to its very helpful Reception staff and its access to shopping (major department store opposite), transport (bus, S and U Bahn plus trams) as well as proximity to Museum Island and other major sites on and around Unter der Linden and the Brandenburg Tor, etc.

Reviews.Title: “39-story tower, clean with comfortable beds in a great location to all transportation”
Reviews.Author: travelsbydori
Reviews.Content: Small yet comfortable room. Be aware that usual bathroom privacy most of us expect is not part of the experience - the beds, modern bathroom sink/shower stall is all open area. There's a hospital-track type curtain that can be pulled around the bathroom sink/shower stall area. The john is separate with a door and a translucent glass wall that faces the room. Health spa and casino on premises. TXL bus from Tegel airport takes you right to the hotel for E2.10.

Reviews.Title: “can't beat the location...and the hotel is pretty good too”
Reviews.Author: cchouin
Reviews.Content: given that it located at the alexanderplatz, the hotel couldn't be in a better location in berlin. there are a number of bars, restaurants and cafes as well as many places to shop around the hotel. it's in the middle of everything, with all forms of public transportation in the immediate vicinity. reception is very friendly and willing to help. we had questions about the location of a particular place and, without hesitation, the staff at reception gave us a map and explained how to get there. in case there was any question, they also pulled it up on their internet so we would have a better idea of where we were going. while they are very modern, the rooms are not terribly spacious. as many other reviews state, it is also be helpful to travel with someone with whom you are very comfortable. there is almost zero privacy in the rooms. not only can you hear nearly everything taking place in the bathroom from anyplace in the room, but the bathroom walls are frosted glass. overall, not much is left to the imagination. that aside, the view from the room is great as you can see much of berlin. our room was also very clean and the bed was comfortable. as a side note: we also decided to venture up to the hotel's rooftop terrace that the hotel advertises heavily. although i do recommend staying at this hotel, i can't say i would go back to the terrace. the view was nothing compared to the view you get from the fernsehturm, which is only a 5 - 10 min walk from the hotel. it was also crowded (not enough seating) when we went and drinks are very much overpriced. if you want to see the city, it's worth spending a few extra euro to see the whole city at the fernsehturm.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: chrismarkwalker
Reviews.Content: Took my girlfriend to Berlin for a birthday treat last year. It was only £60 a night for the room, the buffet is immense loads of everything you dont need lunch after it. The hotel is right opposite Alexanderplatz station so it great as you can get train direct from the airport right to Alexanderplatz then walk across the square and its there. The rooms were spotless and maid came everyday. Also you can never get lost in berlin as it by the TV tower so when you want to go home just follow the tower

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Scunneredbywork
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Inn for 3 nights & really enjoyed our stay. We booked the hotel through GTA Hotels as one of their secret hotels on a B & B basis. This way it was 10 euros a night less than the standard price on GTA. The hotel couldn't be better located. We got the train from Schoenfeld straight to Alexanderplatz, the station is practically in front of the hotel (with C & A & a department store in between). So if you want to use public transport to get about you couldn't choose a better place. We had a short wait to check in but we asked if we could have a room on a high floor & we were given a nice room on the 29th floor with an absolutely cracking view of the TV tower. We thought the room was simple but nice & bright, personally we don't mind the shower & toilet cubicle set up as it is better than cramming everything into a tiny dark pokey bathroom that you can only get into one at a time (or in what I mistakenly thought was the wardrobe when we stayed in Florence). If you are a modest person then the shower being open into the room might not be your thing but then you have been warned!! Breakfast was good & it was really quiet when we were there,(from Sunday to Wednesday & we tended to go between 9 & 10 so that maybe helped. Our first night we ate at Spagos in the hotel which was really nice, usual big hotel pricey drinks & I didn't know until then that the small glass of wine is only 100ml- that's really small- but other than that the service & the food were very good (as was the small wine). The other 2 nights we ate at the Brauhaus Georgbrau in the Nikolaiviertel area which is just down from the hotel towards the river & then at Barist under the S Bahn arches in the Heckescher Market. We enjoyed the meals we had in both & both were about a 10 minute walk from the hotel. We didn't feel the need to use public transport, we walked up Unter den Linden to the Brandenburg Gate, then to the Reichstag, back the the Jewish memorial, then to Potsdamer Platz & the Sony Centre then to Checkpoint Charlie, Gendarmenmarkt, then back to the hotel via Nikolaiviertel for a glass of wine by the river. It was a fair distance but we were strolling, taking everything in & it was an excellent day& we thought best way to see the sights. The following day we did one of the boat trips, we just took the hour trip & we also enjoyed this, it was a relaxed way to see some of the sights from a different viewpoint. So go to Berlin & stay in the Park Inn Alexanderplatz. Oh & we waited about an hour & a half in the queue to see the Reichstag Dome but it was well worth the wait when we walked up the ramp to the very top. Spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fabulous hotel.”
Reviews.Author: moddy102
Reviews.Content: It is an amazing and luxurious hotel situated in the heart of Berlin. The staff are lovely and I would definitely return there.

Reviews.Title: “rooms like student digs”
Reviews.Author: 050810a
Reviews.Content: i told my parents to book this hotel as its been in Berlin since the 60s and thought it must be good to survive. it is a former Communist hotel where western politicians and diplomats stayed in the cold war so it has an interesting history. however on entering the room we collapsed in shock, it looked like a hall of residence. 80s portable TV nailed to the wall, sink next to bed and the worst thing was the bathroom. apparently the rooms used to have shared bathroom and the bathrooms have only been recently fitted. the bathroom consists of 2 cubicles, one toilet and the other shower so make sure you ravel alone or with someone very close- the cubicles are of frosted glass with gaps under and over so if youre in the shower or on the toilet, your travelling companion will see n hear everything! Breakfast is a travesty too, its 12 euro and the food is probably nice but they pack too many people in (bear in mind the hotel has 35 floors) . Go to the nearby restaurant Alex for a 5 euro breakfast instead or the coffeehouse underneath the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: icelandic_cat
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a weekend with my husband. The location was great, right in Alexanderplatz with the train and underground stations just outside. The Airport Express train takes you to from the airport to the station and from there it is about one minute's walk to the hotel, very convenient. We had a room at the 32nd floor, facing the TV tower. The view was absolutely great. The bathroom arrangement was a bit weird, but was fine by us. Would not recommend this for people who get undressed in the dark, but just fine if you don't mind walking about naked in front of the person sharing your room. Everything worked as it should, comfy bed and good service at the front desk. I would definitely consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view, good location but the hip interior has its draw backs”
Reviews.Author: MarieMalmo
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a friend for a week. The hotel is very well situated in the old eastern part very close to the museum island and shopping areas. The underground and the S train stop at Alexanderplats so the communications are very good. The room was average size and as many before here as pointed out the modern design is nice and feels up to date. However since the door to the toilet are and everything surrounding that area is made of glass and hard wood/tiles I srongly recommend not to stay here unless you know your travel companion well and are both relaxed in each others company ... There are very few places to actually put your things (drawers/knobs/hangers/shelves) The service of the hotel was good - we had some problems with the booking but everything was solved efficiently at the reception. Breakfast was huge and the selection good.

Reviews.Title: “The Epitomy of Modern Berlin Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Turrysagh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located adjacent to Alexanderplatz which has several modes of transport available, the U Bahn, S Bahn, trams and buses all are available.Three alternative U Bahn lines converge the U2, U8 and U5. We flew into Schonefeld and there are two airport express trains that stop at Alexanderplatz the RE7 and RB14. We used the train. However, there is also an airport bus which has a similar journey length. Buy the Berlin Card at the Tourist Info desk in the airport (turn right after baggage reclaim) this gives you unlimited use of all public transport in Berlin. You can purchase different periods ie 72 hours. It also gives numerous discounts at museums, attractions and restaurants. Please note that you must validate the card before use ie to start the clock running. The cards can be validated on the train platforms at very inconspicuous short red boxes on grey columns (there were no signs). After that its great, just one word of warning you need to carefully plot you routes around the city e.g. the underground has several lines and you will probably need to change a few times and possibly use all modes of transport to get about to your chosen destinations. Also be careful what exit of the underground you leave by since you may find yourself heading the wrong direction. That said it is wonderful. Tip for finding the hotel - leave the station from the Dircksenstrasse exit and you should be facing a square across which is an entrance to the hotel. The hotel is unmissable being extremely tall. The hotel room is very comfortable and clean. There is a free to use safe. There is no tea/coffee making facility. As noted previously the rooms have glass walled wc and shower (the wc is obscure glass, however you can see through it) and so if sharing with a friend I hope you are not too easily embarrassed. I guess it's a British hang up. There is a privacy curtain which helps your modesty a bit - however there is no sound proofing between the wc and the room - turn up the TV. I couldn't imagine my parents being too enamored with the arrangement. Another tip is to hang the do not disturb sign on the door as the cleaner just knocks and enters - you have been warned! We booked through Lastminute.com and got the room for 3 nights for £175. We didn't eat at the Park Inn, I think the breakfast is about 18 euro and it is very easy to find cafes or bakeries all around serving any kind of food at vastly cheaper prices. We didn't pay anything like 18 euro for 'two' of us, never mind each! For evening dining you are spoilt for choice we ate at an Italian called Soleno in the Nikolai area. It is a small cosy budget restaurant and very nice and good value for money. We also ate at Thai Inside on Dircksenstrasse 37, this is an excellent restaurant with fantastic presentation to the dishes - every one a photograph. The food was delicious and reasonably priced, its to be recommended and is a short stroll to the Park Inn. We also ate at Corroboree at Bellevuetrasse 5 in the Sony centre at Potsdammer Platz. This is an Australian type eatery and is ok - it has croc and kangaroo. Plenty of pubs around also although watch out they seem to be able to smoke in part of the premises and you can therefore get a bit of smoke filtering through. Main sites visited include the usual Reichstag, Brandenburg gate etc; A good trip is on the Spree which gives a great view of the city and some of the new buildings. I'm an architect and the architecture of Berlin is excellent. A visit to the Bauhaus archive is worthwhile although its empty of exhibitions the building is a delight. I would also recommend the Jewish Museum both for the exhibits but also to experience the building - it is quite unsettling. The holocaust memorial is very moving. Checkpoint Charlie is unfortunately a touristy attraction with photographs and stamped postcards its a bit tacky and sadly a bit disrespectful of those who died during the cold war years trying to escape. Three days is not enough in this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, clean, business style and top location”
Reviews.Author: mattmeier
Reviews.Content: Good service, perfect location. We also stayed at lux 11 (aprox. 1 min far away, which is a bit more trendy) Park Inn has a better view however and a bit more business style. Both are nice hotels. Park inn has good prices for what they offer. Nothing bad to say..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: SharonJLM
Reviews.Content: While the rooms are smallish, the location and service cannot be rivaled, as well as the view. Staff were friendly and helpful, and the breakfast was great too. Small tip: housekeeping will not knock on the door before entering, so be sure to leave the 'Do not disturb' sign whenever you are in the room. Almost everyone in our group was walked in on by housekeeping. Another note: internet is available in the hotel, but very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Continues to be a safe bet”
Reviews.Author: AlvinNarod
Reviews.Content: Thie was my second visit to this hotel, a year after my first, and it brought no surprises. The hotel was good value for the area, the room was roomy, clean and provided a nice view of the TV Tower. The entire hotel is non-smoking - a HUGE plus in my book since most public areas in Europe, including Germany are still filled with smoke, unlike in Canada so the hotel is an oasis in a sea of Berlin cigarette smoke. The room design is a little unconventional, as reported by other reviewers; the shower is separated from the sleeping area by only a glass wall. However, a curtain can be drawn to separate the two areas. But couples travelling together who may not be too intimate, might want to consider this before booking. There's little I can fault this hotel on - the staff do seem a little cold - A sign at reception says something like, "Wait here for the next smile" but smiles were few and far between from the staff. It didn't really bother me; perhaps I'm just looking for a bad comment to make. When I checked in, there was no line up but I did notice, at other times, very loing lineups for checkin. I must have been lucky. Neverhthesss, I did my checking out the evening before, to avoid morning lineups. I left very early in the morning, and it turned out there was no lineup but hey, I was just being sure since I didn't want to miss my train. I have no h esitation in recommending this hotel both for value, clenaliness, location and comfort. Oh, I just remembered that WiFi access at this hotel is extremely expensive (18 Euro for 24 hours) which was more than I'd been used to in other locations. I thought this to be such a rip off that I didn't purchase it and did without it for the duration.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, superior service and the best view over Berlin”
Reviews.Author: DanishTraveller2009
Reviews.Content: Went there for 5 days and stayed on the 21nd floor in a Panorama Room. We had free view over the city and the TV Tower was right in front of us. The rooms are clean and the bathroom is a litte different in this hotel as you can see in the gallery ond their webpage. But it´s no problem at all. The service all around the hotel is superior and the staff is friendly and very helpfull. Good food in the restaurant both morning and evening and the price is fair. The U- and S-Bahn is right outside the hotel to take you whereever you want to go. It´s very easy. We would like to come back another time is possible. This hotel comes highly recommended from out point of view.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location....Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: throwerp
Reviews.Content: The Park Inn in Alexanderplatz is a perfect location for seeing the sights of Berlin as the transport links are scattered all around the square. The hotel iself is comfortable, modern and decent value for money. The views from the top of the hotel are among the best in the city and the unique bathrooms make this place a little quirky too! All in all a great base from which tio start your Berlin experience!!

Reviews.Title: “A surprise”
Reviews.Author: Railpasser
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by the tourist bureau at the Hauptbanhof. Being a budget hotel user i expected it to be the usual slightly seedy hotel . For the price it is excellent value and definatly not seedy. good transport connections and close to many attractions, and helpful staff. Rooms are clean and modern with what a european hotel needs .Suggest that other hotel users consider this as a benchmark for standards/price. breakfast was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Mogart59
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in a great location. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We requested a high floor and, even arriving late at night, were upgraded to a corner room. The views were amazing, day and night (we had great views of stunning fireworks at Templehof Airport). It takes a bit getting used to the bathroom being in the bedroom but other than that, the room was fine. Breakfast was included in our rate and it had a great selection. We also enjoyed an evening meal buffet - great value and great choice. The hotel is near to some of the sights. We tend to walk rather than take buses, etc so we enjoyed the walk down Unten der Linden on more than one occasion. However, the train is very convenient from the station across the road if you want to go farther. It does cost €3 to go on the roof terrace, but the views are terrific from there, especially if you like taking photographs! All in all, we loved the hotel, especially the panoramic views.

Reviews.Title: “clean hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: dagb20
Reviews.Content: Myself and a group of friends stayed in the hotel in July. The hotel is in a great location with all forms of transport available close by. The rooms are small but clean. The major issues with the room in the shower area with the curtain. The whole shower design with the bathrooms does take a lot away from what is an otherwise good hotel. Had no problems with reception staff checking in or out, but the restaurant\pub staff could learn to be more nice considering the prices they charge for food and drink.

Reviews.Title: “Dont take panorama room”
Reviews.Author: mikeleprague
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was ok, clean and good breakfast for the money. The only problem we had was the room, we choose panorama view room, which is higher price than standard. I requested high floor and queen size beed, neither of the request were fullfiled. We were on the 8th floor of a 40 and facing the construction parking, so no view of berlin at all ( which was the main reason to pick this hotel). When I told that in reception they say the room type comes only with twin beds and that they and any single room availble to change it to us, out of 40 floors hotel I doubt this, as well we had a continuesly sound from the A/C and you can not switch it off. Overall good location and price, but beware of the room type before you choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok...but great location”
Reviews.Author: Travelaba
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel clean, safe and staff very nice and helpful. If your looking for a hotel with a personal touch this hotel is not for you - it's huge and bland-looking. We had a suite, but later found out it didn't have any windows. To be honest this was very weird, even though the rooms were in tip-top shape, we constantly felt we were at some 1990s nightclub when we were there. Huge breakfast selection. Great location for hip Mitte neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - fantastic view!!”
Reviews.Author: Stepsyl14
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Inn for two nights with our teenage daughter and another family. We had a junior suite - a huge corner room on the 35th floor!. The room was spotless and the views were incredible. We did not have the see-through shower situation. The reception area was busy, as it is a large hotel, but very efficient. I agree that the breakfast was overpriced, but plenty of inexpensive options in the area. We loved the Kaufhof department store next door for food, and the 'wurst' vendors outside in the plaza. We would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Recommended”
Reviews.Author: adam3544
Reviews.Content: We've stay in this giant hotel for 8 nights. The location on the Alexanderplatz is suberb, very close to big transportation hub and close to the main tourist attractions in Berlin. Because this is very big hotel, therefore there is a feeling of train station, like in those giant hotels of Las Vegas. A constant movement of hords of visitors, line for registration, etc. The room we got on 32 floor, was rather compact with glass partition cab inside was the bathroom and WC. It's a little bit weird, but the glass is semi transparent. The breakfast (at additional price) was buffet style in huge dining room. The food was very good. The towels were exchanged on the daily base. Room was clean. There was a mini bar and safe. The bed, matress and pillows were very comfortable. Finally, the view from 32nd floor of Berlin was breathtaking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & stylish hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaChee
Reviews.Content: The hotel is gorgeous, stylish, modern & chic! Great location & near shopping centre which is good news for me to do last minutes shopping & grab all the chocolates & souvenirs (especially Berlin Bear)! The only things that I remember about this hotel is the see-through bath room, but this shouldn't be an issue as there is curtain to pull around the cubicle, which I think many people do not know about it!

Reviews.Title: “a good hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: georginio
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hotel for five nights. the location of the hotel is perfect. easy access to bus,tram and s & u - bahn. both airports (tegel & schoenfeld) are easy to reach. the hotel is very big. with a lot of rooms and of course a lot of people checking in and out all the time. but the reception staff is quick and effective. very good concierge service. they seem to know almost everything and are very kind and helpful. we stayed in a panorama room which had very nice view and a very nice sunset from our room. the bathroom (the shower) as many reviewers say is open.it has only glass to keep the water in. if you go with your loved one then that's no problem. but in a case of going with a friend or business associate it can be a problem. it had a curtain but i don't know how much it helps . elevators were fast. omly two drawbacks are : 1. very expensive breakfast (18 euros per person) in a city that you can find great breakfast in many cafes until late in the afternoon. we haven't tried the hotel breakfast so i can't comment on the quality. 2.very expensive internet services and i think no wireless service (at least in our room on the 18th floor). but that is a problem generally in berlin. very few places with free wireless internet. overall we were happy with our stay. comfortable clean modern rooms, great location and it wasn't expensive (if you book more than two weeks in advance you get better prices).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: SquareNothing
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Inn just before christmas. First of all the location of the hotel really is fantastic, right in the centre of alexaderplatz and approx 1 min walk to the train station and subways. We stayed on the 17th floor which had great views towards the TV tower and over the city. There is a hypermart opposite the hotel which was great for bringing bits of food back to the hotel (it also has a fantastic selection of beer!). Overall the Hotel was great and I will no doubt be returning to this hotel in the not too distant future.

Reviews.Title: “Ausgezeichnet!!!”
Reviews.Author: jrdixon4121
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Inn for 9 days and enjoyed it greatly. It is close to transportation, shopping, historical areas, and in the middle of "old Berlin". The room was superlative and exceeded only by the professional and courteous staff. I intend to return within the year and hope I can get the same room!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Any age, any time, anyone - I'd recommend”
Reviews.Author: johnno13
Reviews.Content: The building is a renovatd 1930's (ish) communist building - dont let this scare you! They've done a remarkable job of updating it. Upon arrival I was greeted by Inga, she explained everthing thouroughly and answered all of my questions. I asked if she could recommend areas to go for night life. She gave me a map and two great places to go and added 'if you come back tonight before 10.00pm I'll have more information for you'. which I did, she provided me with an A5 piece of paper. She'd noted down every day I was staying and then provided the best places to go on that day - wonderful! The room - immaculately clean, very efficient. I've noticed some travellers say the rooms are small, which to a certain extent is true however if you put your bags under the desk provided there is more than enough space for two people. Bathrooms - at first seem unconventional, but when you use the shower it all makes sense, everything is where you need it to be. The seperate toilet works well. I did use the shower on arrival and the water flooded into my room - I informed reception then i ventured out into the city. Within an hour I returned, the room had been cleaned, the floor dried and I was provided with complimentary slippers incase any moisture remained in the carpet. In my opinion, this was excellent. The shower didnt flood again, the previous occupant had dropped those plastic covers that come on razorblades in to the drainage - this was also sorted. Location - Berlin is a vast city - things do feel spread out. German public transport is incredible, which makes up for this. You can step out of this hotel and be straight on public transport to anywhere you want to be. Restaurant - I didnt eat here, why eat at a hotel when you've got a city within arms reach? Breakfast - I noticed one traveller said that they couldnt get breakfast added on. When I arrived I was told I could add breakfast at any point, even in the morning. I went to the reception one morning and I was offered breakfast, so it didnt seem like a problem (the selection always looked good too.) Final thoughts - I think this is a fantastic hotel, I will be staying here again without a doubt and Berlin is a wonderful city (take the free walkking tour). The cleaning staff are there every morning - for seperate people knocked on the door, but to be fair I didnt get up until midday. Simply put the 'do not disturb' sign on the door - you'll have no worries. As regards to the minibar - prices are just above average. They don't monitor whats in here electronically or anything like that and someone comes to fill it every day. I had a few drinks from here and I didn't feel ripped off - bearing in mind I was travelling on a budget. Ask for a room on a high floor - the views of Berlin are incredible. The lift to get you up and down is unbelievably fast - so you're never waiting round and you get to the top of the hotel in literally 20 seconds

Reviews.Title: “No worries hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: MiToZ_ZG
Reviews.Content: Before leaving for Berlin, me and my girlfriend spent quite some time searching through jungle of Berlin hotels, mostly using tripadvisor.com. As we were going to Berlin for the first time and as Schonefeld airport was our landing place, we decided to make matter simple and book one of hotels that have good connection with airport. Our choice was Park Inn. After seven nights in Park Inn, our impressions are as follows: - Location - basically, it's excellent. 20-25 minutes from Schonefeld airport by Airport Express (RE7 and RB 14) train that leaves every 30 minutes; almost all major (all that average tourist need) U-bahn and S-bahn lines goes through Alexanderplatz and their stations are from 50(U-Bahn) to 150(S-Bahn) meters from west hotel entrance; also, if you like to walk, even Unter den Linden and Brandenburg Tor are not that far away (20-30 minutes?); hotel is near the place where the original settlement of Berlin was found and although most of old buildings in area were destroyed during WW2, they were faithfully rebuilt later. - Service - we haven't had breakfast or any other meal in hotel, so I can't say anything about that, but rooms were kept very clean (daily service) and all of the staff that we have had contact with, spoke english pretty good. - Room - we had room on 11th floor and we were very pleased with it. After reading some of the reviews on tripadvisor, we were afraid that the room is going to be very small, but in reality it wasn't. I can't say that room is large, but there is more than enoguh place for two people to enjoy it. Furniture is modern and looks stylish, there is a mini bar (prices are ok) , flat screen tv and room safe (large enough for camera, SLR, flash and objectives). There is in-room Internet connection, and although I can't remember the price, i remember thinking that it was very expensive. As for location and look of the toilet and shower bath, that can be a problem if you travel with someone other than your spouse :) ... altough modern, toilet and shower bath are located at the corner of the room, and surrounded by glass so you can see other person showering (toilet is surrounded by some material that is not as transparent :)). Of course, there is a curtain that hides both shower bath and toilet from the rest of your room and prying eyes of your roommate :) ... and not to forget, our room type was "business class room". All in all, during our stay in Berlin, we never had a need to think about our room or safety of our staff in it. This hotel gets our recommendation :)

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: AirbusTronn
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a small single room. 236 euro for 4 nights, booked at Booking.com. The room had a view to the West. Not Alexanderplatz as i asked for, but that might be because that all the singels are not facing it. Room was small, but ok and fine. But there was no mini bar. And the TV-set was placed on the wall, but at the same side as the bed, so it was almost impossible to se TV from bed. Since I was leaving early I would have liked to use the minibar for placing some food items in it the last night. I asked the Reseption if it was possible to place a bag of food in a cold room or refigioator, since there was no minibar in my room, but it was not. The hotel is big. And this is at typical tourist hotel as far as I can say. A lot of groups of quite elderly tourists. I stayed at Motel One Alexanderplatz 1,5 years ago, and perfere that one. The rates for internet was very high.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: Glasgow_Member06
Reviews.Content: Very well located next Alexanderplatz station - 35 minutes with no changes from Schonefeld Airport. Friendly, helpful reception and concierge. The breakfasts are superb. Cheeses, cold meats, fruit, bread, rolls and hot food. Tea and good coffee. We stayed on the 27th floor with superb views. Ask if you can have a room that looks over Alexanderplatz and towards the television tower. The views are fabulous. Rooms small but clean. It was hot and air-conditioning was either off or simply a bad joke! There is secondary glazing so opening the windows isn't very effective. I can understand comments from other reviewers re bathroom and shower. They are both in the actual bedroom contained inside etched glass walls with a single glass door that pivots to close off one or the other. I was travelling wife my wife (of 30 years) so no problem but if you had just started a relationship then the sanitary arrangements could cause embarrassment! (Maybe you're uninhibited!) Air conditioning and toilet arrangements apart, no-one could find fault with the Park Inn. We would have no hesitation recommending it or returning - and we will do so.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and good service”
Reviews.Author: julle1001
Reviews.Content: Great assistance in lobby, good english skills and very helpful. We had the panorama room and this is great with lots of view. Breakfast buffet is excellent and woth the money. Only bad this is the roof top close to early - need to extend the hours of operation. Parking is limited even with the parking garage next door. We where very lucky to get the last available spot.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin and the Park Inn hotel”
Reviews.Author: GWUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Inn hotel Alexander Platz between March 27th and 30th and must say it was a very enjoyable stay,As we had an early morning flight & knew check in was 3pm,we went to drop our luggage off at the hotel & the receptionist was able to check us in at 10.30am. The hotel is large ,but manages to be well run,staff are friendly and helpful,clean in all public areas,Breakfast is the usual fayre of cereal,cooked meats,cheeses,bread,fresh fruit,boiled & scrambled eggs. The rooms are clean,modern,they have safes,ironing board,mini bar,but no kettle for making tea/coffee. The shower and toilet are just seperated from the room by frosted glass,(See photos). So as long as you don't mind seeing/hearing your room mate in the shower/ toilet then it is fine. Berlin is a great city and I would recommend using "INSIDER TOURS" for any walking tours of Berlin, and especially for the tour of the concentration camp at Sachenenhausen.Our English speaking guide Chris was very informative,funny,a great host for the day. You can find all details on Insider tours in the Things to do section. Would use hotel again,as it has good location for S Bahn,U Bahn and buses. Cab to/from Tegel airport 20 euros one way,or catch the TXL bus for 2.10 euros that runs every 8 mins from the Airport to Alexander Platz

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: savvydublin
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed at the Park Inn and both times I enjoyed the location and hotel very much. The rooms are compact and have a bit of strange set up with the shower located opening onto the centre of the room. The shower was separated from the toilet cubicle by a pane of frosted glass so if you're on a romantic break with a new love interest, this may not be for you. The location can't be beat for being central and close to many restaurants and bars. The hotel is directly on the SBahn line directly to Schonefeld airport and also on the UBahn line as well. Very handy. The room was very clean. The only exception was a pink stain on the carpet which looked like cleaning staff had attempted to remove without success. The housekeeping staff tidied daily and responded to the "do not disturb" sign. Internet is available in each room but at 18 euro for 24 hours or 6.50 an hour, it's pretty steep. If at all possible, try to get a room on the side facing the TV tower - the view from the other side of the hotel isn't as picturesque. Overall, the Park Inn delivers great service, a central location and good value for money. I look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice short break”
Reviews.Author: Hels_9
Reviews.Content: Smart, modern and clean rooms ideal for a short break. The breakfast is buffet style and very good with a fair choice. The hotel is in a good position for the main sights, right next to TV tower, within walking distance of the Red Town Hall and a short taxi ride to the Brandenburg Gate / Checkpoint Charlie. We struggled to find many bars in the local area, most are restaurants which serve traditional food. There are a few steak restaurants around and the usual MacDonalds and fast food outlets. Drinks in the hotel are very expensive (around £18 for 4 small beers) and the food everywhere is pretty pricey too. Be warned if you are a smoker, the whole hotel and the majority of bars etc are non smoking. In summary, a good base for a weekend sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: england12320
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely gorgeous! The views were amazing, we had room number 3504 which was on the 35th floor facing the tv tower and the rest of Berlin. The rooms were very spacious, modern and clean. The hotel is massive and mainly attracts business people. Staff are extremely helpful. The transport system was amazing, very easy to get from schonfeld airport to Alexanderplatz station which is right outside the hotel. I would highly recommend the Berlin welcome card as you can use any form of transport and you also get offers for various attractions (25% off) including bars and restaurants. I would also recommend visiting Spagos, the hotel's main restaurant on the ground floor-its lovely and has a really nice atmosphere! Overall an amazing experience at the Park Inn hotel and would definitely recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “very good location.”
Reviews.Author: elefterios
Reviews.Content: a very nice hotel in the centre of berlin nice location and great view from the 15th floor and up the room's bathroom could be much better beacuse the glass isnt so safe when you take a bath and need caution i recomment this hotel

Reviews.Title: “practical and easy”
Reviews.Author: JoonasH
Reviews.Content: Park Inn was more comfortable than I expected - room really small (single), but all necessary was there. Very comfortable bed and good shower. S-train to airport was 100m from hotel! Small gym with one treadmill and two other machines. Good value for about 50e. If you want more comfort, checkin to Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,great location”
Reviews.Author: baquinn
Reviews.Content: First of all,a great location - really central in terms of public transport.Stayed on the 26th floor - sadly not facing the TV tower.The room was just perfect for us,while it was a little small,it was clean and the bathroom issue that people have been talking about really isn't an issue,although this may depend on who you travel with.The free breakfast was enough to set us up for that day.Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Can;t Wait To Return”
Reviews.Author: PlateMan
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location. The Park Inn is a huge multi-storey hotel located in the smack center of Alexanderplatz. Both the U and S Bahn stations are directly outside,. Some places are a nice walk, but others are easily reached with the many transportation options./ Room was ultra-modern, with a small tv, pricey internet and like most hotels in Europe, no air con. Breakfast was amazing (included in most room rates.) Tons of hot, cold items and cooked to order. The best on my multi-stop trip. Front desk is efficient and they have a lot of people working. Nice fitness center with a sauna. One problem would be the conceriege, there is only one working at a time and with a huge hotel you may have to wait a bit. Also, their English was not the best and there were not overly helpful. To counteract the below review, never once did I see teens peeing in the square. There were some hanging out, but never once did they bother us. Also being in the square, means ton of food options. Place is trendy, happening and all around great. Across from the hotel is a huge store, that has a great buffet on the top floor, ate there most night. However, avoid Asia Snack in the train station, made me sick. I would not hesitate to return to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located”
Reviews.Author: Seanie_pc
Reviews.Content: Just back from Berlin having stayed in the Park Inn. To Start with the hotel is easily accessible from the airport, just jump on the S9 and get off at Alexanderplatz. Its 2 minutes walk and you cant miss it, its the tallest build apart from the television tower. The hotel is in fomer East Berlin and you can see that there is alot of work going on there to upgrade the area. Its turning into a very nice tourist part of town. With many shops etc about. The hotel is about 20 minutes walk to the Brandenburg gate and the Reichstag, so you can get a feel for the location. There is also any manner of public transportation at the door step, S-Bahn, U-Bahn, buses, taxies.. The hotel itself surprised me. The lobby area is very nice and open with a decent sized reception. Staff at checkin were very pleasant and efficient and had no problem when I asked to change room, it was done very quickly and in a very polite manner. So I can't fault the service one bit. In the lobby the is a very nice bar & restaurant and again staff were very nice. The rooms are of a decent size with the usual quality you would expect in a business class hotel, so again no complaints here. Folks, the location and accessibility of this hotel is first class, the staff are world class and the rooms are of a standard you would expect.. Is this hotel recommended.. ?? -definitely. Enjoy Berlin. Ps. apparently the best casino is on te 37th floor... I didnt make it up but I am assured that's its is a great night out.

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice rooms, weird beds”
Reviews.Author: totoharvey
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed here on 26th Feb for 2 nights. we were able to store our bags until check in at 3pm (although they said around 2pm would be fine). the hotel is in alexanderplatz square which has the best train and subway links in the city. The staff were friendly and we received 2 complimentary bar drinks - i highly recommend the alexander cocktail! The rooms (we had a business room) were nice and the shower was great. the layout is quite strange as the shower cubicle is in the room with a curtain to pull around the cubicle. may be a slight problem if you are not with your partner. the 'double' bed was very strange as it is essentially 2 single mattresses put together with 2 single quilts. overall a pleasant stay and a good view if you ask for a west facing room as high as possible!

Reviews.Title: “VVVV satisfied customer!”
Reviews.Author: ladybird1Dublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in Febraury and we were very pleased. Although it is a HUGE hotel, this doesnt affect the quality of service you receive. Reception staff were friendly and helpful, breakfast was yummy..keep you going til lunchtime. the location was excellent too, just beside the shops and the trains and trams. Rooms were clean and we had impressive view of the city from the 35th floor! We really enjoyed our stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, classy and quiet!”
Reviews.Author: SMJSeattle
Reviews.Content: This is a perfectly situated hotel in East Berlin's Alexanderplatz, a short S-bahn trip from the new Hauptbahnhof train station. From the plaza in front of the hotel it is very easy to get to all Berlin sights by foot, train, or bus! We took advantage of all three! It is only a short walk to the classic Berlin Dom (cathedral) and adjacent to the Fernsehen (television) tower, both of which are beautifully lit landmarks that can be seen from almost anywhere in the city. We were very impressed with the friendly service and the outstanding buffet breakfast with choices to please international guests. Rooms are immaculate with contemporary touches and nice lighting for atmosphere. The hotel has very efficient elevators--no standing and waiting. Room ratesare reasonable and overall, the Park Inn is "preiswert"--a good deal!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent view, but things could be improved...”
Reviews.Author: swetrotter
Reviews.Content: Stay at this hotel recently (beginning of February 2009). The location couldnt be better, with the TV -tower as neighbour and not far away to the other atractions. The Alexanderplatz U-Bahn(Metro/Tunnelbana/Underground) and S-Bahn(Commuter Train/Pendeltåg/Cercancías) stations(s) at the doorstep makes a visit here verry convenient. Recomend to buy a day card for th zones A,B or A,B,C which is valid until next day 3AM. Had a single room which was light and fresh, small but in some way spacious. A really negative thing was that the TV screen was placed right at the wall, and just slightly turned, which made it almost impossible to watch TV from the bed, but anyway, theres so much in the town to see... The bathroom were in verry special, design, not sure so smart, I understood the idea and concept, but after showering the water sometimes floods out(though small amounts, but anyway) on the carpetfloor, which makes me feel that the hotel might get some problems with damage by damp in the future. No minibar or safe in room is a minus. My room didnt face the TV twr, a pity really, but I could stand with it. The Breakfest buffet was really great, but not sure if worth the price? I mean, 18 Euros for a breakfest (they just increased the price from 17E), its probably the most expensive breakfest Ive had, and for that price they could be more serviceminded in the restaurant! The fitnessroom/gym is fatal, thyve just put a few machines in there (2for running, 1 cycle, 1 other), a verry booring and dull room, felt dirty and unfresh, how can they call something like that, on a 4star hotel, a fitness room/gym!???
