When leaving the hotel theres like usually a room to store youre luggage in, but if youre having an evening flight back home, and you might want to use the hotels toilet/bathroom (the hotel you just stayed at, yes) you have to pay!!! =( Its ridicilous to take charge of over 5cent to use the hotels toilets. Its a 4star hotel, a Park Inn hotel, It shouldnt be that way! You dont charge youre own guests! Most of the staff is really nice, but then there are those that are in need of service and manner education, and how to treat a guest, for example on of the guys (a young blonde man) at the Concierge desk. Overall its a good hotel, but, its ridicilous to charge 18E for breakfest, 5cent for toiletts(from the own guests). The room wasnt totally clean, with dust for example on the hotel booklet, which only had information in German, although it said it would be in english too!

Reviews.Title: “excellent experience, great christmas markets”
Reviews.Author: tipCork
Reviews.Content: we were there for the christmas markets in december 2007. the hotel is right on the square with the tube right outside the hotel. the christmas markets are just outside the hotel and is very close to all the other christmas markets. there is an ice ring in alexander platz plaza. it's not too far from the airport. a short taxi. i our trip was excellent and we will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant views”
Reviews.Author: chocolatemonkeybear
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel in conjunction with a deal on Expedia in 2006. A great hotel right in the centre of Alexanderplatz. Whilst there was some refurbishing going on in the lobby the staff did everything they could to make our stay enjoyable. The room was super although the frosted glass bathroom could be an issue if you aren't staying with someone very close!

Reviews.Title: “Overbooking - Swings and Roundabouts”
Reviews.Author: Lenski
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with four of my friends in November 2008 and had booked 3 months in advance. We travelled in two groups, with myself and my one friend arriving at around 8pm from Luton and the others arriving just before midnight from Gatwick. On arrival, my friend and I checked in. I told them that we were a party of 5 and that the others would be arriving later on. No problem we were told. However, the first room we were given was a double, not a twin. On returning to the reception we were told that they had no twin rooms free. After some polite but firm negotiation we were finally given a twin room. Happy, we went off to for a meal before our friends arrived. Our friends arrived at midnight, but on trying to check in were told that the hotel was full and they would have to move to another hotel, despite the fact that the rooms were booked 3 months in advance. I complained that we were a group and would not be split up. So instead they sent us all by free taxi to the 5-star superior Westin Grand hotel at no extra charge. We stayed there for one night (please see separate review), had free taxi rides there and back, free breakfasts at both hotels and were also given an upgrade on our return to the Park Inn. We were really disappointed with the initial problems at the hotel but the way it was dealt with was first rate. On arriving back the next morning at the Park Inn, the reception staff were already fully briefed about our situation and were extremely helpful, especially Ms P. Sanchez. The Park Inn itself is a great hotel and well situated in the city (close to the airport too). The rooms were nice (though a bit small) and the fears about the weird toilet arrangements were unfounded. Good breakfast, though I probably wouldn't pay 20 euros for it. NB. Ask for a West facing, upper floor room for a great view of the Fernsehturm. I would happily recommend this hotel, but they clearly overbook in the hope that not everyone shows up. If you are planning to arrive late I would bear this in mind when booking though maybe we were just unlucky, as that weekend the hotel was full of swimmers, in town for the World Cup meeting later that week. Berlin is a fine city by the way - so much to see and do and the beer is great too. Check out Hertha Berlin - a much more authentic football experience than in England. And cheaper too!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Bosporos
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Park-Inn Hotel for 5 days, the first 5 days of January. In general the hotel was not bad, but it was not also perfect. You can reach it very easy from Tegel Airport, with the bus TXL that stops in Alexanderplazz, but if you want to make check in early, that means around 12.00 (as it happens for other hotels) you will be disappointed because you can not make check in before 15.00. However you can let your luggage in the store room. When we went back to the hotel, around 16.30, they told us again that the room is not ready and that we should wait 1 more hour. Finally, after negotiations, the reception girl said that she did a mistake and that room was ready. Our room was in the 23rd floor of the hotel ( the hotel is huge with at least 30 floors and hundreds of rooms) facing the TV tower and the square. The view was very nice, but for us the basic problem was the heating. The central heating of the room didn't work; the room was not cold, but it was not hot either. But with outisde temperature under 0, you can understand that without central heating somebody starts to freeze. We communicated with the reception and they sent a technician to check it, who said that nothing can be done and that the central heating system wouldn't work. So we asked to change room; they put us in another room 10 floors down, which was again very cold and again the central system didn't work. So, we decided to return back to the first room, even if it's cold to have better view. Finally from the reception they arranged us an electric portable heater, that helped us a lot; but without it, it would be impossible to stay in the room. The room was cleaned every day; we were disappointed to find 2 single beds united instead of one double bed as we had asked, but most probably there were not double beds. Other than that, we didn't try the breakfast because 18 euro for breakfast seemed too much for Berlin which is a relatively cheap city. The best thing of this hotel for us it is his location; it is near the "alternative" centre of Berlin if you want to go for shopping in nice shops and designer clothes shops; also it is in Alexanderplatz from which all the trains depart and we really liked this.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: Debbie007
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a prominant position not far from the TV tower. When arriving from Tegel airport, is only cost 2.10 euros, was very easy to find and took about 30 minutes. If you can ask for a west facing high floored room to give you a wonderful view of Berlin. I was on the 13th floor and had lovely views each evening of the sun setting and also the Christmas markets close by. We did arrive early and couldn't check in until 2pm, but they were happy to store our bags for us. The room has a modern feel, with the bath and sink in the main room, with a curtain to cover when in use. We were disappointed with the twin beds pushed together and separate quilts, when we had asked for a double bed. However reception informed us all rooms were like this. The room also has a safe and mini bar. There was little room for storage, but as we were only staying a few days this was not a problem. The room was cleaned daily, however when they came to clean one morning and we were still in the room they never came back later and so we had no room service that day! In the area we found a handy supermarket for soft drinks and bread (NB they charged extra for the drinks, but you can recycle them at the supermarket and take the receipt to the tills and get your money back). There is also a lovely Italian style restaurant not far from the hotel just off to the left by the twin peaked church. Location wise, this hotel is not really central and you could stay closer into the city. However it was only a 2km walk to the Brandenburg Gate and the transport links where excellent. Overall a comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: value counts
Reviews.Content: Park Inn is well situated, close to many major attractions in Berlin and easy to get to from Tegel airport- the bus stops almost outside the hotel. It's also close to rail transport, a few minutes walk from a major shopping centre and good restaurants. Service at the hotel was efficient, the rooms were clean and comfortable. The bathroom is in the room( from one's bed you look through a glass screen into the bath/shower) but this was not a problem. The only (major) disruption in the only hours of the morning was from American guests screaming and fighting with one another in the corridor. Despite the size of the hotel it never felt crowded even though Burger King downstairs was often crammed full of people and the coffee shop at the entrance was mostly full. Escados restaurant is highly recommended for steaks- excellent value, good quality food and value for money prices, even though the service could be improved. At €17 for breakfast, Park Inn should be avoided. The Galleria shopping mall( a few minutes walk from the hotel) has the freshest bread, rolls, fresh fruit, fresh meats, juices and yogurts at a fraction of the cost. The more people avoid paying exorbitant prices for hotel breakfasts the quicker hotels will realise they're over-priced!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean and comfy”
Reviews.Author: Cfcabreu
Reviews.Content: We booked a standard room via ebookers.com but due to problems with the room we were given ( it was occupied by someone else by the time we got there!) we were upgraded to an executive room. The room had a reasonable size and it had a modern feel. The bed was very comfortable and big. The bathroom, that we already knew by advance that was strange, wasn't a problem as I was travelling with my girlfriend. The breakfast room was very busy, like the hotel itself, but there was a large variety of food and overall it's a good breakfast. Other positive thing is that we can buy a day travelling ticket for all public transports directly through the concierge. The location of the hotel is also very good, Alexanderplatz is one of the heart of Berlin and you can really feel the spirit of the Berliners there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: wjaWexford
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Park Inn at the end of November 08. It was a trip organised by Citiescapes which included a walking tour. The rooms were comfortable and clean. They had comfortable beds, safe, minibar/fridge, shower, WC, sink, wardrobe with trousers press (no iron), and plenty of towels. We didnt really mind the layout with the toilet and shower. There was a good selection for the hot & cold buffet breakfast including juice, cereals, cheese, cold meat, breads, soup, eggs, fried potatoes. You could get a buffet dinner for €19 per person which was quite good but the menu did not vary each night. The main bar, Spagos, was quite expensive. I can highly recommend Escados steak house just across from the hotel. There are plenty of restaurants and shops in the area. Our room on the 27th floor overlooked a construction site. If I was staying again I would prefer a view over Alexanderplazt. There are plenty of shops inlcluding several shopping centres, two, Galleria and C&A, were just outside the hotel on Alexanderplazt. Also, the Christmas markets had just started on Alexanderplazt right outside the hotel. One way of getting across town is by using the 100 and 200 buses. A one way ticket is just €2.10. The 200 goes via Unter den Linden, Friedrichstrase, Potsdamer Plazt to the Zoo. The 100 goes via Unter den Linden, Reichstag, Tiergarten, to the Zoo. Overall, a highly enjoyable stay in the Park Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Park Inn Berlin”
Reviews.Author: CorkAnnCork
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 4 night stay in the Park Inn Alexanderplatz and I have to say it was a most enjoyable experience.We flew into Schonefield airport and for E2.80 we were outside the back door of our hotel in 20 mins.The staff were lovely.Breakfast was excellent with plenty choice.Busy early in the morning but with the big restaurant there was plenty seating.The only down side of the hotel is that the bar was rather expensive.Rooms were cleaned and made up daily and service was very good. The area of Alexanderplatz is very nice with Galleria Kaufhof and C & A next door but Ladies if its a serious shopping trip you are on I would advise you stay in the area of Kurfurstendamn.This is where its all happening. Berlin does have a fantastic transport system however and it is very easy to get anywhere in a short space of time.Anyone that is arriving to Berlin on a Sunday the shops are closed so you can do your city tour then which is good value and you can hop on and hop off when you like.Eating out is cheap in Berlin with a vast variety of places to eat. At this time of year the Christmas markets are in full swing and it is magical. Berlin is a city worth a visit and so is the Park Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: blok_70
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Park In for five days and it was our first time in Berlin. I highly recommend this place if this is your first visit to Berlin: the hotel is perfectly located (close to the public transportation); it is clean, safe and the staff speak English (check-in was efficient). It is just a walk away from Hackescher Markt (with lots of bars and restaurants) which is very convenient for late night dinner. Our room was comfortable (despite the strange-looking shower explained by the previous posters) and cleaned daily. Perhaps we would try a different place for our second exploration of Berlin, but we were very satisfied at the end.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: uktravelller
Reviews.Content: Hotel was just across from the train station, we arrived early and was able to check in. The room was clean and modern, as other reviews mentioned about the see through shower and frosted toilet, it was a bit strange, but was not a problem, there was a curtain that you could pull round if you get a bit shy. We both found the beds a little soft for our liking, but still had a good nights sleep. The breakfast had a good choice of food which was nice. Didn't try any of the other places to eat, as there are so many other places around the hotel. The bar was about average on price, it had a relaxing atmosphere about it. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, in a good Location”
Reviews.Author: Allyone
Reviews.Content: On my first visit to Germany, earlier in the year ( May-2008 ) I stayed two nights in this Hotel. I understand it was originally an East German Hotel, but completely renovated. The room I was in was simply just about big enough for a single bed, with a toilet and separate shower, as reported on other reviews, both had frosted glass doors, so OK on your own no problem, but in a larger room, if you were "shy" could have been embarrassing...!! This was a room to sleep in no more, so not a big issue. It is in the heart of Alexanderplatz, with the U-Bahn and S-Bahn right on the doorstep, with a good selection of Restaurants and Bars within walking distance, indeed the walk up the Unter Den Linden, to the Brandenburg Gate passing some Historic sites on the way was no more than 30mins. The Bar in the Hotel was very pleasant, with a Piano playing, great to relax in, Breakfast was very good, if not a wee bit pricey ( 17 euros ) but filled you up for the day, very "European" rather than British/American, but hey it is Europe..!! I would go back to this Hotel, but if my wife was with me, I would certainly insist on a much larger room

Reviews.Title: “seethrough shower!”
Reviews.Author: donnaHampshire
Reviews.Content: We had a very clean room on the 10th floor with a view of a large building site. The shower was lovely (rainforest head) but I didn't like the transparent toilet and shower cubicle. Staff friendly and helpful. Always a queue of available taxis at the front door 24/7. Surrounded by restaurants and fast food eateries if you don't fancy going far. Near to the S and U Bahn but we walked to all the tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a good location.”
Reviews.Author: knsv
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in old East-Berlin with public transport just around the corner. Loved the hotel with friendly and smiling staff, good breakfast with a large selection of food. We got a nice, clean room on 21st floor with a great view to the TV tower. I was aware of the situation with the bathroom in the bedroom, so that was no surprice to us. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good base”
Reviews.Author: MandMM
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. The hotel is very clean and the staff are good. It was a great base with the Underground station outside. yYu feel that it's certainly in the East Berlin side, with very functional buildings around this stark and huge plaza. Little cafes, for breakfast and the Galleria shopping centre are outside hotel. The breakfast is expensive in the hotel, and the cafes are fine for a croissant or a roll and coffee. The beds are most comfortable, and the bathroom fine, if you're staying with your partner! The Kilkenny Irish pub is close by in the Hackescher Markt station. Look out for the following restaurants:Mutter Hoppe on Rathaustrasse 21, and Brauhaus Lemke in Hackescher Markt. For a snack, buy a bratwurst for a euro on Alexanderplatz!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: alwaystraveling72
Reviews.Content: I did not have much of a choice of hotels for my one night stay in Berlin. There was some kind of protest taking place in town and everything was booked. A few days before I left for my trip, this room popped up online and I grabbed it. The room with 2 beds we recieved was small but managable. The one thing I hate about traveling in Europe is the small beds they give you. The room we were giving had a seperate bathroom with a toilet and a sink. The shower however was in the bedroom and was seperated from the beds and tv only by a curtain. Yes, I did feel that I had privacy while showering, but if anyone wants to leave the room or use the toilet at the same time, it would have intruded on privacy. The shower and toilet area were decorated with marble and the fixture were nice as well, except for the showerhead that would not stay up and continued to fall without holding it up. (yes I tryied to tighten the knob.) The hotel is in the eastern part of town. Alexanderplatz in convienently near the metro, just steps from the hotel entrance. There is also a city bus tour that allows you to get on and off all around the city, that stops right outside the hotel. The negative about the area is that is is probably the ugliest plaza in the city. If I were to go back to Berlin I would find a hotel in a more "happening" area of town.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: badly1004
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in Berlin and when I booked I wanted something ultra-easy to get to from the airport. This couldn't have been easier. 22 minutes on the Airport Express and the hotel is straight across from Alexanderplatz S-Bahn station. We got checked in immediately and we were hitting the town within minutes. We didn't book breakfast but it was easy to stock up in the large department store opposite the hotel. The room itself is pretty small but more than adequate. Plenty of space to put your clothes away. Bit of a strange setup with the bath and shower being in the middle of the room but not a big problem. We ventured up on the roof to see the sunset one evening. It's a gorgeous view but I don't know if I'd pay the 3 euros again - added to the 4 euros per beer I though it was a bit of a rip-off, especially when the terrace itself didn't look anywhere near as nice as the photos which advertised it...and it was baltic up there!!! All in all we had a great experience with this hotel and the location was second to none with the whole of Berlin a few steps away from the door due to the excellent transport they have in city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: Eur0pe08
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. Its in a great location close to all of the sites and next to both the tram and rail station. The Room is large, modern and always immaculate. The hotel offers a large buffet breakfast with great variety. The reception staff are very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: taoben
Reviews.Content: The location is great. The 1st room they assigned me was a suite that had faux backlit panels instead of windows. I changed into a tiny room but at least it had a window. There were no drawers and the only shelf was filled with minibar stuff so I had to put those on the floor so I could put my clothes somewhere. In the bathroom there is no place to hang your used towel which makes the “Please decide for yourself” notice fatuous. Hanger space is very small. 5 hangers and your clothes are pressed against each other. Of course there is a minibar and the checker came in about 4 times in one morning. No kettle, no couch, no luggage rack. I had to stuff the suitcase under the writing desk. Luckily it just fit. The room aircon was a strange metal plate hanging off the ceiling which was cool to the touch but did nothing for the room. Service is where the hotel shines. For a very busy hotel the reception staff is efficient and friendly. When I asked for an iron and 2 pillows I had barely put down the phone when they arrived. Internet speed was lightning fast. So don’t expect to put up your feet and relax in your room. But you will not be waiting around for service when you request it. The breakfast is in total contrast to the room, ie very ample, with a huge tea selection and good egg chef.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: prikubo
Reviews.Content: I strongly recommend Park Inn. The hotel is huge and extremely well located, in the heart of Alexanderplatz and a few minutes away from the TV tower. The metro is only a few meters away and there`s a huge mall right in front of it. Rooms are very clean, but small. There`s a table and two chairs. Also a small cabinet to put clothes. Bathroom is a bit different and some people might feel uncomfortable with it. Let me explain. The shower is "open"(check the photos) and the sanitary is tiny small. You can easily see someone sitting in the toillet. There`s a curtain that separates the room from the shower. Don`t book breakfast, it`s was too expensive. Eat in the street instead. There are several options very close (Dunkin Donuts and some other local places).

Reviews.Title: “Good for business”
Reviews.Author: mikkifr
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellently situated in Alexanderplatz, which made it convenient to get too and was so tall that it was very easy to find (and find your way back to). The Panorama Terrace on the 39th Floor (3 Euros entry and open to non-residents) is a must for great views over Berlin. The room itself was your average high-class business hotel, although internet access was very expensive. Staff were friendly and helpful. One complaint we did have was with the cleaning staff, who even though we hung out the 'Do Not Disturb' sign (we'd been out clubbing), still rang the room to ask if we wanted it cleaned! On Monday, the day we checked out, they tried to get in a 8 a.m. to clean as we'd forgotten to hang out the sign!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for business and vacationing travelers”
Reviews.Author: kodiaktraveler
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a business trip to Berlin. I have stayed at other hotels in the city including the Radisson SAS and have to rank the The Park Inn right up there among the best in the city. I like the simple setup of the room with every amenity I needed. From the high-speed internet connection at my desk to the stocked mini bar and LCD tv; the room was very nice. The convenience of the hotel was another big factor. It was extremely easy to get to from the Berlin Tegel airport. I jumped on the TXL bus outside of the main terminal and the bus stops right next to the hotel at Alexanderplatz. I chose the bus because I had some extra time and it offered me more views of the city instead of a direct taxi ride. The bus ride only costs 5 euro roundtrip. I highly recommend taking the bus to get downtown from the airport. Being in Alexanderplatz, there were no shortages of restaurants to choose from. Berlin is a great walking city, but has so many public transportation options and several depart right next to the Park Inn. I will stay at the Park Inn again when I visit Berlin. I did not have to pay as much as I did to stay at other hotels in Berlin without sacrificing any of the luxury or convenience. My only complaint about the hotel is that the lobby tends to get filled quickly with bus loads of travelers so sometimes it makes it difficult navigating yourself to the room elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Rich_25
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great base to explore on foot all of the main sights Berlin has to offer. Great views over the City, well laid out, tidy and smart/modern bedrooms with all the amenities you would expect. Bathrooms could be a concern for some as only have glass doors so you can see out whilist showering or using the toliet! I had a great time here however and would recommend for couples and lone business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Eldritch05
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were most impressed by the Park Inn Alexanderplatz. The location is superb, right on the square and a stones throw from every type of public transport imaginable. Getting to the hotel from Shoenefeld Airport couldn't have been simpler (arriving at night, we could see the hotel through the windows of the train even from the stop prior to Alexanderplatz Station). We had requested an upper west facing room, and that is exactly what we were provided with. The lift at the hotel took no time at all to shoot us up to the 26th floor, and the view upon opening the curtains was fantastic, as we gazed upon the Fernsehturm and down towards the Reichstag in the distance. We were very pleased with the room itself. Admittedly, it was quite small, but the ergonomics of the room mean that you don't feel cramped. The bathroom facility layout is a little out of the ordinary, in that there is no bath 'room' as such, simply glass partitions between the toilet, shower and sink. I wouldn't fancy sharing a room with the boss or someone I was not intimately acquainted with, as the partitions leave very little to the imagination. Still, the duvets on the comfortable bed were fantastic, and there was a nice flat screen tv and minibar in the room, and plenty of storage space. Although there is not a massive amount of nightlife on Alex Square itself (possibly due to its rather irregular communist era layout), the hotel is a ten minute walk from the lively bar and restaurant area of Hackescher Markt and a short U-Bahn ride away from the up and coming Prenzlauer Berg district. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel; there is a very nice Bistro next door to the hotel on the square that offers reasonably priced breakfasts. We took breakfast on one ocassion in the revolving restaurant at the top of the Fernsehturm. The food was standard fare, although I would certainly recommend it for the commanding views over the city, although get there prior to 9am, before the queues become prohibitively long. All in all, Berlin is a great city, and the Park Inn Alexanderplatz provided us with an excellent base from which to enjoy our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic deal, central, modern hotel!”
Reviews.Author: svalbard_view
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through hotel reservation service (hrs.de) and got a very good deal. The hotel is an old building but has been renovated so that the rooms are very modern and smart. There are good views across the city, and it is a very good location. I preferred being based at the centre of Alexanderplatz because it is so close to the older areas of Berlin. Easy walking distance to the Unter den Linden area with it's museums, cathedral and of course the Brandenburg gate and Reichstag. It is also not far to Hackescher Markt and the Tiergarten. From the Berlin hauptbahnhof either take the city S-bahn trains to alexanderplatz, or walk along the river to Alexanderplatz. The hotel was very neat and clean, relatively busy and the rooms were well looked after. There wasn't too much noise from the city, and the room was spacious and smart. Definitely recommended for people who prefer to stay in larger hotels or chains and want a predictable base for their visit to Germany's capital.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: lv2travelScottsdale
Reviews.Content: The hotel is extremely close to all parts of the city because of its proximity to the S and U-Bahn station a few minutes away. It is a twenty minute walk to Brandenburg gate. The area around it is bustling during the day as Alexanderplatz is a large square and the hotel is right across from a huge department store. The room was small (typical European fashion) but everything seemed new and updated inside. You have to pay for Internet access as we found common in many places we stayed in Germany. Personally I thought the area of Berlin that was west Berlin was prettier than east Berlin (where the Park Inn is located), so if I was returning to Berlin I’d stay there, but overall we liked this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Park Inn "Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: OUFC-fan
Reviews.Content: I strongly recommend you to go somewhere else if you can. It was the first time in my entire life that I went to a hotel that didn't have a proper bathroom. There is no proper wall between the shower and toilet and the rest of the room. From the aesthetic point of view it's awful. These are my wife's comments. I pretty much agree with them, though personally I think that the lack of auditory privacy is more of a problem. I also found the beds (two single beds together) far too soft, though that's obviously a personal preference. Worse, in my mind, is the fact that a clear space between the two mattresses therefore opens up, because of their softness. We've become accustomed to the two single mattress situation in hotels in Germany and the Czech Republic but this is the first time we've experienced a problem. We booked a "business class" room, and the hotel management have assured us (twice) that this is the room that in fact we've got. The only difference appears to be that we have "marble" floors in the shower and a "rain" shower. But the room couldn't be any smaller and our view is over the building site, rather than over the more picturesque view that (fortunately for us) appears on the photograph facing the bed. Business-class rooms are supposed to have tea and coffee; we had to request that service, but there's almost no room to put the hot water heater. The hotel does indeed provide internet service (which is what I'm using right now), but you should know that (unlike in the other hotels in which we've stayed during this trip) to use it costs 6.5 euros per hour or 18 for 24 hours. To be fair, the room itself (though very small) is clean and functional (if you don't care about privacy). But our bet is that you can do much better in Berlin than stay here.

Reviews.Title: “don't stay there!”
Reviews.Author: makakochan
Reviews.Content: I encountered two big problems: a. more than one week has passed since check-out and 417 euros are still blocked on my card. The necessary payment has been made but this amount (which is more than what has already been charged) is still blocked. I called the hotel 5 times already, they say it will be solved, but nothing changes. They never say anywhere that some amount will be blocked on your card for weeks after the check-out. b. toilets are awful! they are transparent! if you are staying as a couple, you will have no privacy - you need to know that you will see each other in the toilet and while taking shower.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Annablondie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a friend's hen weekend, and was very impressed. It is easy to get to the hotel from the airport, and is in an ideal location for shops, bars etc. The rooms were fairly small (without being cramped) but had everything you need. The bathroom was cleverly designed with glass walls to make the room look more spacious - but there is a curtain to draw around the glass!! The buffet breakfast was the biggest I have ever seen, and all the food was of exceptional quality. The only thing I could find fault with was the shower, which kept going hot and cold. Other than that, the Park Inn is a fantastic hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: stromkr
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent, right on Alexanderplatz. You can walk everywhere, or hop on the U- and S-bahn and get all over the city. The view from the rooms are good (so you can skip the overpriced TV-tower). The bathroom setup was out of the ordinary. There is a curtain and glass walls separating the shower from the rest of the room - and the toilet is behind frosted glass. You have to know each other quite well to feel totally comfortable. If you're traveling with your partner, it's no problem! The staff was friendly. An internet connection was pretty expensive (6 EUR for 1 hour, 18 EUR for 24 hours), but there is a restaurant with free Internet on the ground floor. Overall, the room looked good, the bed was nice and everything was clean. We got good value for money (we booked in advance).

Reviews.Title: “Took a chance with the location and we're so happy we did!”
Reviews.Author: TNLaddy
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed for a week at the end of May 2007. I was attending a conference at the International Congress Center on the west side of town and originally wanted to stay closer to the conference site, but a little online research and some comments from relatives who live in Germany and visit Berlin frequently, convinced me that the east side of town is a little more up-and-coming. We found that to be true, and we couldn't have been happier with our decision to stay at the Park Inn. It's location is fantastic. The Alexanderplatz station makes it convenient to get anywhere in town via subway or train. Just a short walk north of the hotel puts you in an area full of cute, modern restaurants and bars. Head west one stop on the S line to Hackescher Markt, and the plaza is full of restaurants with outdoor seating. From this location you can find a nice compromise between accessing touristy stuff and wandering into quaint, off the beaten track restaurants and bars. The hotel itself was fine. The room was a bit small, by American standards, but well appointed for Europe. It was clean, and the beds were comfortable. The bathroom would definitely be an issue if you are sharing the room with someone and want more privacy, but if it's you alone or you are with a loved one, it's fine. Our air conditioning didn't work particularly well, but the weather was nice enough that we could open the windows. The view from the top of the hotel is nice, although you have to pay a small fee to access it. In the end, we were extremely pleased with our stay at the Park Inn and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, lovely rooms, great value”
Reviews.Author: isaksen
Reviews.Content: Park-Inn Alexanderplatz has recently been renovated, and they have done a marvellous job. The rooms are small, more like cabins, but elegant and practical. My room had a view to the Alexanderplatz itself, with the old tv-tower from DDR. This TV-tower is a landmark, and it's so tall that you are able to make it back to the hotel from any part of Berlin. And the location is excellent - walking distance to Hackesche Markt with all the bars and shops, not to far to walk to Brandenburger Tor etc, and only a short taxi ride to Prenzlauer Berg and Kreuzberg. It wasn't very expensive either, so I will definitely stay here next time I go to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: PawelL
Reviews.Content: Park Inn Berlin Alexanderplatz is a very good choice for Berlin. It is superbly located, at the Alexanderplatz, opposite to a huge shopping mall and surrounded by shops. The TXL bus from Tegel Airport stops a few meters from the hotel and both U and S-Bahn stations are very close. Rooms (I had a business friendly room) are spacious and have a very interesting design, with plenty of glass. Unfortunately, the windows are not completely soundproof. Try breakfast buffet at Spagos restaurant – it is quiet and have a very wide choice of products. Avoid the main restaurant as it is full of tourists. Next time in Berlin I will definitely choose Park Inn Berlin Alexanderplatz.

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel”
Reviews.Author: CornwallBracken
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. Yes, it's big but the staff were very helpful and friendly. The location was fab with U and S bahn and bus stations on your doorstep. Alexanderplatz itself doesn't have much to offer, but you're within close walking distance of some lovely areas for bars and restaurants. My room was on the 26th floor and looked out onto the telecom mast - a brilliant view! It was a fair size, nicely furnished and decorated, and very clean. Having read the reviews about the shower situation I was a bit concerned, but in fact the frosted glass was perfectly adequate at providing cover: though perhaps not for the very shy. No bath which is always a minus. The breakfast was very good - a really wide choice of hot and cold dishes, though it was a bit busy at peak times. It's the best hotel I've stayed in in Berlin, and the deal I got was reasonable - shop around for a discount site.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: MICHAELIRELAN
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for five nights in April and found it an excellent modern well run hotel. Location was excellent with friendly and helpful front of house staff. Our room which was cleaned daily was comfortable, although the view was onto a rather large building site although this should be gone in a few months. Bathroom privacy could be a problem with some people as only a curtain and some slightly opaque glass seperated the bed and washing areas from the toilet. Breakfast was not included in the room price and was on the expensive side however the food-hall in the Kaufhof Department store just across the street served an excellent cheap breakfast. All in all the hotel was very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything”
Reviews.Author: NorTraveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel Park Inn Berlin-Alexanderplatz is a perfect place if you want to see Berlin,close to everything and public transport is just around the corner. Romms is not to large but nice and clean and very good beds. Breakfast is also good for a fresh start.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!!!”
Reviews.Author: zo0sha
Reviews.Content: At first I was happy with my stay until a the last night before my departure from Berlin when I could not withdraw any money from my account! It turns out that the hotel <<blocks>> the amount of money of your stay PLUS a 100 euros for the mini bar in your account WITHOUT telling you!! The problem is that I specifically asked when checking in if any money will be deducted from my card and they said NO. So You can imagine when I was shocked that 750 dollars had disappeared from my checking account during my stay there. The hotel not only didn't realize the severity of the problem that this may create for some travelers, especially if one is traveling alone... but they also proceeded to NOT compensate me for even one nights stay or offer to make my stay more pleasant. Not only these things happened to me during my stay but my friends bathroom flooded his room and the hotel was not so keen on the idea of him changing rooms even though his entire carpet floor was soaking wet! In all , you pay for the location, so don't expect anything special at this hotel.... just a cheap room with a good view. Overall, unpleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “I was surprised to find I loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Writerwriter
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a real surprise to me. On first sight, I thought, "Oh, no!" It looked like one of those Communist mega hotels, and indeed it is in Alexanderplatz which Honecker intended as a DDR showpiece of Stalinist architecture. I only agreed to stay because it was almost the only place with room over the bank holiday. (Once again, I thought "Oh, no!" what's the problem with it?) But - I was so surprised. I really liked it and would return again. Our room was on the 11th floor, a reasonable size, modern and well fitted in dark brown and chrome. It was very clean and the beds were very comforatble. Towels were nice and toiletries smelt good although they weren't well known brands. We paid 18 Euros for 2 to have breakfast but others seem to have paid 18 Euros each? Maybe we got a bargain or they paid too much ?? But anyway check the price and I can assure you it was really excellent, with a huge choice of items. It included 3 types of scrambled egg, Nuremberger sausages, yogurt meusli, little pastry cases to put jam in, lots of different types of bread and rolls, cakes, salads, cheese, fruit - including passion fruit and other exotics, lots of different types of tea, and more. We made a point of eating a large breakfast so we didn't have to have much lunch. By the way, there are 2 breakfast places. One is a sort of ocean liner type dining room, which is quite grand, the other is in the bar downstairs which we preferred because it was bright and (when the sun shone) sunny and in our view had more interesting food. I don't think they give you a choice of breakfast room after your room is allocated - so check this at the time of booking. The hotel was very well soundproofed and quiet, despite being so large. There is a concierge, which was a plus. The reading lights were good, with an extra LCD light on a stalk attached to each one so you didn't have to keep your partner awake while reading. There is a safe and mini bar, etc. Theres also a wellness centre with massages which I didn't use so can't comment on. One reviewer commented on the disconcerting frosted glass in the shower and toilet. This is true but you can pull a curtain around to conceal the blurred sight of your room-mate showering or sitting on the toilet. There is a separate shower and toilet, which to me was a plus. No bath, though. Alexanderplatz is not beautiful but it is quite a lively square and right across from the hotel is a huge and good 6 storey department store which also has a food hall. The U2 underground line is steps away, and you're in walking distance of Hackischer Markt - a fascinating older area of Berlin with loads of good restaurants. You can also walk to many places of interest, although be warned, places in Berlin seem to be very spread out and there's always lots of walking. One evening we had a buffet supper in the hotel, that was 19 euros each and once again a huge variety, it's not that exciting to eat in the hotel when Berlin has so many unusual restaurants but it suited us well since we were tired and didn't want to go out. I read from a guidebook that the hotel had some rooms which were not renovated,but this may have changed by now. That is probably something else to check in advance. We felt it was good value for money. As it is a very large hotel you do run the risk of having to wait at busy times to check in and check out. I didn't find the staff either good or bad, they were just people doing their job and quite polite about it.

Reviews.Title: “First Rate All Around”
Reviews.Author: LADWhitePlains
Reviews.Content: From check in to check-out we had no problems at our stay at the Park Inn. Even though we arrived early and jet-lagged, we were given our room immediately. The hotel is modern, but the rooms are quite small and the single-use bathroom door (shower or toilet but not both) have been well documented by other reviewers. Since the Park Inn is the tallest building in Berlin the views are spectacular especially from the higher floors. My wife found the noise level from the construction in the front of the hotel (facing east) to be annoying, but the hotel allowed us to switch our room without hesitation or additional cost to a slightly larger room on the western side. The breakfast buffet, which was included, in our room rate, was typical. Boiled eggs, scrambled eggs, cereal, sliced meats, rolls,yogurt etc. Grab the cake as soon as you get in on busy days or you might not get a piece. Convenience is terrific. The S and U train are right outside and the Galleria department store is adjacent. The TXL bus from Tegel airport stops a half-block away and costs only 2.1 Euros! The room was equipped with a flat screen TV but all but two channels are in German. Only English-language stations were Sky News and CNBC but who comes to Berlin to watch TV? Check out was painless. We settled our bill the night before and simply left the key in the room. There is a small gym available for hotel guests and many of the rooms have Wifi internet connection but you must ask in advance I would guess. We did not use this feature. The only downside is that large groups seem to use the hotel which can make the lobby crowded,and elevator-wait times a bit longer than normal.

Reviews.Title: “excellant hotel”
Reviews.Author: ASTRA5
Reviews.Content: Just back from the park inn. beautiful hotel, central location ,very clean. we booked with otel.com our breakfast was included , this was self service restaurant on the second floor lots to eat fruit cereals , breads, meat, eggs and lots more. The toilet and shower situation is not good, you would want to be there with someone you knew well. rooms were cleaned every day .bed was very comfortable. no noise from outside as we were on the 27 floor. the area outside the hotel is lovely lots of stalls with food and beer There was live music playing there on the saturday afternoon. lots of people sitting around enjoying a beer and the sunshine. there is a lovely restaurant accross the road called Escados we went there twice. Overall berlin is wonderful and so is the park inn.Thanks to all those who recommended it on this site

Reviews.Title: “squirmed at the park !”
Reviews.Author: judychamer
Reviews.Content: the park is a well positioned hotel and is clean and the staff are friendly and helpfull but 3 things made me mark it low 1 the bar prices were very high and service very slow not a massive complaint on its own but then breakfast at 18 euros terrible we went down half hour b4 close everything clock cold ask for beans as tray was empty never got them bacon was unedible toaster didnt toast! 54 euros down the pan ! complained and told it was cos we where late coming down! but they still charge 18 e biggist complaint shared room whith my 82 y old dad and the toilet area is a disgrace the glass panel is virtualy see through in a very small room some things are priate! see the web photosb and you can see the loo ok if youracouple if not embarasing im no prude im a builder 4 gods sake! but i must say second time in berlin and its afantastic place to visit loads to see and visit

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kiwidrifter
Reviews.Content: The Park Inn is a high rise hotel right beside Alexanderplatz in the heart of Berlin. The location is excellent for a visit to Berlin. The standard rooms are very small but fine for 2 people. Our room was very clean, very nicely furnished and up to date. Our room was on the 19th floor overlooking Alexanderplatz so we had a great view. The Alexanderplatz station (train and metro)is only a minutes walk from the hotel so you can go anywhere in the city very quickly. The restaurant at the hotel is nice but we found it expensive so we only had breakfast there once and ate out the rest of the time. There are plenty of cafes and restaurants within walking distance to choose from. The staff were friendly enough but very busy so it was hard to talk to them and when you did they were in a bit of a hurry. Overall I would say this hotel is good for a short break to visit the city whether on buisness or pleasure but I wouldn't recommend it for a relaxing luxury holiday

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: RAYNELLE
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Inn a couple of weeks ago and the hotel was close to train station and buses with easy access to everywhere. We were on the 19th floor which had been completely refurbished (quite recently it appeared) and the room was adequate and very comfortable. The only drawback was one assistant on the concierge desk and as it is a very busy hotel one had to wait some while for attention. The staff are however very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: britney2630
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and we had a great view as we were on the 21st floor. The bathroom is somewhat unique and as mentioned in previous reviews; it does lack privacy. I used the shower on the first night and due to a blockage in the drain it actually flooded quite a large area of our room. The cleaners were great and came up within 5mins to deal with it. However due to the carpet getting rather damp it did smell, but again the staff were great and when we returned to our room it smelt fresh and clean. On our departure we informed reception of the incident and they knocked 20% off for the first nights stay. I would stay here again as the location is great and the room is a good size for a European hotel. My only negative comment would be that the hotel has a roof terrace which is a big selling point when booking the hotel, but they actually charge hotel guests to use the terrace :(

Reviews.Title: “Brill Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeelyeater
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 3 night stay at The Park Inn and can honestly say this was one of the best Hotels we have stayed in having done similar breaks all over Europe.Cleanliness,helpful staff,position of hotel all in all added to one of the best city breaks we have had.Oh, Berlin itself was first class as well!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views”
Reviews.Author: CJ_Dub
Reviews.Content: A superb hotel. The rooms are very modern and very stylish. Perfect for a romantic getaway although the shower/toilet arrangements may not suit all. The service was great with the staff were always looking to help. The location to Alexanderplatz train station,tourist sites and shopping centres could not be better. Everything is at your finger tips. If you can get a room facing the tv tower then you have the perfect view from a wonderful room.

Reviews.Title: “Spoiled by The Adina”
Reviews.Author: pghpeople
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in Feb. Second time to Berlin and couldn't decide which hotel so we split the trip. Loved the location! The hotel was nice enough. Asked in advance for a room with a view--not. Low floor and a construction view. Paid for a business class room and was given what I believe was a regular room and was told that to have a room with more windows would be 20 more a night. The amenities for my type of room were also non existent. Their website does not list 2 types of business rooms. Also asked to use a computer to check our flight and was told it would be 8 e. The Adina really spoiled us--very friendly staff. The Park Inn let us check in early, but acted like they were doing us a Huge favor. We would have been happy to store our luggage if we could have got the room we paid for. Also very sneaky during check in asked if we wanted breakfast which they would have added to our rate--yet didn't say that it would be extra till we asked about it. The Park Inn is lucky it is in such a great convienent area otherwise I think it would be lower on tripadvisor .

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Paulgavin
Reviews.Content: Six of us (3 couples) stayed in this hotel for two nights from Feb 26th-28th. The tallest hotel in Berlin is located right on Alexandra Platz and is situated directly across from the train station which makes it that bit easier to find your bearings. We had absoloutely no problems with check-in. We actually checked in 3 hours before check-in time and we all got our rooms straight away. We all stayed on the 14th floor which provided us with a beautiful view of the city. The rooms themselves are extremely clean and are a comfortable size for two guests. The shower is definately a little more intimate than other hotels I've stayed in (from top to bottom its all made of glass). I'd definately recommend this hotel for a nice break away in this beautiful historically drenched city!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a superb location”
Reviews.Author: Juicylady
Reviews.Content: stayed here with my husband on a last minute deal for a couple of nights - paid only £118 through hotelsclick for 2 nights B&B. Hotel is in a great location for transport links throughout the city - it is a 2 minute walk from alexanderplatz train station from where you can get trains to just about anywere you want to go!!! Room we had was on the 27th floor and we had a super view of the tv tower and the alexanderplatz - one point to note the room was stifling hot even with the window open and no matter how hard we tried we found no means of cooling the room down using the air conditioning!!! another point to note is that some of the walls are quite thin in the hotel - we were lucky we had really quiet neighbours but we did hear people comment that they were kept awake by a rather vocal lady being pleasured by her companion for most of the night if you get my drift - not exactly what I want to hear while on a short break!!! the bathroom we didnt find too much of a problem - but then we are married i guess!!! ours offered quite a bit of privacy with frosted glass right to the roof of both cubicles so not too sure what the other rooms are like - - only comment i have to make is why do other hotel guests insist on slamming their room doors at all hours of the day and night - the doors of most hotel rooms are on self closing hinges so you dont need to slam them after you - show some respect for others who may have arrived on early fligths or leaving on early flights please!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Breakfast was great with a huge selection of cereals, cold meats, fruit, breads, cooked items - you certainly will not go hungry - it kept us filled up for a good part of the day so if you can do try to get a deal with breakfast included - if not there are burger king, mcdonalds, dunkin donuts, subway and various others within 5 minutes walk so you wont starve!!! Good little restaurant and bar just as you leave the back entrance to the hotel onto alexanderplatz - it is a little pricey for drinks though - we paid almost 5 euro for a large beer and discovered that an equally quaint little bar in the train station ( i know it sounds crap but trust me all the locals drink there!!!) served the same beer for only £ euro - have a guess where we spent some time???? anyway for me it was a nice city but i wouldnt go back again - i just dont enjoy trawling museums all day and thats anout all there is to do - i would highly reccommend the hotel for its location and the breakfast - we didn't have to wait to check in as described by many others on here - we had our room at 10.30 am so maybe we just got lucky!!!! anyway if you get a good deal then go and enjoy the beer - its fab!!

Reviews.Title: “Berlin from a height”
Reviews.Author: speigili
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel in Feb with 3 other women. We asked about the possibility of having rooms on the same floor or nextdoor. No was the impolite answer - no reason given - just couldn't be bothered!! Other than that, it was a great hotel, fabulous location in east berlin. Rooms a bit tight and the bathrooms were very intimate. Not ideal for a first date. The breakfast was very good and the bar at night lively enough. Great big couch to sit on and you can take off your shoes. Great after a long day queueing etc to see the sights. Really good location. Train station, underground train, tram and buses just outside on alexanderplatz. Get tickets at hotel from the concierge who has great english. Also the 100 bus is great for all sight seeing. Tip - make sure to take the express train to schonfeld airport not the slow line. It's confusing and time consuming and you will need to change twice. Oh and the galeria on the square is a hugh 5 floor department store worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jon_Mendel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for six nights in a Business Class room (which cost around A$20 a night more than a Standard room). The room was very comfortable with a nice bath (although those sharing might find the open bathroom somewhat unusual!). For a single person it was spacious enough. The hotel is massive with over a 1,000 rooms, but it has a massive breakfast room so there was never a problem getting a table. The breakfasts were good. I had dinner in the Zille-Stube, one of 3 restaurants in the hotel and it was ok, but not great. The hotel is located in an excellent position, near Museum Island and about a 20 minute walk to the Brandenburg Gates. It has a S-Bahn station very nearby. Also nearby is a bus stop from which one can get the bus to the airport which cost around €2.10. Overall I found the hotel excellent, comfortable, with good service and offered good value for money. I would certainly stay there again if/when I return to Berlin. Tip: look out for the store called "Schkecker" (nearby the hotel and in other locations in Berlin and other cities) which seems to be a chain selling cosmetics and the like, but also has soft drinks at generally reasonably prices (eg cold Coke €0.79 and water was €0.59, plus bottle deposit)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: dublin321
Reviews.Content: Park Inn Berlin Alexanderplatz is a wonderful hotel. It's a real treat. The location is absolutely PERFECT-easy to get to, day or night. As central as you can get! The hotel room was a bit small, but had excellent views over Alexanderplatz and the TV tower. The breakfast was incredible-best choice of food I've ever seen in a hotel. Coming from Ireland, the height of the hotel was really exciting. Would really reccommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever, best breakfast and superb staff”
Reviews.Author: Miss-Solberg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 3 nights in january. It was superb. We ordered the hotel through hotelsclick.com and payed 500 euro for two doubleroom friday-monday included breakfast.. I upgraded the room directly by caliing the hotel for 20 euro pr night. The room was upgradet to panorama wiew witch meens that you have a panorama room with two windows on a corner. This room is bigger than the other ones and also includes a bath tub. I askes for a coffee and teamaker and that was brought up to the room. Everything was perfect. The location is superb. Breakfast was the best i have even seen. The best variety of breakfast i have ever seen at a hotel ever. The cleaning of the room was great. The roomservice from the restaurant was extremely good. We ordered clubsandwich, pizza, french fries and two coke for the price of 40 euro. Enough for 3-4 people:) I would recommend this hotel for everyone But keep out of the restaurant beside burger king at first floor. We were all sick after have dining there.Worst food ever..

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MspTripper
Reviews.Content: I can't think of 1 negative... This is what I liked: the room was not large but well laid out and beautifully (although not necessarily expensively furnished); the bed was extremely comfortable and I loved the comforters (we each had our own which was wonderful); the hotel was incredibly quiet, even over New Years when it appeared they were full to the max; the buffet breakfast was exceptional; the location was great, with the U-bahn, S-bahn and buses all right at Alexanderplatz; the climate control in the room was perfect, even though we were on the 32nd floor it never was too hot or too cold (we had our own thermostat but that doesn't always guarantee a comfortable room); in addition to the good public transportation options right there many of the major tourist attractions in the city were in walking distance (I like to walk so other's might not agree). We were here a full week and there was nothing about the place that I can fault. And just as an fyi, it is a soviet era building that was remodeled a couple years after the wall went down, and they did a fabulous job on it. I have stayed in other properties in former soviet bloc countries which retained the sterile/ugly quality so recognizable in those buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring Berlin”
Reviews.Author: WalkerTalker
Reviews.Content: Had a recommendation from someone that Park Inn was good, so booked it on-line for a 3-day city-break. It turned out to be one of the best hotels I've stayed in - not for glitter and flash but for plain efficiency and excellent location. Room was modern with all the usuals and more - TV, minibar, locksafe. Staff were helpful. Hotel is in former East-Berlin, right next to transport links, and walking distance to many of the must-see sights - TV tower, Museums, Reichstag etc, e.g. Brandenburg Gate is an easy 20-min walk away. The room's glass-walled shower and toilet were strange, but if you turn up the TV you can hide certain noises. Extra cost for breakfast on our deal - 17 Euros seemed a lot for breakfast, but we found plenty of cafes or even the department store nearby which provided great breakfast for less. Anything bad to say about it? - No. The bar managed to provide a substantial sandwich meal on our arrival after midnight even (delayed flight) even tho the kitchen was officially closed. Full Marks!

Reviews.Title: “Definately a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: KiwiInPimlico
Reviews.Content: Have just got back from a weekend in Berlin and stayed at this hotel booked through lastminute.com which had it listed as a 4-star - it is definately not! The location (and the views) are excellent, and while we did a lot of walking, we had no problems navigating the underground either. The rooms are small, and as two single travellers, the bathroom set up wasn't the best, and because of that I wouldn't stay there again. The service was fine and we did use the Concierge a couple of times, but his recommendations were not that good to be honest. An Italian restaurant just around the corner from Checkpoint Charlie called Sale E Tabacchi was recommended to us, and it was so good, we went there twice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Excellent Excellent”
Reviews.Author: WicklowIrelandOntour
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in early Dec. What can we say except EXCELLENT. For such a big hotel the customer service is spot on. We arrived bleary eyed from Schonfeld via the airport express (€2.40pp) at 11am and were allowed check in to our room immediately. Rooms are a little small but everythings works extremely well. This hotel ticks all the boxes - location, price, facilities, cleanliness, great breakfasts- what more can I say? We booked thru hotel club.com and got a got deal- €80 per night including the excellent breakfast. Request a tower facing room for the best view and get as high a floor as is available. We ate at the Block House (8 min walk away) and had fab steaks at unbelievable value. Enjoy all the Xmas markets and remember your luggage allowance for the flight home!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “City Break”
Reviews.Author: bigburd
Reviews.Content: We were in Berlin for a short City Break. The main reason for our visit was to see the sights and to visit the Christmas Markets. The hotel was ideally located - right next to public transport but also within walking distance of lots of main attractions. Staff in the hotel were pleasant and helpful. Our room was on the 33rd floor and had a tremendous view right across the city. The rooms were well fitted and spotless. The beds were very comfortable. Don't let the toilet set-up put you off, it's really not as bad as you might imagine. We chose only to have breakfast on the last morning of our stay - it was lovely but a lot more expensive than in any of the many eating places which are nearby. I would definitely use this hotel again and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it as it is great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay in Park Inn”
Reviews.Author: Dol123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent value. The location is brilliant. Only takes about 40 mins from Schonefeld airport on the train and you step off the train and walk about 5 mins to hotel reception. Hotel room was fantastic - modern and minimalistic, clean and fresh with a stunning view ( Floor 37) .Parents had absolutely wonderful room on lower floor but no view. Breakfast was plentiful. We couldn't fault the place, even the reception staff were really helpful and eager to help us. All in all ...2nd time we have stayed here and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Park Inn - Ups and Downs”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_Dudes
Reviews.Content: First the UPS.... The Park Inn Hotel in Alexanderplatz Square in Berlin (Old East Berlin) is a very nice place to stay. Shopping, bus, tram, subway and tourist attractions are all within walking distance. Alexanderplatz has many places to shop. This hotel could not be more ideally situated for the tourist. The staff throughout the hotel is friendly. The bar and restaurants are nice and the food is better than most hotel offerings. The morning buffet breakfast at the Spasso Lounge is excellent. Live music on the weekends at the bar (Spasso's Lounge) was very nice. A very relaxing place to sit back and have a cocktail after being on the run all day. The Concierge at the Park Inn was excellent. Not only can they book tourist attractions, they also can book restaurant reservations and make suggestions on places to see, do and eat. You can also buy your daily City Pass (6,20 Euros) from the Concierge that allows you to take any public form of transportation for the entire day (Bus, Subway, and Tram). Now the Downs.... The rooms in the place are tiny. Now when I say tiny, I mean tiny. The price is very good for Berlin, but be prepared for cramped quarters. The restrooms seem to have been a second thought for this place. The shower, sink and toilet are all separate, but the toilet and shower are enclosed in GLASS stalls. The toilet area is smaller than most stalls you would encounter at a shopping mall restroom. The shower was large enough to move around. However, make sure you are traveling with someone close and personal to you, as there is absolutely no privacy in the shower or toilet. I mean to say; when you use the restroom (toilet or shower) you are sharing your experience with everyone else in the room! The Hotel check-in is at 2pm. Remember, this place is huge (over 1000 rooms). If you arrive early, the counter staff will not permit you to check in until after 2pm. What does this mean? Well, at 2pm there is a mad dash for check-in and an enormous line builds up. The wait for me was over 30 minutes in this line. I felt sorry for those even farther back in line waiting to check in. However, if you arrive early, the counter staff will take your luggage and deliver it to your room after you check in. The hotel has a viewing deck on the upper floor. However, even though you are a paying guest of the hotel, you still have to pay 3 Euros to get off on this floor to see the views. This Hotel also has a casino on the upper floor. However, there is a dress code for men. Men must wear slacks and a tie to get in. No exceptions day or night. If the doorman does not like what you are wearing, you will not be allowed inside. Even though the hotel advertises it offers WiFi on all floors, be aware this is not the case. In fact, there are several floors that do not have WiFi service. Make sure to ask for a floor with WiFi if you want to connect to the Internet. All in All, this hotel was a great choice and definitely above average. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: dw22277
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Berlin. Had a great time! There were wonderful views from our hotel room. There is a Christmas market with an outdoor skating rink just outside the entrance of the hotel. They sell yummy Bratwurst, Currywurst etc. Don’t forget to try the Mulled wine, because you are going to need it, it is very cold at the moment in Berlin, colder than I was expecting, so wrap up warm. The hotel was lovely & the rooms very modern, the bath & toilet are a bit strange with the frosted glass, but there is a curtain you can use to maintain some privacy. The staff were very friendly & we didn’t have tea & coffee making facilities in the room but we requested some at reception & they brought it up to the room within minutes, we didn’t have to pay any extra for this. There are good transport facilities from the hotel, you can get the U-bahn/S-bahn near the hotel or the 100/200 bus from across the road which takes you to the zoo etc. Also if your travelling from Tegel airport just get the TXL bus which drops you off outside the hotel & costs 2.10 Euros’ each, you can buy tickets on the bus. Great location with lots of sights nearby within walking distance. Don’t forget to visit the Gendarmenmarkt, Christmas market as to me this is the best one in Berlin; you have to pay 1Euro each to get it but definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cyriel
Reviews.Content: We just came back yesterday from our trip to Berlin. The trip itself was great. We love Berlin. The hotel was superb. It is located central, near to the 'fernsehtur'. We had a room at the 34 floor, in the corner off the building. We had 2 windows . One looked out at the fernsehtur and the other to another part of the city. What a view, we almost could see the whole city. The room was superb too. It was very clean. We loved the bed. We had a bathroom with bath. Everything in the room looked new (except the television, but it worked fine and we didn't really use it).The room was cleaned everyday and provided with clean towels. The breakfast was great too. I loved the Kaiserbrotchen and the scrumbled egg. The only thing that I can mention as a minor point is, that the coffee was not strong enough. But that was no problem, because near the Fernsehtur there is a Starbucks (there is no better coffee then Starbucks-coffee). On our last day we went for the Spa. 20 euros for a massage and after that you can use the sauna and chill out as long as you like. It was great. All the major sightseeings are nearby the hotel. There is a subway-station in front of the hotel, that can bring you anywhere. The public transport in Berlin is great, also because it still goes at night. Overall I think there is no better place to stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Park Inn!!”
Reviews.Author: nmstein
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel twice and find it excellent value. Great location beside a u bahn/s bahn station, excellent view from the rooms. We found the staff to be very courteous and helpful. The breakfast is the best we've experienced in any hotel. There's no excuse to go hungry!! Would always return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good value and good location”
Reviews.Author: miztravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location to the train and tour bus stops! this was a major plus since some of our day tours started very early in the morning. The run was overall clean. There is a lot of construction going on in the entire area. As it has been noted in some of the reviews the location of the shower is really out of place in the middle of the room. My only negative comment is that the front desk staff was not very friendly. It was like pulling wisdom teeth to get information. I ask to speak to the manager and she was not very helpful at all. We checked in late in the evening and no one had a smile on their face. I did notice that the morning crew was a lot more helpful. I will also note that the glasses in the room were questionably clean/unclean. My tip would be to grab some paper cups.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap luxury on advance internet bookings”
Reviews.Author: LSBournemouth
Reviews.Content: We booked our room a few months ahead online and got it very cheap considering what a posh hotel it is, so we were very pleased! Our room was very quiet and clean. The only minor problem was that Berlin hotel cleaners seem to open the door fairly early in the morning to see whether you're in there or not, rather than just knocking! It's a great location, especially if you want to explore Mitte, the centre of former East Berlin, and is near major S-Bahn, U-Bahn and tram stops, lots of good restaurants and some kebab shops, and a big department store. It's a short walk from the Fernsehturm, the Marx and Engels monument, Under den Linden, Nikolaiviertel and various museums. But do go out for breakfast unless you're very rich.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: gillygeegee
Reviews.Content: I would concur with most other reviewers - great location particularly as you can access most S and U bahn lines to get you to most tourist spots but it is also walkable to most major attractions - 10 minutes to Berlin Catherdral - 5 minutes walk to bus stop for buses to the airport - between 20 - 30 minutes to Brandenburg gate, postdamer platz, berlin wall gallery, reichstag. There are also plenty of shops / cafes / snack bars and restuarants nearby to meet your needs (fast food, take aways, to chain restuarants, pizza places and german food places). We did not have a room rate with breakfast but there is a reasonable cafe at one of the hotel entrances (on square rather than main road side) next to a burger king, which save you money as we ate and drank there for about 5 euros and I think breakfast was at least double this at the hotel. There is a casino and a restuarant in the hotel but I did not try either of these out. I note people comments about the slowness of service at reception - we had a problem as we were allocated to two rooms which had not been cleaned and finally on the third try we got lucky! I was disappointed at the lack of apology but on realising that I had left paperwork in one of the rooms (which had since been cleaned) there were incredibly helpful and located the papers in the bin for me and returned them. We were on the 20th or 21st floor and the views were great and you could watch Berlin at your lesuire - this meant that noise was very minimal - we were at the end of the corridor and I was not disturbed by any noise from other guests which was great. Rooms were clean and comfortable and not massive and the bathrooms were fine although a little strange it was not as bad as I had anticipated - the curtain ensured privacy and the toilet was fine and separate which was good if you wanted to use the sink. Sometimes the lobby could be very busy - it is quiet small for such a big hotel and when people were gathering to meet it could be noisy and difficult to get to the lifts. Luggage can be left in safe storage until you depart.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring Berlin!”
Reviews.Author: CurlyWurly_2007
Reviews.Content: Wow! What can I say, this is such a well-located hotel for exploring Berlin! It is located metres from both the S & U-Bahn's and Alexanderplatz seems to be a 'main' station for many of the lines in Berlin so you can get to most places without needing to change trains! I've just come back from Berlin after staying 4 nights in this hotel with my boyfriend and have to say we were both more than happy with it. We got a good service at reception, the concierge was very helpful and they can provide you with the Berlin WelcomeCard should you wish to use that whilst over there. We were on the 26th floor and had magnificent views! As others have mentioned, the toilet/shower facilities may be a touch different to what you expect but we were fine with the arrangement - for those that don't know, its an area within the bedroom that is sectioned off with frosted glass around it and so although you can't actually see the person, it may not be appropriate for those that don't know each other quite as well! Breakfast was included in our rate and it was quite a spread! Something for everyone! Yes it was busy, it's a big hotel at the end of the day, but not so much so that we couldn't find a table and there were many people working and they really were efficient at clearing tables etc! I genuinely can't think of any faults with the hotel, it delivered all we expected. We had a late arrival and this wasn't a problem with the hotel and also our flight home was not til early evening and they have an area where you can store your luggage safely until you need it which was at no charge. Overall, I think this hotel should definitely be considered to all those wanting to explore Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: OliGriff
Reviews.Content: Arrived early evening, first impressions very good, staff attentive efficient. Great location, room comfortable but not lavish but great views over the city (but it would depend on which floor your on) There's a casino on the top floor, however there's a dress code - I went up to have a look but it's no entry without a tie, no boots/trainers or jeans - I failed on all three counts Breakfast was a treat

Reviews.Title: “Good value and Great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: yipchris
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 nights in mid-Sep. The room was small and facilities were basic. However, its location was unbeatable - reachable by all kinds of public transportation. Breakfast was impressive when compared to many 4-5 star hotels in Europe. Staff were generally friendly and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Not all it's cracked up to be”
Reviews.Author: wunderer
Reviews.Content: Moved to the Park Inn from the Mark Hotel, as could not get a booking for four nights, so had two nights in each. Reception was OK when we booked in, however noted long queues at other times, as limited desks for the size of the hotel. Stayed on 20th floor, good views, rooms small,and had bath in room which is very strange. Clean and pleasant, but nothing special. Didn't eat there, but were charged over 10 euro for a glass of red wine! In general hotel was OK but overpriced, we paid for one night and got one free from Radisson loyalty card, and paid a rate of 147 Euro, but heard people paying up to 190 Euro, not good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scout122
Reviews.Content: I stayed for this hotel for three nights and I cannot fault it in any area. The location was excellent and the view from the bedroom was unbelievable. The staff were friendly and very helpful. The rooms were clean and modern and the breakfasts were incredible. The choice available was excellent and the buffet style layout meant you could help yourself to as much or as little as you wanted.
