The bar and restaurant were also good with entertainment each evening. The only downside was the odd toilet and shower arrangements so it would be advisable just to be aware of this before booking. Having said that I believe that my stay in Germany would have been less enjoyable had I not chosen this hotel for my trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Davey1800
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel in a fantastic location. I stayed here for 3 nights over 4 days, and was stunned by how good this hotel was. I paid £80 per night (not that expensive considering £60-£80 can get you a dump in central London) through Thomas Cook. I chose this location due to the fact that the hotel had great reviews, and because it was slap bang in the middle of the must-see areas. The public transportation to the sights was impressive, but it is even better to walk, in my opinion. After arriving from Schoenefeld airport via S-Bahn 9 (easily gotten to from the airport, just follow the signs by foot) at Alexanderplatz, I emerged from the station to see the imposing TV tower on one side, and the very impressive looking (well it would be at 37 stories tall) Park Inn hotel on the other. Amazing first impression. The main lobby is very posh and imposing. The reception staff were very efficient and helpful during check-in. There are 12 lifts that cater to different floors - and my lift took me to the 30th floor in what seemed to be 5 seconds or so. There are about 30 rooms to each floor - each room being 10-12 feet wide and 40 feet long. So they did seem to be small, but they were impeccable. There was a double bed made up of 2 single beds joined together - not ideal perhaps, but at least you got your own duvet if sleeping with a partner - but as I was alone it didn't concern me. I wouldn't of been bothered if I was with someone to be honest and I don't consider this arrangement to be a terrible thing. The room had the "legendary" glass-cased shower / toilet combo that feels like you are using public toilets. Sure, they seem odd and will definitely cause embarrassment to those not fully comfortable with each others "toilet habits", but this IS Germany! The shower was fantastic and had lots of room. It was also well sealed when the door was closed, so no water leaked onto the tiled floor. Also in the room is a flat screen LCD TV (complete with hardcore porn, so put the child-lock on it if you are going with minors), mini bar (beer, wine, snacks etc.. very handy), hair dryer, iron / ironing board, plenty of wardrobe and drawer space. Basically everything you needed was there - EXCEPT a room safe. However, if you ask at reception, they will give you access to a private safety deposit box (like in a bank) in the back room behind reception, and there you can deposit whatever you like (I put my passport, housekeys and UK cash in there). This service is free, invaluable, and is recommended by the hotel itself. I feel that safety in the hotel is top notch though, as there are plenty of staff around, so hopefully no ne'er-do-wells can just wander in (although they "could", as there are two entrances that aren't constantly staffed - although people who shouldn't be there would probably be intercepted by reception before they made it to the lifts). I left valuables in my room without any qualms. Good Points: 1) Excellent hotel overall 2) Excellent location for the sights (including the ladies at Hackescher Markt of an evening) 3) Excellent location for nightlife 4) Seemed safe and secure 5) Housekeeping was fantastic and unobtrusive ("do not disturb" signs needed on door handle of course) 6) Just generally very good :) Bad Points: 1) Alexanderplatz is home to lots of scruffy youths (skinhead types) who congregate all day at the fountain in the main square / plaza, drinking and being very loud. It gets MUCH worse of an evening, when the local kids join in at the base of the TV tower. It seems to get very rowdy, but I had no trouble walking through the area of an evening. Not a nice sight though, so be warned. 2) The breakfast was awful in my opinion. I sampled it once and never went back, despite it being a free buffet. It consisted of cereals (that's fine, but not my thing), different types of scrambled eggs with odd flavours, hot dog sausages (for breakfast?), roast potatoes (I kid you not). The coffee tasted like.. well.. I have no idea what it tasted like, but it sure wasn't coffee :) The workers in the restaraunt were efficient and helpful, so the effort was there. 3) Despite the people on reception doing a great job, they did seem a little "moody", but this was something I noted amongst a lot of German people. The women may be pretty, but they never smile :( Overall, this hotel is fantastic and comes highly recommended. My first stay in Germany was made all the better due to the great location and quality of this hotel. I will be back to Berlin, and hopefully it should be to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shooshi-lou
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Park Inn for a 4 night stay. This was my first time to Berlin and I was so pleased with my choice of hotel. Location wise it is second to none, with Alexanderplatz S-Bahn and U-Bahn running from virtually your doorstep. I found our room to be excellent, we were lucky enough to get a corner room. It was cleaned thoroughly daily. Breakfast in the morning was a joy. There was always a huge choice and plenty of seating for everyone. You are also within walking distance of probably the best nightlife in the city. Using the excellent city map provided we navigated our way to Dirkenstrasse. This is a short stroll from the hotel and here you will find many bars and restaurants housed within the arches of the railway line which runs overhead. A must visit is the Lemke Brauhouse where you get to sample a selection of the local beers before selecting which one (or ones) you wish to have. Next door is Riva Bar where they have an amazing list of cocktails available. It is a little pricey (2 cocktails averaging 17 euro) but they are well worth it. Following the road right round you come to a small square where you'll find several more bars where you can sit outside or if you fancy a dance a must is AM to PM, more great cocktails and a jumping wee dancefloor. During the day the area is just as nice with loads of shops with favourites like Adidas, Hugo Boss as well as one off boutiques. Just strolling around you'll find and eclectic mix of shops and I'm sure spy a nice restaurant to come back to that night. If you are there to sightsee, it is all so accessible thanks to teh location. We travelled to the Reichstag, Jewish Museum, Checkpoint Charlie, Zoo and Brandenburg Gate using the public transport. It was very punctual, clean and safe no matter what time of the day. Just dont forget to buy a ticket before you board and validate it at the wee machines next to the ticket machines. If you dont have one you will be fined 40 euro!! Highly recommended city and will always return to the Park Inn.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: manunyc
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel nicely located right in the hart of the city. I found that almost every thing in this hotel was very nice with the only possible exception being the staff at the front desk. The rooms are nicely appointed, very clean and have wonderful views. the location is great as it sits with in walking distance of many major attractions and right next to numerous public transpiration lines. This is certainly not the cheapest option in Berlin but if you can get a slightly discounted rate as we did it is well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: travellingted
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights on a quick trip to Berlin. We were on the 26th floor and had a room looking towards all the major sites in Berlin, the view was fantastic. The hotel is very easy to get to from the airports. We landed at Tegal and caught the TXL bus straight to Alexanderplatz - fantastic value at 2.10EURO. If you have a day pass, this trip is included in it. Rooms are not huge and as mentioned the shower and the toliet are in little glass cubes, rather than in one separate bathroom. The room has a minibar and small fridge. Check in and check out was fast and friendly. We didn't use any of the other facilities at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: LardSardine
Reviews.Content: Myself and eight friends have just returned from a weekend away in Berlin and found the Park Inn to be ideal. The location is good, within walking distance of many of Berlin's sights and directly opposite the TV Tower in the centre of the large Alexanderplatz. The square itself has a train station which connects to the Schoenefeld Airport via the Airport Express. It has shops, restaurants and bars and is on both the Tram and Underground lines. Once the development around the square is complete, it should look neat and tidy. Because the rooms in the hotel are so far up there is no noise from outside, the windows being triple glazed. This also makes for superb views over the city. It also means that its almost impossible to lose your way home since either the hotel or the TV tower are nealy always in view. Rooms themselves are very small and cramped for two people, but are functional and the beds are fine. The flat-screen TV is nice although there are only the standard 18 or so channels that you get in most European hotels, but you do get Sky News. The bathrooms are a bit odd since the walls are made of glass but luckily our toilet door was frosted and the shower could be cut off from the rest of the room with a curtain although it makes it a little bit awkward if you're sharing with someone you're not intimate with! Bear in mind that not all rooms are the same so the bathroom layout and seclusion levels could be different, for example there was no curtain separating the bathroom area from the rest of the room in one of the rooms two of our party were sharing. There was a safety deposit box in our room although some of our friends didn't have one, however the hotel and Berlin as a whole felt very safe. The rooms were always nice and clean when we returned and we had no problem with the service albeit we didn't need to use it much. The disappointing point was that the rooftop terrace bar was never open, which I couldn't understand in the middle of summer on a weekend. Seems a bit of a waste of revenue to me. Anyway, the lobby bar was pleasant enough. We got a great deal on the price due to booking a flight-hotel package, so it was nowhere near the standard tariffs. One final praise for the elevators, 37 to Ground in just a few seconds, and waiting time was hardly any.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: SafferMark
Reviews.Content: The Park Inn is a star above its rating. Fantastic location, within easy reach of everything. 2 quick train rides (even around the midnight hours) from Schonefeld or Tegel Airports (or single bus for Tegel from the station just across the square). It seems to have been recently (and attractively) refurbished, so some complaints about the bathrooms may have been addressed. Overall, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Strange Shower Arrangements”
Reviews.Author: Trippertrooper
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel recently. Situated in east Berlin right on the slightly seedy square . The hotel staff are very effecient and friendly. Food in the restaurant is reasonably priced and very good. The" twin" bedroom turned out to be a double with two duvets. The en suite consisted of a washhand basin in the room partitioned off from the shower and wc by semi-opaque glass - an astonishing arrangement which gives little or no privacy. Shy couples beware! Great views from the rooms don't really compensate.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: dublin_boy
Reviews.Content: The Park Inn is vast and the sheer number of guests meant that checking in or out or even a simple enquiry to reception meant waiting in a queue, expecially as the staff had a very unhurried approach to service. As others have noted, the rooms have a very eccentric bathroom arrangement with the shower opening directly onto the room and the toilet in a (partly) frosted glass cubicle. You may ending up knowing more about the digestive tract of your fellow-traveller than either of your need! The breakfast buffet had a reasonable selection of most items, though no pastries on either morning - an oddity in a city with a good bakery on practically every street corner. Again the sheer number of fellow guests meant that you have to pick your way carefully through the throng to avoid nasty accidents with platefuls of scrambled egg. We didn't try the rooftop terrace - it seemed a bit mean to charge guests €3 just to enter. On the plus side our spotless room had an amazing view over the eastern part of the city centre, the bed was comfortable with really good quality linen and the location could not be bettered. Berlin is well provided with good reasonably priced hotels and I would rate the generally cheaper InterCity Hotel at the Ostbahnhof better for service

Reviews.Title: “Much Higher Quality Than Anticipated”
Reviews.Author: Andioo
Reviews.Content: Came to the Park Inn expecting very little and was very pleasantly surprised. The rooms were of an excellent quality, very newly refurbished and modern. The bed was excellent and sheets crisp and white. The communal areas of the hotel were adequate although not lavish. The breakfast was of the usual German very high standards. Overall excellent VFM and i will be sure to return. A nice bit of trivia about the hotel as told to me by my guide on a tour of "Red Berlin" was that this hotel before the fall of the wall was probably one of the most bugged buildings in the whole of the GDR as this is where they would house visiting western diplomats.

Reviews.Title: “Can confirm other reviews”
Reviews.Author: Elparaiso
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in June. Ideal location if you fly into Schonefeld, as the airport express stops at the adjacent station. Alexanderplatz itself is fairly bland but the station affords easy access across the city. Reception friendly and efficient. Plenty lifts, good size and ear poppingly fast. Room smallish but fine. Comfy bed but strange double duvet approach. Toilet/shower unusual and only for close travelling companions. Good aircon, which was essential as it was 31 degrees.View we had was towards the TV tower and was excellent. Breakfast was buffet style and fine. We always went down after 9am and there was plenty space. My first trip to Berlin for 16 years and the developments in that time have been amazing. Will come back, although not in the heat of summer, and would certainly consider staying at the Park Inn.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jelmer
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights from June 10. Excellent hotel with good service, very good value for money. Rooms are amazingly quiet and spotlessly clean. We asked for a room with a (great) view on the town and got it. Very good air conditioning control (handy if it is 32 degrees outside, as it was when we were there!) and the beds were excellent. Good breakfast buffet., which can be busy at certain times (hotel has around 1000 rooms), so just pick your times. Location is another of its assets, a 100 metres from Alexanderplatz station.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: laura1006
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel around 10pm on monday evening, where we were greeted with typical German efficiency and were in our room within 10 minutes of being there. Our room was on the 27th floor, which gave fantastic views out over the city (albeit not towards the centre). The room was lovely and clean, beds comfortable (although with only 1 pillow each, I'd recommend asking for extra pillows at reception) and the bathroom fantastic - even if it was a little weird only being separated by frosted glass from the rest of the room. The breakfast was excellent (a bonus as we thought we had room only) with a variety of choices from cooked to continental - even salad!! Loads of different types of german breads, cheeses, sausages etc. The location of the hotel is perfect with the S-Bahnhof just across the square to get you to any destination very quickly. I'd recommend buying a day ticket for zones A & B at 6 Euros each which you can use until 3am the following morning. The trains are so efficient and pretty clean, it was a dramatic change from the Public transport in the UK. We also walked from the hotel down to Berliner Dom, Brandenburg Gate, The Reichstag and then back along the river to the Pergamon Museum, which took longer than expected, but that may have been due to the heat and the fact I was wearing flip flops - not a good choice! In the evening we went to Hackesche Markt which was ok with a view bars and cafes but not the liveliest of places. Since coming back I've discovered we may have been better venturing to Ku'Dam - another time maybe!! Oranienburger Strasse is tipped as a good and lively place to go also but we didn't find it to be like that and were a bit disappointed by it. All in all, I'd definitely reccomend a visit, Berlin is steeped in history and the Germans are not afraid of displaying their past with the Holocaust Memorial including an information centre with personal accounts of what happened to Jews during the 2nd World War - very interesting but definitely emotional.

Reviews.Title: “Smart, modern hotel, high tech rooms”
Reviews.Author: vanmunchen
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights from 5 June. Excellent hotel with very good service and reasonably priced. Smart, ultra modern room although rather on the small side. Very good room air conditioning control - very quiet with extremely comfortable bed. Superb breakfast buffet. Location is perfect. Close to station, department stores, cafes etc

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Turisti
Reviews.Content: Spent the last (extended) weekend of May in Berlin at the Hotel Park Inn Alexanderplatz and was quite pleased. Everything as I had expected according to reviews from TripAdvisor and even better. The room was nice/modern with a great view and everything very clean. Excellent breakfast buffet (incl in our price) served ´till 10:30 (make sure you´ve finished eating by then, ´cause the lady with the vacuum cleaner comes marching in and starts vacuuming on the dot, wont find any crumbs on her floor... ). Though the hotel is big there is no lack of good service. Enjoyed eating at fancy Spagos on the ground floor, good food and service. Went to check on the view from the sun deck on the 37th floor, but they were closed due to strong winds, maybe next time. Found location to be good for different walking ventures; the river Spree with boat cruises, Berlin Dom and Museum Insel, Nikolaiviertel, Hackisher Markt (beware of pick pockets) and Oranienburgstrasse where we had a great 3 course dinner at the lovely restaurant Kadima (Jewish/Russian, non kosher) for 30 Euros pr person, excluding wine. Also recommend a good restaurant downtown on a sidestreet from Ku´damm, Sachs at Knesebeckstrasse, definately the best dinner of our five day city-break. All in all, a good hotel which I can recommend and would consider staying at again, great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: PirongiaJo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and absolutely loved it. It is a huge hotel 37 stories high anbd located at the historical Alexanderplatz with a Underground stop right outside. The rooms are quite small but very new with cool bathrooms and a great shower. Next door is a huge department store open til 7pm most nights. Burgerking and a few other cafes,and a beer garden is also downstairs. The included breakfast was fantastic with a huge selection although in a giant crowded resteraunt. The open top bus tour stops on the road opposite. I also had a swedish massage at the sauna gym area and was very impressed. We liked this hotel although it is huge and impersonal.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugUtah
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Park Inn. It's location can't be beat! The staff was very helpful and competant. Our room was modern and extremely clean. We had a great view of the TV Tower. The breakfast was absolutely amazing, but a bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: sssss1
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in the Park Inn and were really happy with our choice. The room itself was small but contained all we needed. It was spotlessly clean. The bathrooms are quite funky and the rain shower is fab ! The beds were very comfortable. The rooms are pretty quiet, we were beside the lifts and heard very little noise. The hotel is in a great location for sightseeing. The train station is 2 mins away, Brandenburg gates are about 15 mins walk, passing some great sites (Dom, Babelplatz etc). The square itself is fine, based on some reviews I had been quite concerned but these concerns were unfounded. There are a number of shops in the square and lots of little bakeries in the train station which was great for breakfast. On one night, we headed to the Hackescher Markt area to eat and can highly recommend this area for food or a drink. Its a short walk or 1 stop on the S-Bahn from Alexanderplatz. Would also recommend the New Berlin free walking tour. Berlin is an amazing city and the Park Inn is a good base to explore it. We would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice interior & great views, but location is uninspiring.”
Reviews.Author: ExplorerIreland
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights while in Berlin with work, and its a nice hotel and location is great if you want to see the museums. The rooms looks like they've been recently redecorated, and they are both clean and decorated nicely... its clear a bit of effort and thought went into the décor. Having said that, it was a little odd that the bath/shower in our room had no wall, but a glass panel which was open to the room, but hey, open plan is great too. As the Park Inn is Berlin's tallest building, naturally the views are spectacular, although cleaning the windows more often would make this view more enjoyable. The hotel is in Alexander Platz, which is central and near a very convenient U-Bahn line that runs through the main tourist sites, although the square itself is soulless and lacking any charm. Plenty of shops in the nearby platz and in the Galleria Kaufhof behind the hotel. Check in/out was all very efficient, and the staff are very friendly. The hotel also has a terrace on the higher floors (Floor 39, I think) and is an excellent and relaxing place to have a quick drink in the evening before planning your night-life excursions. Having said that, if you are an English speaker, there is only 2 English channels available in the room (both news!)... some kind of satellite or cable choice would have been great, especially for a hotel that advertises itself as international. I was also very disappointed in the lack of wireless internet, although wired internet (via LAN cable) was available in the room, but at a ridiculous cost.Personally, I don't think expecting free or affordable in-room internet access to those who need it is unreasonable. Overall, a great place to stay for comfort and cost, but you could probably do better finding a hotel in more pleasant surroundings than the very drab Alexander Platz. A few tips when in Berlin: Give yourself plenty of time to explore the museums, but if time is limited, the Pergamon is a must if only for the Istar Gates of Ancient Babylon. Museums open until 10pm on Thursday and are free. Check Point Charlie is a little bit on the touristy side (the checkpoint itself isn't the original, just a mock up), but the museum next to it is quite good. If the weather is good, a stroll in the Tiergarten is a nice way to spend the afternoon. A day U-Bahn ticket is a great and very inexpensive way to get around, the U-Bahn (and S-Bahn's) are very safe and clean - if you want to go a little further outside Berlin, get the three zone ticket (Zones A, B, & C), its not much dearer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: MarkRoddis
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 day trip to Berlin and a stay in the Park Inn I arrived as part of a large group close to midnight yet check in was quick, efficient and accurate and I was in my room on the 16th floor in a matter of minutes. I am aware however that the coach that arrived at 2 found that although their rooms were pre paid (not just pre booked) ended up in a nearby 5 star hotel (at the Park Inns expense) because the Park Inn chose to overbook. Don't you just hate it when hotels do that? Anyway my room was very modern with a double bed (well 2 twins put together) and a small table by the window. Plenty of cupboard and hanging space and overall, a perfectly good room. As mentioned in other reviews the the glass walled shower does mean that you should only ever share one of these rooms if you are happy for the person you are sharing with seeing you naked in the shower. The room was served by wireless internet access for which there was a charge however as I use iPass I cannot tell you how much it would have cost but it did work fine. The mini bar was of the over flowing type by which I mean that there were other items such as bottles of water and crisps spread around the room which were all to be paid for if used. The cost of the minibar was not cheap although I don't think the words mini bar and cheap go together anywhere anyway. As the weather in Berlin was stunning this week (27 degrees) I spent some time up on the rooftop terrace on the 39th floor. It cost €3 to get in and did seem a bit makeshift but had a bar, music and deckchairs and the 2nd best view in Berlin (the first being the TV tower next door) so €3 was cheeky but a cost I was prepared to pay. Breakfast was however a joke. It is a large hotel and the breakfast area is large as well but there is no seating help so you just find yourself a table if you can. One morning, 2 of us spent the best part of 10 minutes walking around trying to find a table and some people were starting to argue about people taking their tables. This is plain daft and the hotel needs to do something about it. Transport from the hotel could not be better. It is right next the the station where you can get over ground trains, under ground trains, trams and busses. You can buy an all day ticket that covers the whole system for €6.30 which offers fantastic value for money considering the trains were frequent and quick. I caught the over ground from the hotel to the ICC which is the other side of town and it took 25 minutes door to door. The same journey by taxi took 45 minutes. So overall a good hotel in a good location and I would be quite happy to stay their again if staying in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “this park.brilliant”
Reviews.Author: morgangeth
Reviews.Content: Great hotel,nothing to complain.good location,easy walk to the gate,train station 2 min away.Our room on the floor 36,so we had a great view of Berlin,no hesitation in staying in the Park again.

Reviews.Title: “Great short break”
Reviews.Author: Alex_UK_traveller
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Took my wife here for an Anniversary break. Managed to book a junior suite - only 130 euros (less than 100 pounds) per night. Room was on 35th floor with great view of the tower. Room was very large with bed (Seemed to be twin beds pushed together athough bopoked as king suite!), minibar, chairs and a great flat screen TV. 2 minutes walk from the AlexanderPlatz Sbahn and Ubahn stations. Great reception very friendly. Downside - limited menu and hours for roomservice. Our flight was delayed and we had hoped to get something at midnight - but nothing available

Reviews.Title: “A great stay at the Park Inn”
Reviews.Author: Tatie
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four-night stay at the Park Inn. It was a wonderful hotel. It is huge, but everything runs very smoothly. The concierge and reception staff were very helpful. The breakfast was wonderful, even though it got crowded, supplies were replenished, coffee was always hot and on the table. Rooms were immaculate. The bathroom, as everyone mentions, takes some getting used to, but functions well. The rooms are on the small side, but we were sightseeing all day, and just slept in the room. I can't imagine any hotel being more convenient. You can walk to the cathedral, boat trips on the Spree, and museum island. Buses and trains are right outside the door as are two department stores. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sam69
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights as the first part of our trip around northern Germany. If you are flying into Schonefeld airport, it is very easy to get to as the S-Bahn goes directly from Flughafen Schonefeld station to Alexanderplatz station in half an hour. Upon arrival, it was only a five minute walk to the hotel from the station, just going round the huge Galeria Kaufhof shopping centre. Check in was easy and efficient and the hotel in general looked very clean and modern. The rooms were the same. Although they were quite small by comparison to other hotels, they were extremely clean and modern, with satellite tv, a minibar and a safe. The bathroom was open plan, however, with only a curtain covering the washing and bath area, so i'd recommend staying somewhere else if you're not staying with friends or family. The hotel was also linked to the shopping centre, making it very easy to get anything you needed, for example, for breakfast in case like us, you were on a room only basis. The station, being only a stone throw away, meant that you were only ten minutes away from most of Berlin's central tourist sights and a mere five minute walk to the huge 368m televison tower along with Alexanderplatz's bars and restaurants. The casino on the 37th floor requires you to register with your passport and to wear formal clothes (ie. a jacket and tie), but besides that, all the hotel's facilities are fine to use and I hear the breakfst is good too, although for us it was a little too expensive at 16 euros each. Overall, I think it was a hotel of outstanding value, given its cost of 97 euros a night for a double and its very convenient location! I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Colin F
Reviews.Content: Ongoing with my European tour, Park Inn Berlin. I spent 4 nights for 380 euro with my wife and small dog. They didnt charge me for the dog. The staff was excellent and friendly. The room size wasnt bad considering there was another 1000 rooms plus. Very clean and mini bar with normal costs. I was in room 2711. 27th floor. An awesome sight. Had to plug in for internet at 8 euro for 2 hours and 16 for 24 hours. Free breakfast not bad. Excellent location U and S bahn and trains and trams bus etc right outside. Parking right beside the hotel at 15 euro a day. Very busy hotel, great place, great city. Best deal in Berlin! No complaints

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: EireMember
Reviews.Content: A single traveller, I have just spent two nights at this hotel and can recommend it highly for not only its fantastic location next to Alexanderplatz train station (25 minutes from Schoenfeld Airport), the main sites of historical interest in the Mitte district, but also for the views from the hotel bedroom (if you're lucky to be on a higher floor) and in my case a view of the TV Tower and beyond. The reception staff were courteous and helpful. In fact, I found the city to have a friendly and relaxed attitude. The room was clean and comfortable and I liked the all in one bathroom/bedroom layout. City buses no. 100 and 200 provide ideal links to the West-side Ku'Dam and pass many of the important landmarks on their respective routes. You can access the roof of the hotel (a small, railed-off platform), at certain times & weather permitting. It is the equivalent of a 40th floor level and was perfect for panoramic views back over the city. Finally, I did not dine at the hotel as I opted for a room only. However there are plenty of eating places all around Alexanderplatz, not least a cafe/restaurant located in the Galerie Department Store about two minutes away. I recommend this Berlin hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic view”
Reviews.Author: krogh
Reviews.Content: Arrived 0830am but got a room at once. 24th floor with af marvellous view of Berlin. Fancy room with just a curtain to screen the bathroom from the bedroom. I would prefer an oldfashioned wall, but it is seen in more and more hotels with glass and marble. Room was small but ok. Staff was efficient and polite even though they had lots of guests to deal with. Central location with S and U-Bahn on the doorstep and the buses 100 and 200 going to all interesting sights in Berlin. One day travelcard: 6 Euro

Reviews.Title: “Saved by the Park Inn”
Reviews.Author: Spike77
Reviews.Content: We booked into the Park Inn, after our orginally hotel was awful and miles from anywhere (Dormotel, Hoppegarten) , We turned up stressed and upset but were greeted by a friendly smile!! They were able to accommodate us and we checked out of the other horrid hotel!!! They were very busy and had a queue of people at the desk, but remained calm and very helpful, we asked for the highest floor possible and this was granted!! Rooms were very trendy and the views where stunning! All our needs were catered for, we had cocktails in the bar and again all good!! This holiday was a special one for my boyfriend and I and it was saved by THE PARK INN, Thank you! We will be returning very soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Everyone should stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: ClassicBee
Reviews.Content: After reading the trip advisor reviews, and bearing in mind which sights I wanted to see with ease, I decided on the Park Inn, in Alexanderplatz, east Berlin. Getting there very late at night I got a taxi, which wasn't a fortune compared to UK prices. First impressions were, "wow, the tv tower at night next door looks really lovely", but looking at the hotel I thought "am I going to the office"?!! This is because the exterior of the hotel isn't what you would call classy. However, as soon as I stepped inside, I knew I had picked the right place! Very modern, tip top condition, spotlessly clean, and soundproof. Excellent value for money, considering it's location and views, couldn't believe my luck! I asked for the highest floor possible and was very very happy to have been offered a room on the 34th floor which was smack opposite the tv tower - that was it, I was totally mesmerised by that view, I only wish I could have captured that lit-up, night-time view from my room on camera (sigh). Again, the room was spotless, and very swish. As it was just me I didn't mind the wc having just a glass door, in fact I thought it was ultra trendy! The bedding, I just have to tell you, was the most comfortable ever - I cannot describe it, but the material and weight of that duvet was sheer luxury. Each night I slept like a baby! The hotel was brilliantly situated for the olde Jewish quarter, and for tram rides eastbound outside the city, but also what was great, was, right next door to the hotel was a massive C & A dept store - for us from the UK this is a luxury, for there are no more C & A stores in the UK anymore, so I was pleased to have a store on my doorstep! Also, a U-bahn, S-bahn, and a tour bus all there for the asking, just a few feet away, and, a huge dept store adjoining the hotel, with I might add the most amazing range of chocolates! The hotel has a terrace roof which only opens at certain times and under certain weather conditions, but if you ask nicely, someone will let you go up there, on the roof, to take a few photos - incredible to be so high up, from where you can see all of Berlin's major architecture. Decided to eat in the a la carte restaurant on the 2nd floor. Asked for the pork meal, but the staff advised me not to order it, as it wasn't a pork chop, but a whole leg of pork - for one!!!! Ordered another dish, couldn't even eat that there was so much of it, but the desserts well I had to have some of that so I found room! The only criticism I have is the breakfast - it's an average affair. Granted there's lots of choice, but as a Brit I found all the herbs and sausage meats and breads too heavy and spicey/herby first thing in the morning, but it was great to have a whole jug full of coffee on the table so I could drink as much as I liked. I would definitely stay here again and, as one of the previous posters wrote, it's best to ask for a room away from the lifts. By the time I left, I kinda liked the way the exterior looked, and, where-ever I went in east Berlin, I could spot my hotel from afar, even from the plane when it flew over Berlin before hitting the clouds, and just thinking about the Park Inn now makes me smile; I know I'll return there again!

Reviews.Title: “Belfast Ireland”
Reviews.Author: Slatequarry
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day break in Hotel. We had an excellent time - Hotel staff friendly and gave us a Kettle/jug when requested. Room safe did work so Hotel allowed us to use Hotel safe. Economic use of shower/toilet door - one door done both. The staff were very accomodating as we had a late departure and they allowed us use of our room until 3pm. If visiting Berlin would stay here and would recommend to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Shawlands
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend at this great hotel. It is in a fabulous location with Alexanderplatz station opposite. You certainly don't get lost getting off the train from the airport! There are lots of great eateries and pubs in the vicinity. Try the cocktails in AM/PM at happy hour! We didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment on the food there. Our room was on the 30th floor facing the TV tower which had fantastic views. This hotel is certainly value for money and I would thoroughly recommend it to anyone considering a short break in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly....”
Reviews.Author: Carrie-6
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend in Februaury. Fantastic location. Everything within a stones throw of the hotel. The only problem was the smell. Our carpet had been washed and was damp for the whole weekend and they wouldn't change our room for us. It smellt so bad we couldn't stay inside for long, just to sleep and i had to buy air freshener so that it would be bearable. The staff were unfriendly and not willing to help us. Berlin is a fantastic city and the people are so nice, it was a shame that the Park Inn didn't reflect this.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value Hotel in Europe”
Reviews.Author: maggs01
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for long weekend after positive TA reviews - was not disappointed, modern clean room, in fact was upgraded to a suite taking up large corner views of 34th floor. Often travel to Europe with business but never felt the need to add any comments. But on this occasion was very impressed with hotel staffing and location. PS try out the Spanish Tapas bar across the road (Las Olas) on street level do not be deterred by the exterior.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay at the Park Inn”
Reviews.Author: Jubsy007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Inn for three nights over New Year and had a superb time there. When we booked the stay I requested a high room facing the television tower and although they said they could not guarantee it we got a room on the 34th floor with an amazing view. Everything about the hotel was great - the staff was helpful and the location excellent. We paid extra for the business breakfast and it was worth it. The buffet had everything you could think of and it wasn't crowded at all. Thoroughly recommend the Park Inn and will definitely go back to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern room”
Reviews.Author: kauris
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the very modern room, obviously very recently renovated, with all new aminities. Very clean also. I have stayed in 5 star hotels with inferior rooms. Excellent view and good breakfast. The price is excellent considering the very central location and quolity of the room. My room was the last one of the corridor with a view to two directions. Room size was decent.

Reviews.Title: “Free Minibar”
Reviews.Author: KatyFearn
Reviews.Content: Staying in the Park Inn - Alexanderplatz as we speak due to leave tomorrow. Rooms are a tad on the small size but for the price I paid on Last minute.com it was more than sufficient (got 3 nights for the price of 4 and a free minibar, YES A FREE MINIBAR) went up to the 37th floor casino last night (make sure you wear a tie) but quickly left due to not being sure how to play the games but the views are immense. shower and toilet are both cordoned off by the same glass door in the room (so if you dont like the though of hearing your partner in the toilet then find somewhere else just turn the volume up on the telly when they go). Location wise excellent as yoú get the train from the airport and the hotel is just accross the square from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “pretty much ok.”
Reviews.Author: 3Bergen
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in the Park Inn Berlin in January 2007. We've been to Berlin a couple of times before, so we already know a few hotels in the city. Our first choice (schoenhouse appartments) was already booked and since we booked the night before we went most places in the city were booked. This is how we ended up at the park inn. Now the hotel itself is located right on the Alexanderplatz and very near the TV Tower. It's not the most beautiful area of berlin, but you're close to all the public transport, close to Hakkischer Markt (nice area), well you're pretty central in berlin so that's very good! The hotel doesn't look very charming from the outside, but the rooms are pretty good, with (if you're lucky to get a room on a higher floor) great views of the city! The rooms aren't very spacious, but sufficient. I don't think we'll come back to this hotel, but all in all it isn't a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: tahawus
Reviews.Content: Convenient to trams and metro. Near a Tegel TXL bus stop. Excellent breakfast. Shopping mall across the plaza. TV tower minutes away. Clean rooms. Pleasant staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Horrible Guests”
Reviews.Author: BamaDave
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice with views overlooking the city that is absolutely fantastic. The staff is extremely friendly as well as the concierge although it seemed a bit overwhelmed by the Christmas time traffic at the hotel. Berlin is absolutely beautiful at Christmastime and the city is strangely friendly for a large European city. My only complaint about the hotel was not with the hotel itself but the guests it draws. Mostly snobbish overly rude people who have no manners whatsoever. I would gladly stay here again considering the price and location. The amenities were excellent and the bathroom was very nice but.....I wouldn't stay in the same room with someone I didn't want to share a shower with.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Cazni
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location easily accessible by rail from the airport. As said in previous reports the rooms are unconventional in that the shower cubicle is in the middle of the room!!! Do not let this put you off as there is a curtain that can be pulled around for privacy. The rest of the room is modern and clean. On our first night we ate in the hotel restaurant (there are 3 think this one was called Spagos) The food was very good an reasonably priced. The underground network is about a two minute walk from the hotel and trains are frequent taking you all over the city. This hotel is an excellent base for discovering Berlin and I would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: EllaBIreland
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a great location. Bars/Restaurants in walking distance. City Tour bus leaves just across the road. Easy access to Airport and public transport is V Good. Dont be afraid to stay in this hotel for a short break in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Functional and good value”
Reviews.Author: Ane27
Reviews.Content: Big busy hotel in a good location. Rooms are very clean, beds comfortable but towels thin and small. For the rate paid- about 100 euros for superior room incl. breakfast it´s good value. If you prefer personal service or small extras as tea/coffee or complimentary water in the room this is not your hotel. But we liked the stringent service and had a great stay. The food in the beakfast buffet is fine- but the restaurant is very crowded and the waiters wont show you to a table- you will have to find one yourself which can be hard during rush hours. Try the Spagos restaurant/lounge in the lobby- great food/service/interior and not expensive. For other good restaurants take the tram to Hackesher Markt ( five minutes - walk 10 min.) - which is also right next to Oranienburger Strasse where a lot of good restaurants and bars can be found.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch - What a City”
Reviews.Author: Graeme007
Reviews.Content: We booked this Hotel on the back of the reviews from Trip Advisor, I have to say that we were delighted with the hotel, it is located right in the heart of the Mitte district and is only a few stops on the S/U bahn from the main attractions. The rooms were clean & spacious and if you are on one of the higher levels you get a fantastic view of the city. The staff are friendly and very helpful and the breakfast is excellent. I don’t normally write reviews but I felt obliged as the Hotel contributed to one of the best Holidays we have had! Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great views! fairly good location”
Reviews.Author: fuhyong
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in one of the highest building in the vicinity of Alexanderplatz which more or less guarantees an unobstructed view of the neighbourhood plus large bits of Berlin if you stay on a high enough floor. I suppose it depends on facing as well. But if you take the rooms overlooking the platz, you can be assured of an astounding view of the TV tower, Berliner Dom, town hall etc. The rooms we were given initially was on a higher floor (>20th) but the bed was merely a queen size which could not fit in ourselves plus the baby. We asked for a change and was given one on a lower floor (17th) but 2 singles pushed together which gave us a slighter large one. This room however was in the end of the corridor and thus had 2 sets of windows which gave us a wrap around view of the platz and beyond which we were extremely happy with! See attached pics. The outer glass windows was quite grimy unfortunately so the quality of photos taken from the room suffers accordingly. They do however have a viewing gallery from the top of the building but unfortunately it was closed during out time there. Geographically, Alexanderplatz is in the formal Eest Berlin, you can walk to museum island from here and most other places you want to see are but a short tube ride away although you may need to make 2 and sometimes more transfer. People with buggies like us would be pleased to know that most stations in the heavier touristed area has elevators. You will have to navigate stairs in other smaller stations. The room is pretty standard as far as such hotel chains are concerned. Fairly comfortable beds and pillows. Cleanliness was kept to a high standard. Already noted was the clear glass enclosure of the bath/shower/sink area. The WC is kept from view but a frosted glass door. A curtain can be used to wrap around the glass enclosures to hide it from view. I suppose they would have erected dry walls for the more prudish of us but the clear glass is great if you want to luxuriate in the bath and watch TV at the same time! TV by the way was a 20” Loewe LCD panel. English channels are limited to sky news and CNBC. No CNN but I could be wrong there. But I wasn’t in Berlin to watch TV. :) Transport wise, you are right at the doorstep to the U-Bahn and the S-Bahn access is about 200-300 metres away across the platz. Although your transport tickets are good for all transport, the S-Bahn and the U-Bahn are not as geographically intimate as the tube maps will suggest. Transfer between these 2 forms of tranport almost always requires a platform change and sometimes a short walk to transfer from one to the other. We did not take the trams or buses as the tubes will plenty good in getting us to most places we want to get to. We leg it for everything else. As already noted, the room rates through expedia does NOT include breakfast which is levied at an extra 15 Euros per person. In case you are not disinclined to part with such large sums for breakfast, there is a couple of small restaurants and a Burger King just downstairs next to the lobby. There is also a small café in the shopping centre in the building next to the hotel. There is large shopping mall next to the hotel. It may not have the top premium tiers of products (ie Gucci, LV etc) a la KaDeWe, it does stocks a decent range of stuff to assuage all but the highest level of consumerism.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MulberrySt
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a great weekend break in Berlin - lots to see and do. We spent the last evening at the Staatsoper, which was an incredible experience, and one I'm sure we won't forget for quite a while. We stayed for four nights at the Park Inn - Alexanderplatz. It's a very functional hotel - in a perfect location to access all parts of the city, since it is right beside the U- and S-bahn station. This was particularly useful for us, since we arrived late at night. The rooms are pretty unique in design, as other reviewers have mentioned. The sound proofing of the loo is not the best, though, and may ruin many's the friendship! The hotel bar/ restaurant was one of the busiest we've seen in quite a while; lots of people around, plenty of atmosphere. Maybe these two ideas are linked! In general, more than adequate for the price; but I would recommend a rate including breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “East is best?”
Reviews.Author: traveller34
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel even if the bathrooms are, as other people have stated, a little unconventional! The rooms are a good size and comfortable and even though the hotel is huge the lifts seem to be readily available to speed you up and down. Unfortunately you need a shirt and tie to access the Casino on the 37 floor. Breakfast could be enough to see you through the entire day, I've never seen so much choice! The hotel is very close to the U-Bahn and other public transport stops and is on a direct line to Potsdammer Platz with a short walk from there to the Brandenburg Gate, Checkpoint Charlie and the Reichstag etc ( in different directions). All in all a nice play to stay for a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value for money!”
Reviews.Author: eliashan
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located right on Alexanderplatz, East Berlin's main square. Right outside the Hotel there is a Metro and tram stations, and within 1 minute walk one can find bus stations and Berlin's main train station; the location could not be better! The Hotel itself looks very new, modern and luxurious. I have stayed both in a Standard room and a Business-Friendly room, and I can say both were spaceous, modern and well-equipped (Business room even had an LCD-TV). For about 80€ per night, the hotel is excellent value for money, and I will return to it when I visit Berlin again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, shame about the loos”
Reviews.Author: Dukeno1
Reviews.Content: Good location in the old Eastern Germany. Right across from the railway/underground station. The only better location would probably have been nearer to the Brandenberg Gate. However you can get anywhere around the city from here on bus, tram or rail. This is a massive hotel 37 floors. Ask for a high room overlooking Alexanderplatz and you will have a fab view at night of the Berlin landscapte and the incredible TV Tower. Check in was smooth and quick and our request for a high room granted. The rooms were small but very comfortable. However these were let down by the shower and toilet being cubicles in the room itself. The door swung between toilet and shower so you wouldn't want to stay here with someone not particularly close. Breakfast was brilliant and had almost everything, except a toaster. The hotel was immaculately clean and despite being a busy hotel the service was very good. We wouldn't have hestitated to stay again if it wasn't for the toilet setup. Nearby you will see a few cafes, bars and fast food joints and some good restaurants such as a Steak house called Block which served scrumptious steaks. Also plenty of stalls selling Brockwurst etc but unless you are a particular fan of German Sausage i would give them a miss. If you are into shopping there is a fabulous Department store with 6 floors opposite the hotel. All the good designer names and a fabulous foodhall with quality wines at brilliant prices and fabulous chocolate gifts. The hotel also has its own casino and a couple of restaurants which looked good but we didn't try these. One word of warning, make sure you check out on time otherwise you will come back to your room to find your door card won't work. Having said that the hotel couldn't have been nicer about it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a great price”
Reviews.Author: Smilingguest
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in early Sept 2006. Shower/toilet took a while to get used to but no problems. Room was good size, plenty of wardrobe and storage space and cleaned every day to a very high standard. No-one can complain about the breakfast - such a selection and help yourself. At night we tried the €17 dinner buffet - again, great value with polite and efficient service. Lucky to be in Berlin with beer festival in local park. When we came in at nights we went to the casino on the top floor - free entry and great fun if you can stop when ahead! Location is absolutely no problem as beside major transport links - use the 100 and 200 bus as these take you everywhere. Would not hesitate to go again to Berlin and would definitely book the Park Inn.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a monstrosity”
Reviews.Author: swinny_70
Reviews.Content: This is not a bad place to stay, it's very near public transportation and has clean and spacious accomodations. The service staff at the front desk were very helpful. There were a few minor irritations, however. The bizarre shower in our room leaked all over the floor of the toilet and sink area. The television reception seemed to run off of antenna and was subpar. The bar/cafe in the lobby breezeway had free Internet if you were eating or drinking, but they didn't take credit cards or allow charges to the room. What the hell? Who doesn't take credit cards in a major European city in a major hotel anymore? The other complaint is just the sheer size of the hotel and the size of the groups the place attracts. It reminded me of the days of the Hotel Rossiya in Moscow. You'd see 4 tour buses pull up out front and all of the sudden the lobby would be full of 300 new check-ins and you'd have a devil of a time using the elevator or just walking out the door. Also, adjacent Alexanderplatz is undergoing massive construction that has fencing up all over the place. It really makes it a hassle to get in and out of the place.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jodublin
Reviews.Content: Very Modern Hotel opposite the train station. Stayed in the Park Inn in August 2004 and it was fantastic, Fabulous room, a little small . Rooms had been recently renovated to a very high standard, spotlessly clean, towels changed every day. Breakfast is hot and cold buffet. The buffet breakfast has to been seen to be believed, two years later my partner is still taking about it. Staff were extremely friendly and spoke excellent English. Fabulous hotel, very highly recommended. Front entrance right beside Tram stop and back entrance right beside U Bahn station. Bus stops less than five minutes walk across the square, Great location to explore Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: shell40
Reviews.Content: My husband and i have just spent three nights in this hotel. It is ideally situated to see all the main sights as it is right across the street from the train station and under ground, which I must say we found to be brilliant as they all seem to arrive on time. The hotel and the rooms are very clean. The staff are friendly and the concierge are excellent for information about the best way to get to sights. All in all an excellent trip and I would have no hesitation on recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best location in East Berlin”
Reviews.Author: YoSpanish
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in this 4-star-Hotel. We booked it through hotelclub---. It has the perfect location to visit Berlin. Close to Museums (a 10-minute-walk), and to the major sites. It's located in Alexanderplatz which happens to be under construction. It can be a little confusing to find your way into the main entrance..But it's not a problem at all. The room was nice but, as mentioned in other reviews, bathroom facilities are weird..YOU MUST BE FAMILIAR with the person you are sharing the room with..But again not a problem at all. Breakfast buffet was a little crowded at times. Take the hip on/hip off bus. It's 20€ and it's worthy. Also we took a taxi from Tegel airport and it was just 19€.

Reviews.Title: “A good all-rounder - would recommend to all.”
Reviews.Author: Povemeister
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I booked a City Break for two nights at the Park Inn through myvacations for £165 inc flights. We found the hotel easily accesible by train from Schonefeld Airport, it took 21 mins (approx 4 stops) and cost 2.10 euros each for the train ride, payable on the train because we didnt fancy using the ticket machine - which worked to our advantage as there was no inspector at all on the train back to the airport which resluted in a free ride!! As for the hotel, the room was very modern and well equipped (trouser press, tv, computer socket, minibar & fridge, plenty of cupboard space) with excellent views over the Western side of the city, we would of preferred to get a room on the other side of the hotel as this is where all the main sights of Berlin can be seen from, including the Radio Tower which is a breathtaking site! We spent a lot of time in the casino on the top floor which has even better 360 degree views of the city. Drinks were a little on the expensive side, a pint being 5 euros but we cant complain as we did quite well on the Blackjack Table (minimum stake 10 euro). We found the staff to be very professional but not particularly friendly . The hotel was very clean and kept tidy and their was a good choice of food layed out for the inclusive breakfast. The pate was the one item I would say i liked the most. As for the location, well you probably cant pick a better hotel. If you drive you've got access to the major arteries right outside the hotel. Every main historical site is within a good walking distance ie: reichstag, berlin wall, brandenberg gate and all the parks and rivers etc! You've got restaurants and cafes closeby and all the main fast food places are next door at the train station subway, mcdonalds etc. If you like shopping, you could spend half a day in the Galeria department store again about 20 metres from the door of the hotel!! They sell everything from food to tv's and clothes even, good prices too! As mentioned in some of the previous reviews, there was some biulding work going on near the hotel, but caused no problem whatsoever, certainly didnt keep either of us awake, partly because of being so high up i suppose and the beds are very comfy so we had an excellent nights sleep! This was the first time we've done a city break as we usually go for the beach style holidays but i would recommend to anyone reading this who might not be sure to definately try this hotel, you cant go wrong!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: pugsleythedog
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Inn for four nights in May with my husband. Would probably say it is a smart 3* rather than 4*, but we had a very pleasant stay there. The bed was especially comfy and no, it isn't weird to have the two separate mattresses and duvets for a double bed, that's what they're all like in Germany! The toilet and shower had one 'shared' door (in fact we didn't work this one out until 30 mins. before we checked out!! Doh! But the 'open plan' style of the room allows little privacy, so probably best you stay there with someone you're at least vaguely intimate with! Fantastic location, you can virtually roll out the front door and straight into the U-Bahn. Alexanderplatz is also a central station on the S-Bahn line and is direct to and from Schönefeld airport.

Reviews.Title: “I'm still dreaming about their breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: SusieGirl7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Park Inn from July 2nd through the 6th. My father booked this hotel through his travel agent and we paid 109 Euros a night. I think the location of the hotel is absolutely perfect. The S-Bahn and U-Bahn are just a few steps away (you're on the S-Bahn line to Schoenenfeld), as are the 100 & 200 bus lines. If you feel like walking, Unter der Linden is about 10 minutes away. Museum Island is about a 15 minute walk, or just take the bus. And right outside, there is a department store plus several places to eat or grab a snack. We must have paid the business rate because were were entitled to the free fancy breakfast - omg, what a spread. Eggs, sausages, fresh fruit, yogurt, jams, random veggies, muesli, cheeses, meats, all sorts of drinks and more varieties of delicious breads than I have seen in a while. The service was pretty good and I could have stayed there all morning. Seriously, I would go back just for the breakfast. The people at the front desk were polite and helpful. There was some problem with our reservation (I blame the travel agent) but it was quickly resolved and we had rooms next to each other, despite arriving on different dates. Plus, they let me check in at 10am and the check-out went smoothly (we also lets on different dates). FYI - the front desk staff speaks perfect English. We were on the 33rd floor. While our view was not of central Berlin, I still enjoyed looking out at the night lights. The bathroom set-up with the shower/toilet in the room was a bit odd, but the closets were nice and there was plenty of storage space. If the hotel had fluffy towels, I would have given them an "Excellent" rating. I enjoyed the built-in lamps by the bed and the nice comforter. Plus, the cleaning staff folded my pajamas for me. My sense was that the hotel gets lots of large groups, but it also works well for the individual traveler. Of the amenities, I only used the spa. No one was there, so I could play in the showers and saunas to my heart's content. Also, the International calling rates seemed reasonable though I had trouble figuring out how to use the VM and calling out system (probably because my German [-----]).

Reviews.Title: “its not perfect but good (great room)”
Reviews.Author: deemps
Reviews.Content: my room was really nice very new, some people might not like that the toilet and shower as its not very private but the design was very modern and minimal and fittings were high spec the kind you'd be happy with at any 5 star hotel (although the tv was flat screen it was really annoying and kept turning itself off) Ask for a room with a view as the view overing looking the tv tower is really lovely. i was on the 19 floor and it was high enough but my friend who had booked a room at the same time as me and paid the same rate had a bigger different room like a motel room, very dated and not nearly as nice as mine and a bit deressing to be honest (he was on the 29th floor so he had a better view) Also if you have breakfast included in your rate ask for the business breakfast on the 1st floor not the 2nd floor as its much nicer but make sure you get there early before 9am as it still gets crowded and the service is not very good. it seems to be that if you get an orange room key then you can have breakfast on the 1st floor so ask for one of these. its a strange hotel the lobby is not very nice again like a motel and the reception staff are not like in a luxury hotel more like a holiday inn. The restaurant is nice and there was a really sweet waitress that always served us and was very friendly. you have to pay for the internet which is a bit annoying and the towels are small and thin but the location is great you can walk to loads of restaurants and the train station easly and there is a taxi stand right outside. The peope staying here were a wierd mix of oaps, tour groups and tourists its not a trendy boutique hotel at all. One day the lfts broke down and everyone had to walk down the stairs and my other friend that was staying in the 30th floor had to walk down 30 floors and the staff didn't seem particularily apologetic. If you are looking for a good deal, nice room, good location and don't mine sacrificing good service or trendy atmosphere stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Inn Alexanderplatz 24-27 June 2006. We took the Airport Express (train), 2.10 Euros each, direct from Schonefeld airport to Alexanderplatz station - 2 mins walk to hotel. You can see the hotel from the station whilst on the train - the only 37 floor building in the area. Had a room on the 35th floor with breathtaking views of West Berlin. Hotel + room very modern, toilet + shower separated from the bedroom by a frosted glass door - not a problem at all when on holiday with your husband/partner. No noise can be heard whatsoever from outside, the quietest hotel we have ever stayed in. All previous comments about the beds + pillows are true - the most comfy beds we have ever slept in! Had breakfast in Spagos Bar/Restaurant which is a new addition to the hotel on the ground floor of the hotel, 15 Euros each but well worth the money. Not busy at all with plenty of choice: sausages, mushrooms, scrambled egg, grilled tomatoes, cold meats, cheeses, fresh fruit, fruit salad, yoghurts, bread, pastries, tea, coffee, fresh juices. U + S Bahn seconds from rear entrance to hotel which take you all over Berlin. Didn't have time to visit the casino in the hotel or the wellness area, simply too much to do outside of the hotel so cannot comment on these facilities. We highly recommend this hotel and after seeing other hotels whilst wandering around we were glad that we had chosen to stay at the Park Inn. Excellent value for money - try booking a 4* hotel in the UK for £65 per night!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good breakfast,but!”
Reviews.Author: SBlue
Reviews.Content: the room seemed a little too small, especially the shower and w.c. which were merely enclosed within glass panels and the hand wash basin was actualy on view in the room. This said, the quality of the rooms furnishings and the service, surrounds and food seemed to be 4 star standard. ( would have been nice to have a kettle and coffee /tea making facilities inside the room) The location is very good for a tourist needing to see Berlin, for the hotel is in the " more interesting" east and the excellent transport links are within 100m. The price paid was about £70 /night for a double roon B and B, through Last Minute, which seemed to be a good price.....but then the room was not as good as one that I had used during an earlier stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Simon0965
Reviews.Content: Slap bang in the middle of things.Spent 4 nights in Berlin.Excellent breakfasts and the most comfy beds and pillows I have slept on for years.Absolutely nothing wrong with this hotel at all except it would have been lovely to have tea and coffee making facilities in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Not so impressive”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Inn at the end of May 2006 and were less impressed than other reviewers. The area, though convenient to Alexanderplatz railway station, resembled a building site - indeed on one morning we were woken early by the sounds of construction. We had booked (via Expedia) a room on floors 26 - 35, and paid extra for this (£233 for 3 nights) but our reservation did not confirm this in writing and we were assigned to a room on the 14th floor (we were refused an upgrade on the grounds that the hotel was full, which seemed unlikely), so the views were average. We were disappointed that there were no tea or coffee making facilities in the room. The room rate did not include breakfast and we did not try the hotel breakfast, but ate locally instead. The room itself was small but stylish (lots of mirrors, glass, chrome, marble) and comfortable - wonderful beds and cotton bedlinen! Other reviewers mentioned steam-jet showers, but these weren't in our room. Perhaps we expected too much after all the rave reviews...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to Berlin for a long weekend and decided on the Park Inn for 2 reasons. One being price and the other being the location. The bus from Tegel airport cost only €2.10 each and dropped us off approx 50 yards from the door. We were early but were allowed to check in anyway. Once inside the room we were very impressed. We had a corner room on the 27th floor and had a fantastic view (from 2 sides of the room) of the whole city as well as a close up view of the TV Tower! The bathroom was somewhat unusual as it didn't have walls as such, but frosted glass panels! All the usual amenities (toiletries, tea, coffee etc) we included in a very clean and comfortable room. Alexanderplatz is a great location to get around the entire city as well. U Bahn, S Bahn, Trams and buses all run from virtually just outside the hotel entrance. I'm planning to go back to Berlin later in the year and I will definitly stay at the Park Inn again. Thoroughly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, avoid the hotel breakfast”
Reviews.Author: mandy28
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and loved the hotel. Rooms were sufficient and staff very friendly. The breakfast is pricey at 15 Euro per person. I suggest you skip the hotel breakfast and walk across to the new department store "Galleria" - it's literally across the road from the hotel, and you need to walk through it to get to the train station. On the ground floor of "Galleria", there is a complete eating area, which as well as being like a mini-supermarket also has a bakery that has yummy pastries and tea/coffee. Or you could pick up some fresh fruit from the supermarket area. We ate like kings, and spent less than 10 Euro for the 2 of us - much better than the hotel breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and the best location”
Reviews.Author: CSCfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Park Inn Alexanderplatz 20-23 april 2006. We had 3 fantastic nights in the best location. We were upgraded to a suite on the 34th floor - so absolutely no complaints there!! It is a big hotel with more than 1000 rooms and the lobby is really busy with a lot of people. But the check-in and out was quick and very friendly. We were upgraded to a junior suite with the reason that we would have more space (2 adults, 1 child 13 years old) We think the hotel was full, because it was really busy - but we didn´t need a reason for the upgrade ;-) The room was wonderful with king size bed, sofa bed, separate bathroom & toilet, minibar, safe, coffee maker etc. etc. and the view was fantastic. The room was next to the elevator but quiet. The cleaning and service were perfect. We paid only Euro 99 pr. night for this!! Booked through the hotels own website. Note that the internet price is not incl. breakfast. We didn´t try the hotels restaurants but tried the restaurant in connection with the hotel. A good English breakfast for Euro 4,50. Burger King is also there on the ground floor if you need a quick burger. The area around the hotel is really busy with a lot of construction work going on, so if you are looking for a quite area, this is not it. But the location is superb. Alexanderplatz (just 20 min. on the train from Schonenfeld Airport), busses and tram are just outside the hotel. So are the yellow hop-on hop-off busses. If you like to walk it is so close to all the main sites in town. There is a Dunkin´Donuts and Internet cafe very close. We felt safe no matter the time. We could go on and on … we loved the hotel and the busy area where you are close to everything. But if you are looking for a quite area and more intimate hotel choose the west side of Berlin, where we have stayed 2 times before. No matter where you live it is so easy to get around Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for a superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: Baekke
Reviews.Content: Lovely rooms with all you need from minibar to safe. The rainfall shower is the best! Paid €99 per night booked directly through the hotel...great price for the location and room quality! Will highly recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic down duvets”
Reviews.Author: solender
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. Perhaps I was overjoyed because I'd never stayed in such a nice hotel, but everything was great. The room was big & modern, with lots of windows. The beds were very comfortable with super soft down duvets and pillows. The bathroom was very clean & the staff was super quick with bringing you anything i.e. an iron. The room came with a hair dryer, soap, shampoo, a shower cap & shoe polish. The staff was very friendly and helpful. There was a mini bar fridge in the room, which we emptied out (don't eat/drink anything! very expensive!) and put our own food into. There is a supermarket right downstairs underneath the hotel. My only complaints would be that the "double" bed we booked was really 2 twin beds pushed together. Also, don't use the telephone in the room if you can avoid it. The costs are astronomical!! It costs 0.33 euro/min for a local call. I had to call Canada while i was there and it cost 0.94 euro/min!!! There are lots of internet cafes with telephones in Berlin, so use those instead. There was also ALOT, and i mean alot, of construction around the entire hotel, so it was a bit hard to navigate around it. While I loved the hotel, I wouldn't stay in this location in Berlin again. The eastern side of Berlin is quite barren and alienating. I would stay in the western side should I go back.

Reviews.Title: “Centralized location with a view”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week vacation in August 2005. This was my backup hotel since the Swissotel in the trendy Kudamm/West Berlin was booked. The surrounding areas of the hotel are rather dodgy as much of Alexanderplatz is a construction site with graffiti covered walls, and punk anarchist kids hanging around, which oddly adds to the beauty of being in the heart of East Berlin and all of its former Marxist glory. The lobby was being renovated so it wasn't that sexy. The room I was in on the 34th floor had a great view looking west facing the Observation tower, Museum Island, Berliner Dom, Potsdamer Platz, the Reichstag and all the main attractions of Berlin - feel sorry for those who have to look out towards the East. The room itself was small yet clean. Theres a little fridge with snacks and drinks in it which is nice. The bed was comfortable. The shower and toilet are kind of in the open to the room. Don't get too crazy splashing water around because the shower has a tendency to leak. The on-site restaurant had good breakfasts, dinners were rather bland. The concierge was very helpful in giving directions and suggestions. There's a Burger King on the ground floor if you wanted to grab something quick to bring back to the room. Theres a internet cafe connected to a Dunkin Donuts on the otherside of the Alexanderplatz station opposite the tower. The s-bahn and u-bahn station is probably the biggest plus because its right outside the hotel. Another big plus was going out at night to restaurants, pubs, and bars and EASILY finding where I had to go back to since the observation tower is visible everywhere in the city. Otherwise my stay at the Park Inn was not that bad, if you want luxury yeah that Swissotel would have been better, but this hotel's strongest point is convenience.

Reviews.Title: “modern hotel in convienient location”
Reviews.Author: latte_fan
Reviews.Content: Park-inn is located on Alexanderplatz, in the former East Berlin, steps from the U-bahn and S-bahn station. The hotel has a modern feel with comfortable furnishings. A lot of the reviewers have mentioned the en suite facilities being strange but I had no problems with the functionality or design concept. The beds are very comfortable with plush down filled comfortors. The staff are a HUGE asset to the Park-inn, especially the concierge service. Everyone from reception to house keeping was helpful and knowledgeable. The hotel has Wi-Fi access in the common areas and on every other floor, floors without wi-fi have ethernet ports for connecting to the internet. However the hotel's intenet access is a little pricey at 18 euro per day. The breakfast buffet was 12 euro and featured a lot of options from fried tomatoes to ceral -- something for every taste.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Inkypinky
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Park Inn because of its location and it was perfect. We checked in earlier than the usual check in time and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was on the 30th floor, giving great views of the TV tower and the centre of Berlin. Other reviewers have mentioned the 'different' bathroom, it wasn't a problem for us: we just turned up the TV! The location was great for access to Schonefeld airport (25 mins by S-bahn with a train running every 30 mins) and for the city centre by U-bahn, although you could easily walk there. The U2 line takes quite a long route around the city so it's better to walk to Stadmitte, enjoy the scenery and join the metro from there. The breakfast at the hotel was 15 euros which we found a little steep so I would recommend going to the Alex cafe/bar at the base of the TV Tower where for 5 euros you can have their huge buffet breakfast, served until midday. I would also recommend the Discover Berlin Walking tour which starts at 10.30am outside the Haagen Dazs at the next station along beginning with H Markt. Sorry, I cannot remember the name!! You can just turn up and pay 10 euros for a fantastic four-hour tour of Berlin. I think the hotel is great: great location, great views and great staff and would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: SwissMrs.
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Inn for three nights on the 34th floor and were very happy with the accomodation and service for the price.
