Comfortable beds, great view (as good as the TV tower and free), super convenient. You can walk to many of the main attractions and there's an S-bahn / U-bahn / overland train station just steps from the hotel (Alexanderplatz). Transport-wise, you couldn't do better. We opted not to pay 15 euros for breakfast, bought pastries at the station instead. Would not recommend this hotel if you are travelling with someone you're not intimate with. Toilet and shower separated by a lightly-frosted glass barrier that does not reach ceiling or floor. In short, there is no visual or auditory privacy... Lots of construction in the area right now, but noise was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed my expectations”
Reviews.Author: z28r4cer
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Park Inn for 3 nights and I was impressed with the hotel. The staff spoke English well and were courteous and helpful. The room had a beautiful view, and I found it had enough space to be comfortable, and was decorated very tastefully. The best part of the hotel is its central location in Alex. The underground station is just a few yards from the hotel entrance and you can easily get about to where ever you need. It is also an easy walk to Unter den Linten. Also something useful to know is a taxi ride from the hotel to Tegel airport is around 20 euros, I paid 17.50 I think. Also good to know is there is a Burger King attatched to the lobby. Yes, as others have stated, their is a lot of construction around the hotel but it's easy to ignore and I felt completely safe walking in the area at all times. WiFi access was available through a Tmobile hotspot, but is a bit pricey at 18 euros for 24 hours. Both my girlfriend and I agreed we would stay at the Park Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Faye1980
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Park Inn from Feb 18th for four days and thought the room, service and location was excellent. We obtained flight for only £23 each with Easy Jet so equally wanted a cheap hotel. We found this hotel on Expedia for one night free so it cost us only £109 for three nights (total price). The hotel was huge but this did not mean the service was bad (as with many big hotels). The reception staff were friendly and even though I tried my best German they were all more than happy to speak in English. Our room was lovely. Big double bed, great view, mini bar, trouser press and you could also phone for an iron when ever you needed one. If you have read other peoples comments on the shower and toilet - don't worry its not as bad as people have made out. The shower is literally a glass section in the corner of the room however their is privacy because it is frosted and by the time the hot water gets going your partner or friend can't see you anyway! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. This was our first time to Germany and we are going back in April but this time to Munich, I hope our hotel there is just as good as this one. Ignore the review in the Time Out Book - we take time out everywhere but the comment on this hotel is wrong I'm afraid it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: mazztravel
Reviews.Content: I was a little dubious about this hotel after reading some of the reviews but I took a chance due to our flight getting in a little late. It is an ideally located hotel as we got off great airport express to Alexanderplatz, came out the station at the foot of the hotel. Reception staff smiley and helpfull, okay the room was small but spotless, well comfy beds, great view across berlin and breakfast well and truly fed us. For £168 quid two adults three nights B and B you cannot be robbed! I saw the other hotels as we went on an excellent Bike tour with fat tire bike tours an excellent way to see the sights and meet new people, the other hotels not wanting to dis them looked very run down and trading on a name ie hilton and raddison! overall a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel / Great Price”
Reviews.Author: AlecCampbell
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend spent at this hotel adn have to say that I was very impressed. Easy to get to via the Airport Express train and the hotel is position right by the exit at Alexanderplatz so easy to find. Rooms are bright and light and beds are extremely comfortable. Glass shower and toilet cubicles take a bit of getting used to though. Hotel doesn't have many leisure facilities but sauna complex is nice and new (as is the feeling throughout the entire hotel). Staff were friendly and helpful (their displayed motto "please wait for the next smile" is very apt). Location of the hotel makes it idea for sightseeing and connections across berlin using the underground are frequent, punctual, and cheap (max 2 Euro 10cents ticket each way or day tickets are great VFM. All in all an enjoyable stay and don't think it can be beaten for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, excellent operating base for exploring Berlin”
Reviews.Author: casper53
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very strategic location, Alexander Platz is a central hub of the Berlin public transport network. From Tegel Airport, bus TXL (every 10 minutes) takes you straight to the hotel. The hotel is easy to spot being one of the tallest buildings around. Ok, Alexander Platz is undergoing a major reconstruction but that is to be expected as Berlin is one big building site at the moment. The view from our room (26th floor) was spectacular. We could see most of the historic landmarks. The room was clean and modern. Just make sure you go with someone you know well as the bathrooms are not particularly private with all that glass!! The staff in the hotel were friendly and helpful. Excellent breakfast buffet. Evening meals are good, and not overly priced. The hotel's sauna (costs 5 Euro) is well designed with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “weekend away”
Reviews.Author: SallyCumbria
Reviews.Content: Booked a birthday weekend away for my other half at the Park Inn. First time in Berlin for us. Flew by Easijet and then took the Airport Express train to Alexanderplatz. The hotel was easy to spot being one of the tallest buildings around. Ok, Berlin is a building site at the moment but that is to be expected. The view from our room (23rd floor) was spectacular. We could see most of the historic landmarks. The room was clean and modern. The staff in the hotel were friendly, helpful and mostly local. This hotel is so central to all the historic sites. The TV tower is a must (just have lunch in the revolving restaurant). Most sites are witin walking distance. The Berliners were polite, friendly and accommodating. Even the young youths at the railway station (who were wearing hooded tops!) were most helpful in giving us directions!! I will definitely go back. Just make sure you go with someone you know well as the bathrooms are not particularly private with all that glass!! We had a 25 hr delay on the journey home but we met some fantastic people and turned it into a positive experience!!

Reviews.Title: “A disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: gojoyce
Reviews.Content: I booked a city break through Brendan Vacations and was placed at the Park Inn. I was very disappointed in the area as of November 2005. The building was surrounded on three sides by construction and graffitti were plentiful. Some of the buildings across the street from the hotel looked like housing projects. The area is one of urban blight. Even a city guide book concedes that the square in "in redevelopment." At present, this poorly lit area isn't safe for a single woman. There were few places to go in the evening. The money spent on taxis could have purchased a room at the beautiful Radisson SAS, which is down the street but out of the Park Place square. Brendan was of no help in offering candid information on the area or in arranging for an alternative location. I would not recommend this hotel. The lobby is full of smoke. Moreover, there was only one computer in the "business center," which I had to clean with wet wipes myself. The television featured promotions of pornography, which I had no interest in seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Best/Most Covenient Place To Stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: britne
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 5 day stay in Berlin which we spent at the Park Inn.The hotel is a huge 37 storey high building(casino on 37th floor).My wife and i found it to be just perfect for exploring the city and easily walked from Alexanderplatz to the Brandenburg Gate/Reichstag/Freidrichstrasse and Unten Den Linden.If walking isnt your thing public transport is both cheap and convenient in the city whether it be bus U-Bahn or S-Bahn.The Hotel itself we found to be very good with friendly staff and an excellent concierge.The rooms (we where on 35th floor) are very nice with excellent views out over the city. The way the rooms are laid out is unusual as the shower and toilet whilst ensuite are housed in a wet area near the door to the room and screened off with tasteful glass partitions.Very good use of space in fact.You have all the usual things in your room including a mini bar(prices the same as hotel bar prices).On the third floor of the hotel is an excellent sauna and fitness centre(costs 5 euros).The hotel restaurant is on 2nd floor and you can choose to eat either a la carte or better yet in our experience go for the buffet which is excellent value at 17 euros per person for a 3 course meal (all you can eat).At the moment the hotel has a lot of building work going on outside it(new shopping complex being built between it and the railway station).the hotel itself is also having an exterior facelift to an all smoked glass exterior.Whilst this may sound a lot to put up with it wasnt.We werent disturbed by any noise during our stay at all.All in all we would heartily recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “When in Berlin chose the Park Inn, it's so easy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having flown into Schonefeld as a Berlin virgin with easyJet I was concerned as to whether the Park Inn was the right location. My fears evaporated when I stepped off the s-bahn after the 30 minute journey from the airport. The hotel is the perfect location for travellers new to the city or there for a long weekend. The staff are friendly and rooms clean and functional. A hearty breakfast sets you up for a day of trips. Our room on the 26th floor looked west across the city with views of the "tooth pick", Mitte, Reichstag and Sony Center. The hotel is within easy reach of Museum island and Mitte and we meandered to the Brandenburg Gate within 45 minutes. The bars and cafe/restaurants at Hackescher Markt are no distance and well recommended. All in all we had nothing bad to say about this hotel or its location. Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pollygw
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Inn for 5 days in August 2005. Great hotel, excellent breakfast with anything you could want. Good buffet evening meal too, everything you can eat at 17 euros- but would also recommend the Alex restaurant just adjacent to rear entrance of hotel - good food and friendly staff, we got 25% discount on our third dinner there. Reception staff were fine, bar staff very friendly, and also shop staff - they made a special effort to get the English version of the Berlin 1939-45 tour book I asked for by the next day. Room (on 15th floor) was OK - a bit small but with comfortable beds. Strange though to have bath/shower/washbasin with just a curtain round them, toilet was separate with a proper door. A lot of building work in the area, but we were not disturbed by any noise. And we had a fantastic view of Berlin! Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jojo2005
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Berlin. The Park Inn Alexander Platz is a great hotel. The room was large, we had a great view from the 30th floor. The shower is amazing. The only downer is the location, lets face it, Alexander Platz had seen better days and better crowd. I would definetively go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Newly remodeled. Easy location to find. Very close proximity to the subway and the historical downtown of Berlin. Great buffet style restaurant located within the hotel with lots of food to choose from. Ask for a room up high facing the west - it will be worth the view.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: rockchick22
Reviews.Content: Easy to find ...didn't need a map. Rooms basic and clean. Staff friendly and helpful. Went sightseeing and there was no way you could get lost. Would definately use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't need a map to find it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed there as part of a group of 21 blokes on a stag trip. Very convenient location to explore the eastern side of the city. Rooms are functional and business-like, with amazing views over the city (I was on the 16th foor). Breakfast was typical European fare; not the best I've experienced because of the vast numbers of people the hotel caters for, but a good range and perfectly adequate enough to start the day. Thoroughly recommend it for large groups needing a city base because of its 24hr access. The best feature was the fact that wherever you are in Berlin you can see the hotel; especially important at the end of a big night out!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Floski
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed in. Spacious rooms with comfortable beds. So convenient to restaurants, shops, and mass transit. If I make it back to Berlin, I will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: peterhouse
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Park Inn during February 2005, had a fantastic time. Hotel room was really nice it was on the 31st floor with incredible views, its also in a great position within walking distance of Brandenburg gate, Checkpoint Charlie etc. Berlin is an amazing city, covered in snow when we were there, lots to see and do. Would have no hesitation in staying at the Park Inn if I were to return to Berlin.

HotelInfo.Name: Park Inn by Radisson Berlin Alexanderplatz
HotelInfo.Address: Alexanderplatz 7, 10178 Berlin, Germany
